preview: Netflix are one of the worst companies I've dealt with, they took a payment without warning. When I've asked for a refund as I'm sure I cancelled, they've told me it'll take up to 30 days and there's nothing else that can be done. When I said to the cust
review: Netflix are one of the worst companies I've dealt with, they took a payment without warning. When I've asked for a refund as I'm sure I cancelled, they've told me it'll take up to 30 days and there's nothing else that can be done. When I said to the customer support that they should send an email before they take payments to check with people if they want to proceed with membership as this has happened before they just terminated my live chat. Won't ever recommend and I won't use again. Aside from that their platform just isn't worth 7.99 a month in the UK, a lot of the shows they produce are boring and the Americans get a lot bang for their buck.

preview: I try to be conscious-minded about where/what businesses I give my money to. Since I don't do cable (too many useless channels), I thought I'd try out Netflix, specifically for Supernatural shows. But now that I hear Netflix plans on pulling investments
review: I try to be conscious-minded about where/what businesses I give my money to. Since I don't do cable (too many useless channels), I thought I'd try out Netflix, specifically for Supernatural shows. But now that I hear Netflix plans on pulling investments from Georgia because they passed the HEARTBEAT bill, I plan on cancelling my subscription. I do not want to be involved with any company that throw their support to places that kill unborn babies! My mom and uncle were preemie babies and they survived and thrived being born so early, even though my mom had polio. I will not support anyone who could be so cruel to another human being whether they have good programming or not!

preview: I rented a lot of movies and my husband took our movies back and before if we forgot the movie in the case it would kick the case out. We forgot a movie, I found it in the DVD player and I ask my husband and he said he took it back. I ask him how do we r
review: I rented a lot of movies and my husband took our movies back and before if we forgot the movie in the case it would kick the case out. We forgot a movie, I found it in the DVD player and I ask my husband and he said he took it back. I ask him how do we return this movie? We called Netflix to find out and we couldn't get through. And a week later we are paying 35 dollars and no one to call. I will never rent from Netflix again.

preview: I just had the worst experience with Netflix ever! I have not been able to get Netflix to work on my TV for approximately two weeks now. I finally had a day off and figured I would dig into it further. I contacted Netflix after doing all the troubleshoot
review:
I just had the worst experience with Netflix ever! I have not been able to get Netflix to work on my TV for approximately two weeks now. I finally had a day off and figured I would dig into it further. I contacted Netflix after doing all the troubleshooting steps that I already know of and was told that it was a compatibility issue between my TV and Netflix. Netflix comes pre-loaded on my TV. I have not used my Netflix since May 22nd. Today is now June 3rd. After going through the painstaking troubleshooting steps again with the rep he tells me there's nothing that they can do and they have no nut estimated time of resolution. I asked the question why should I pay for something that I can't use? He told me I can use other devices. I told him that does not help me with my living room TV. I stated they should offer me some compensation since they have no estimated time of resolution. He stated not in their policy to do so.
Read full review

preview: There is lots to like about Netflix, and the facility to download for offline viewing was a great step forward. It works well on IOS and Android but is a disaster on the Windows Platform with U7353-5101 errors. All attempts to resolve seems to just resul
review: There is lots to like about Netflix, and the facility to download for offline viewing was a great step forward. It works well on IOS and Android but is a disaster on the Windows Platform with U7353-5101 errors. All attempts to resolve seems to just result in mutual "finger pointing" between the two companies which is no use at all to the customer. PLEASE NETFLIX/MICROSOFT DO IT RIGHT OR GET RID OF IT!!

preview: I had Netflix for about six months. It didn't take long to run out of things worth watching. Until there were only the lame yuppie sitcoms left to watch. And I hate those. So I cancelled Netflix. Six months later I decided to go online and see what Netfl
review: I had Netflix for about six months. It didn't take long to run out of things worth watching. Until there were only the lame yuppie sitcoms left to watch. And I hate those. So I cancelled Netflix. Six months later I decided to go online and see what Netflix is showing now. And it's the same worn out list of movies and TV shows that they had when I left. Absolutely nothing has been updated. If I wanted to pay for things I don't want to watch, I would just get cable or a satellite TV. Amazon and Hulu have the same problem as well. Hulu is still showing TV shows that they had from back when they were a free service. Terrible.

preview: I have been watching Netflix for quite a few years now. I used to like it because I could almost always find the movies or TV show I was looking for. It seemed like they had everything. And they were really great when my account got hacked and put an end
review:
I have been watching Netflix for quite a few years now. I used to like it because I could almost always find the movies or TV show I was looking for. It seemed like they had everything. And they were really great when my account got hacked and put an end to it right away. But all that has ended. Now, it's completely changed. They're more focused on making their own movies, and often they just don't seem to care about the quality or appropriateness of those movies.
Read full review

review: I have been a customer for over 5 years now. This company is terrible! You're going to suspend service because I can't make a payment on my account 1 day from now!!!! What the heck! This is ridiculous, I'd rather go to Hulu and Vudu. You also have terrible customer service. I will NEVER return to Netflix, you lost a good, loyal customer.

preview: We had moved over 6 months ago and forgot to cancel our account. When I realized it I called to cancel with their customer service. First I was irritated that they made me give them all my bank info so to "verify" it, then I was handed over to a supervis
review: We had moved over 6 months ago and forgot to cancel our account. When I realized it I called to cancel with their customer service. First I was irritated that they made me give them all my bank info so to "verify" it, then I was handed over to a supervisor who said not to pay attention to the recording that I had to listen to in order to get my cancellation confirmation code, and I had to agree to it. The recording had me agreeing to another charge and possibly an ongoing charges. I would not agree and the service rep stated that I had to and then assured me I would have no other charges but needed to pay this one time privacy protection fee. We had thought about ordering Netflix for our current residence but I will never order ever it again, the whole experience was very unethical. I was force to say yes to this recording and they would not put me through to a higher authority.

preview: We inadvertently sent back our own personal DVD instead of the DVD we had rented. Before I noticed the mistake, I received an email stating that the correct DVD had been received. Later, I realized that I had actually sent one of my own and I proceeded t
review:
We inadvertently sent back our own personal DVD instead of the DVD we had rented. Before I noticed the mistake, I received an email stating that the correct DVD had been received. Later, I realized that I had actually sent one of my own and I proceeded to contact Netflix by phone; they explained that they would return my personal DVD two weeks after they received. Four weeks later, we had still received the DVD. After speaking with them again, they told me that they were unable to locate my DVD. While waiting for the return of my DVD, I had returned the correct DVD to them by placing two DVDs in the same envelope.
Read full review

preview: Just received an email stating I was eligible for a free 1 month trial. I had a Netflix account last year and thought I’d give it a try again. Clicked on the red free trial box and I had to use PayPal to get signed up. I was immediately charged for a mon
review: Just received an email stating I was eligible for a free 1 month trial. I had a Netflix account last year and thought I’d give it a try again. Clicked on the red free trial box and I had to use PayPal to get signed up. I was immediately charged for a month. When I called the help line and reviewed the email, it said If you have had a Netflix account in the last year you would not be eligible for the free month! Talk about bait and switch! Why are they sending me an email to stating I’m eligible for a free month if I’m not. The help line person made all kinds of excuses, saying they are randomly sent by a computer. Really? But I guess it would be to difficult to program the computer to send these emails only to people who are eligible for the free trial to begin with.

preview: Netflix's blu-ray DVDs are very low quality. Their disc got stuck in my Oppo player, cracked/broke and broke my player. My player cannot read any disc and is responding with Unknown disc. Oppo service told me that Netflix's disc ruined a laser lens. A re
review: Netflix's blu-ray DVDs are very low quality. Their disc got stuck in my Oppo player, cracked/broke and broke my player. My player cannot read any disc and is responding with Unknown disc. Oppo service told me that Netflix's disc ruined a laser lens. A repair will cost me $99.00 + shipping. Netflix does not want to take any responsibility for the damage. Actually, their customer service told me because I put their disc in the player that it is my fault. Where is a logic? Based on this terrible experience our whole family is cancelling their streaming service and getting it from HULU.

preview: My service recently kept changing to Spanish including my emails. When I called I could barely understand what the representative was saying. I asked what country she was in and she said Asia (which is not a country). After I gave her my email and confir
review:
My service recently kept changing to Spanish including my emails. When I called I could barely understand what the representative was saying. I asked what country she was in and she said Asia (which is not a country). After I gave her my email and confirming my devices used, she then asked for my telephone number. I gave her my number and she said that was not the number on the account. I asked her what number was listed and she said she couldn’t tell me for security reasons. Then she wanted the last 8 digits of my credit card. I asked why she needed more sensitive information and she said it was for security. I told her that I have the right to know what number is on the account and she still refused. I asked for the last four numbers of the phone number if she was worried I would call someone. She still refused insisting on the last 8 of my credit card.
Read full review

preview: We have been Netflix customers since 2005. Initially for DVDs and more recently for streaming, and adding roughly over $2000 to Netflix profitability, helping make them one of the big guys (FAANG). Well, NOT ANY LONGER. Netflix has become too big and pro
review: We have been Netflix customers since 2005. Initially for DVDs and more recently for streaming, and adding roughly over $2000 to Netflix profitability, helping make them one of the big guys (FAANG). Well, NOT ANY LONGER. Netflix has become too big and proves once again how power corrupts. Netflix used to provide a very good and diverse service. They should have stayed with that model! They now present their users with how to think (politically), which means they are not to be trusted as a service or with our personal data. They put politicians on their board, cater to one-sided political productions, and sensor out diverse productions that are not to their liking. I will be canceling our Netflix service today, and thank ConsumerAffairs for this opportunity to voice my dissatisfaction with Netflix. P.S. I am adding ConsumerAffairs to my website. Thanks again.

preview: I recently had a problem with the netflix app, I download content and view it offline because data is expensive in south Africa, after finishing the downloads I switch off my internet access and log on the app but it shows me the view more episodes optio
review: I recently had a problem with the netflix app, I download content and view it offline because data is expensive in south Africa, after finishing the downloads I switch off my internet access and log on the app but it shows me the view more episodes option and all the downloads I've made are hidden. Now I call an agent to assist me with this matter but he tells me all these options and all dont work but at the end he tells me to download them again, like seriously use my data again to download content which I've downloaded? I'm very upset as I trusted this company.

preview: Netflix was my favorite streaming website for years. It offers a wide selection of tv shows and movies and the layout felt easier to use that others like Amazon Prime or Hulu. It always had something for me to watch and I could usually find the shows I l
review:
Netflix was my favorite streaming website for years. It offers a wide selection of tv shows and movies and the layout felt easier to use that others like Amazon Prime or Hulu. It always had something for me to watch and I could usually find the shows I loved on it. For a while, it was improving. More shows. Better shows. Shows from all over the world. More language options. More anime even, a guilty pleasure of mine. As of the past year, it's gone downhill though. They've upped the price while removing a lot of my favorite shows. What used to be the place where I could catch up on shows I loved and rewatch old favorites or binge new series, has become a place of frustration as they literally remove shows while I'm in the middle of watching them. And there isn't even a warning! Many shows like Switched at Birth, Being Human, and so many more have been removed.
Read full review

preview: I love Netflix and all the choices you get on it but recently Netflix have been cancelling series, which is leaving the series on cliff hangers so you never find out the end. This has now happened with ten different series I started watching.
review: I love Netflix and all the choices you get on it but recently Netflix have been cancelling series, which is leaving the series on cliff hangers so you never find out the end. This has now happened with ten different series I started watching.

preview: I have been a member of Netflix since getting DVDs in the mail. I have canceled my subscription. Netflix, because there are more views and also 2 other parties here in America. I wish you had at least some conservative points of views. Not liberally bias
review: I have been a member of Netflix since getting DVDs in the mail. I have canceled my subscription. Netflix, because there are more views and also 2 other parties here in America. I wish you had at least some conservative points of views. Not liberally biased and leaning far left. I feel like you are going to even further brainwash the young millennials with flights of fancy, of a perfect world.

preview: I had an account in Netflix, with my credit card. Then my father decided to start paying himself instead of me, so he made another account with his credit card. So I cancelled mine. After a while I noticed that I am still paying for Netflix! Apparently t
review: I had an account in Netflix, with my credit card. Then my father decided to start paying himself instead of me, so he made another account with his credit card. So I cancelled mine. After a while I noticed that I am still paying for Netflix! Apparently there was a sign in to the older account because it never WARNs you if you are going to reactivate, you don't notice that you're signing in to the older account, then it automatically reactivate the account and you will start paying again!!!! I had to pay for almost a year for the account, then I cancelled. Then again it happened (probably from another user), then I cancelled, then again it happened!!! I contacted Netflix, AND THEY REFUSED TO REFUND THIS PERIOD!!! Shame on a big company like Netflix to steal money in this way.

preview: The biggest problem with Netflix service is that each movie has its license and expire date. Lately I've seen movies, and shows I love go, replaced by cheap, American productions. I don't say all of them are bad, but the most is just time-killer, even, t
review: The biggest problem with Netflix service is that each movie has its license and expire date. Lately I've seen movies, and shows I love go, replaced by cheap, American productions. I don't say all of them are bad, but the most is just time-killer, even, though Netflix service is not for free. That's sad like, the positions on Netflix library are given us based on their popularity or price of the license and that's pointless to look for underground movies, less popular or just the older ones. Love Netflix, but still it's not a nice thing when for example "Cloud Atlas" is being replaced by "The Perfect Date".

preview: I recently found out that I was being double billed for Netflix services and not a single representative nor manager did anything to RESOLVE the issue. I basically begged for help in resolving this matter and no steps were taken let alone offered. I am s
review:
I recently found out that I was being double billed for Netflix services and not a single representative nor manager did anything to RESOLVE the issue. I basically begged for help in resolving this matter and no steps were taken let alone offered. I am still stuck with this bill. If you're looking for good customer skills...this is not the place to give it to you. I had a manager tell me that no matter what the situation... they don’t do refunds & there’s no need to further discuss the issue.
Read full review

preview: Hi, I am writing this review because I was amazed at the support I just received from Netflix's customer service. I'm just a college student, and I never normally write reviews. I wasn't paid to write this review at all. So I received an email from Netfl
review:
Hi, I am writing this review because I was amazed at the support I just received from Netflix's customer service. I'm just a college student, and I never normally write reviews. I wasn't paid to write this review at all. So I received an email from Netflix saying that my account was accessed from Westminster, United Kingdom (I lived in the US). Then, an email saying my password has changed. Finally, that my email associated to the account was updated to a different email. Immediately, I knew my account was hacked.
Read full review

preview: I have been charged double each month since November 27, 2017 - 17 months worth! Apparently someone there didn't close out my old email and that account remained opened being used. My daughter and I share an account which was under my email address. I as
review: I have been charged double each month since November 27, 2017 - 17 months worth! Apparently someone there didn't close out my old email and that account remained opened being used. My daughter and I share an account which was under my email address. I asked to be reimbursed the $135.83 that was deducted from my banking account over a 17 month period @ $7.99. They refused to refund any of the charges. I'll find a different company to go through from here on out! Plus their customer service is terrible!

preview: Same thing happened to me as happened to Yanet of Lakeland and the reason I looked up review sites to see if similar had happened elsewhere. Same reaction as well. Customer service completely nonplussed about the fact that the account had been compromise
review: Same thing happened to me as happened to Yanet of Lakeland and the reason I looked up review sites to see if similar had happened elsewhere. Same reaction as well. Customer service completely nonplussed about the fact that the account had been compromised, account re-activated using stored card details and the same request for the last 8 numbers on the card which I didn't have to hand. I did point out to the lady that she seemed entirely relaxed about the whole thing and knew straight away the procedure to correct this indicating to me that this is happening a lot. Certainly won't be using Netflix again.

preview: If I could give a 0 I will. This morning I found out that my account was compromised, I immediately called customer service, for my surprise no sense of urgency at all. They wanted me to confirm the last 8 numbers of the credit card on file, after a mill
review: If I could give a 0 I will. This morning I found out that my account was compromised, I immediately called customer service, for my surprise no sense of urgency at all. They wanted me to confirm the last 8 numbers of the credit card on file, after a million time explaining that I was working and did not have that information available, a supervisor said that is nothing that they can do. Extremely disappointed because they can't do anything but a fraudster can go into my account and change everything - my email, phone number, all my info and they don't care. Worst company and customer service ever and your information can get easily compromise. Don't get the service before you regret it like I did today.

preview: Frequent streaming interruptions + cheap series B movies. It happens too often that viewing of content is interrupted without reason and we need to reboot. In addition movies offered generally are cheap low quality movies.
review: Frequent streaming interruptions + cheap series B movies. It happens too often that viewing of content is interrupted without reason and we need to reboot. In addition movies offered generally are cheap low quality movies.

preview: Please stop removing good shows and replacing them with bad ones. Especially your own originals. The first one that should be fixed specifically is Daredevil. It's actually helping people forget about the horrible way Matt Murdock was portrayed in 2003 b
review: Please stop removing good shows and replacing them with bad ones. Especially your own originals. The first one that should be fixed specifically is Daredevil. It's actually helping people forget about the horrible way Matt Murdock was portrayed in 2003 by the horrible actor: Ben Affleck. The storyline is actually right and it beats most of your other originals. I used to love Netflix, but over the years I can't find anything to watch anymore. Even out of your thousands of shows and movies. I just watch the same ones over and over again.

preview: On three separate Netflix accounts, I have noticed that the prompt for "are you still watching?" comes up more frequently. Twice in under an hour every time. They are probably saving bandwidth. I appreciate that there are no commercials on Netflix. That
review: On three separate Netflix accounts, I have noticed that the prompt for "are you still watching?" comes up more frequently. Twice in under an hour every time. They are probably saving bandwidth. I appreciate that there are no commercials on Netflix. That beats Hulu.

preview: I have been a customer of Netflix almost since day one. At first they had a variety of movies to search from now they have this system where they Make You Chose from their on archive of movies. None of these movies are chosen by my likes or dislikes it’s
review:
I have been a customer of Netflix almost since day one. At first they had a variety of movies to search from now they have this system where they Make You Chose from their on archive of movies. None of these movies are chosen by my likes or dislikes it’s just a catalog of movies that don’t interest me at all. Not only that they raise the price this year and most of the new movies they have came out with for Netflix are trash “Black Summer” is one, O^ is another and a slew of foreign films that might be interesting but who has the time or patience for them.

preview: When I signed up for their free trial, they said they would send a reminder before the free trial period ends. But I never got a reminder and got charged for two months of membership. I contacted the customer service, but they were not able to give me a
review: When I signed up for their free trial, they said they would send a reminder before the free trial period ends. But I never got a reminder and got charged for two months of membership. I contacted the customer service, but they were not able to give me a refund. She said they don't do refunds anymore. I would have not signed up for the free trial if I knew I would not get a reminder since I tend to miss the deadline for cancelling things. Very disappointed for such a big company.

preview: I don't have a Netflix account. That, however, hasn't stopped someone from using my bank details to pay for their own access to Netflix services for the past two months -- as I've just discovered. Thankfully, my card hasn't been used for any other illici
review: I don't have a Netflix account. That, however, hasn't stopped someone from using my bank details to pay for their own access to Netflix services for the past two months -- as I've just discovered. Thankfully, my card hasn't been used for any other illicit purchases, so this is purely a Netflix-related problem. However, that didn't stop the Netflix representative I spoke to from blaming me for being careless with my card (even though, as I pointed out to her, it hasn't been used for anything else, so it's clearly not identity theft). She'll now block my card from being used to make any more payments, which means -- she told me -- I can't set up a Netflix account myself using that card. Frankly, with that level of service and responsibility, I wouldn't want to.

preview: Netflix is purchasing awful computer generated special effect DVD movies from Chinese filmmakers. Air Strike is a great example of the cheap stuff that is being offered as current movies. Bruce Willis should be ashamed of himself.
review: Netflix is purchasing awful computer generated special effect DVD movies from Chinese filmmakers. Air Strike is a great example of the cheap stuff that is being offered as current movies. Bruce Willis should be ashamed of himself.

preview: When you want to browse for movies, you can basically choose a grown up profile or child's profile. Neither of which has proper filters so that you can browse what you actually maybe want to see without either getting a horrible sex/violence/profane clip
review: When you want to browse for movies, you can basically choose a grown up profile or child's profile. Neither of which has proper filters so that you can browse what you actually maybe want to see without either getting a horrible sex/violence/profane clip with a grown up profile or movies that are only for 5 year olds. It should have more filters and be able to distinguish not solely based on basic filters. I'm thinking of cancelling when Disney+ begins streaming services. With Disney+ and Pureflix, maybe I'll have some wholesome entertainment without having put up with unfiltered garbage!

Please try again later or select a different title....” When calling Customer service the attitude is like Oh Well... Long time customer since DVD mail service, DO BETTER.

preview: I've been disappointed in Netflix before but their removal of a documentary called Root Cause which details the truth about root canals due to complaints from dentists who do root canals is abominable. Yeah, it's about money people, not your health, and
review: I've been disappointed in Netflix before but their removal of a documentary called Root Cause which details the truth about root canals due to complaints from dentists who do root canals is abominable. Yeah, it's about money people, not your health, and now you can't know because it can potentially cut into the profits of the greedy dentists doing these highly profitable procedures. Shame on you Netflix for being part of the system. And then on top of that, raising your prices too. What more am I being offered? Nothing. Thanks for censoring what I am able to watch. Might be too dangerous for me and others to have that information, dangerous for the profiteers that is. Shame. Shame.

preview: I have been a Netflix customer for many, many, many years. In the past few months I've called Netflix numerous times to try to find out why I was being forced to watch trailers over and over while trying to browse movies and shows on my television. The a
review: I have been a Netflix customer for many, many, many years. In the past few months I've called Netflix numerous times to try to find out why I was being forced to watch trailers over and over while trying to browse movies and shows on my television. The answer, basically, was that this is just the way it is - even though the process is time and energy wasting, and some of the automatic trailers shouldn't be seen by children who happen to be in the room. After many years as a loyal and happy Netflix customer, I ended my contract. Frankly, I don't think they care. I'm afraid that what used to be a friendly, warm, personal business founded by an imaginative entrepreneur has become yet another mindless corporation.

preview: I am taking stars because many of the "family" movies have lesbian and gay love scenes. What am I supposed to tell my kids? Why are they forcing their views on us? They can do as many movies they wish for this group of people but they should mark them so
review: I am taking stars because many of the "family" movies have lesbian and gay love scenes. What am I supposed to tell my kids? Why are they forcing their views on us? They can do as many movies they wish for this group of people but they should mark them somehow so we know before we have to start wondering what to tell our kids. There are so many movies on Netflix like that. This is far from family-oriented content as stated.

review: I’m LIVID!!! Netflix has this idea that if they show previews, it’s fine to cut out those scenes in the actual movie. For example, I saw, The Highwaymen’s preview and the only reason why I chose to watch it was because of a particular scene. I finally get to the scene and THEY CUT IT OUT?!?! I don’t even want to watch the rest anymore...I'm just curious as to why Netflix had to include it in the preview but not in the movie.

review:
Netflix took off every step up movie from their site. There were 6 movies originally on Netflix that were all equally good, but now there are none. As a kid I grew up watching these movies and having marathons with my friends, we would all go over to someone’s place for 2 nights to just binge these movies together because they were great. They were based off of dance but had spectacular storylines and I have introduced theses movies to many more and everyone I showed the series to loved the movies and wanted to continue watching them. BUT NOW WE CAN'T BECAUSE NETFLIX TOOK THEM OFF.

preview: Netflix upgrades their software but has a difficult time streaming unlike Amazon Prime which would be a better choice. Netflix also has many movies you would not watch due to their content in foreign languages. Netflix has also increased their price to 1
review: Netflix upgrades their software but has a difficult time streaming unlike Amazon Prime which would be a better choice. Netflix also has many movies you would not watch due to their content in foreign languages. Netflix has also increased their price to 12.99 for 2 viewable screens a month which is over 160 dollars a year. A typical Amazon Prime membership includes as much and gives you free shipping on products from their website for less. Ultimately I have been a Netflix customer for years but after the rate change and product comparison I would definitely go with Amazon Prime or other provider like Hulu Plus.

preview: I think Netflix had a very good concept, however, this Co has since lost its focus on customer value. I understand that they are totally focused on supplier costs and profits but, guys seriously customers want value and they only willing to pay if you ca
review: I think Netflix had a very good concept, however, this Co has since lost its focus on customer value. I understand that they are totally focused on supplier costs and profits but, guys seriously customers want value and they only willing to pay if you can offer value at reasonable prices. Focus on what your customer wants, revisit what you are delivering because seriously you guys load a whole lot of crap on Netflix that nobody wants to watch. Why would you load 60% foreign movies that nobody understands and furthermore your English movies are at the bottom of the box office ranks. There are movies that are released all the time in mainstream. Make streaming with you guys worthwhile, different, uniques and a point of difference. Otherwhys get off the road if you cannot stay in the race, you have no place here!

review: What happened to this company??? Things used to be easy. Now it's atrocious. I bought a $30 gift card. They tried to charge me a $30/month subscription. Slimy!!! They have 2 different companies, so I didn't know I was getting streaming. I wanted DVDs sent to my mom. Was told to go with Crave if I want better rates and better shows. Thank you Netflix for sending me to crave... I got 3 months free of their HBO package.

preview: I’ve been with Netflix for over 7 years. I faithfully pay for 2 screens. Occasionally, one of my kids will accidentally upgrade to 4 screens and when I go back in to downgrade, the prices have gone up and over an error, I’m now stuck paying the higher pr
review:
I’ve been with Netflix for over 7 years. I faithfully pay for 2 screens. Occasionally, one of my kids will accidentally upgrade to 4 screens and when I go back in to downgrade, the prices have gone up and over an error, I’m now stuck paying the higher price. Over the course of 7 years, this has happened 4 times. It happened last night. I have been paying $10.99 for a year now and my kids accidentally upgraded. When I went in to downgrade, the price increased to $12.99. I called Netflix to talk to them about this and the customer service representative was unhelpful, rude, unaccommodating, and completely lacked any and all compassion or understanding. Granted, I didn’t expect much out of them since the first time this happened and called - they wouldn’t honor the old pricing either, but I thought maybe there was a chance that their policies had changed. Not so.
Read full review

preview: I like Netflix and have used their service from back in the snail mail DVD days. Today of course it's all streaming. And my main box of choice is the Apple TV. I like the interface, speed, etc. and it works with all my stuff. Keeps everything synced betw
review:
I like Netflix and have used their service from back in the snail mail DVD days. Today of course it's all streaming. And my main box of choice is the Apple TV. I like the interface, speed, etc. and it works with all my stuff. Keeps everything synced between different TVs. Makes mirroring or beaming pictures onto the big screen a breeze. All-in-all it's my favorite and the best experience if you use other Apple products. Amazon Prime, YouTube, SlingTV, and many other Apps are available.

preview: I am very disappointed I am of Netflix's services, especially concerning the security part. Lastly I had several problems that took a lot a time to solve; one of my former account that I didn't use anymore had been hacked; I saw that 9.99 GBP had been re
review:
I am very disappointed I am of Netflix's services, especially concerning the security part. Lastly I had several problems that took a lot a time to solve; one of my former account that I didn't use anymore had been hacked; I saw that 9.99 GBP had been removed from my bank account on February 8th and March 8th (normally I pay 9.99$CA every 20th of the month); though this amount has been refunded, I am really surprised that no one was even able to notify me unusual activities on this account. And the only way for me to secure this account was to change the e-mail address+password, to reactivate the account, and then to pay 9.99$ the subscription. Of course, I cancelled my subscription right away, but the 9.99$ that has been taken from my account still hasn't been refunded, though all of this happened on March 8th.

Not only were they NOT helpful, they were rude and gave me attitude, telling me that I was mistaken and had to take it up with my bank. Terrible company... Triple charged for over a year on a card that wasn't even designated for payment and no refund. I'm livid. They'll never get my business back.

preview: I was a customer of this service for years. I never had a problem returning DVDs, typically showing returned within a few days. The new release DVDs weren't usually available until a few weeks after being publicly released so I found I didn't use the ser
review: I was a customer of this service for years. I never had a problem returning DVDs, typically showing returned within a few days. The new release DVDs weren't usually available until a few weeks after being publicly released so I found I didn't use the service as much as I wanted so decided to cancel. I followed all directions and requested no further DVDs be sent. Netflix noted they sent a DVD after cancel, I listed this as never received and I returned my last DVD in time. Netflix has charged me for nonreturn of a DVD after canceling. After researching online this appears to be Netflix's standard business practice. Buyer beware, if canceling, clear your queue and return all DVDs where Netflix acknowledges receipt and then cancel so you are not charged for a "nonreturned" DVD. I was planning to activate streaming service, after this dishonest business practice Netflix will never receive another dime from me.

preview: Because I have put popular movies at the top of my DVD queue, for the past 3 weeks they've been mailing me the 7th or 8th choice in my queue. Then when I go to my queue, I see that the top 6 are supposedly ready to ship. Either they lie or their system d
review: Because I have put popular movies at the top of my DVD queue, for the past 3 weeks they've been mailing me the 7th or 8th choice in my queue. Then when I go to my queue, I see that the top 6 are supposedly ready to ship. Either they lie or their system does not work as advertised. They should give up on DVD mailing and start streaming everything instead of just the stuff you don't want to see. The DVD service is frustrating and seems unfair or too random. Hard to tell why the experience is so bad.

If Netflix can’t refund me then it’s fine but the attitude of the customer service person was very childlike, had to have the last word with a very stern tone In his voice and use the word like “damn!”. What is going on Netflix with your customer service?! Offended greatly!

review: Movies which are available on UK or US Netflix are not available on Australian Netflix. Why this discrimination? The movies released a long time ago and old classics are not available. They should make the choice wider and new movies when added should be available to all.

review: Netflix customer service default response to subscriber feedback is to send over some links of irrelevant info. They do not show understanding and fail to truly listen and understand what you are complaining about. Whether it's the fact that subtitles default to on because Netflix designed their apps that way, shrinking credits, pop ups appearing over playing content, auto-playing trailer-advertisements. They communicate that they don't really care about your feedback/complaint and can't wait to get rid of you. Over and over again this is my experience with the company. They express a lack of concern and care and nothing ever improves on the things you report.

review: Netflix typically increases its costs on an annual basis, but the increase is worth having the new programming available. Netflix has original shows, a lot of documentaries, and movies that are not only highly rated, but have won Academy Awards for Best Motion Picture, Best Director, Best Actors both Leading Role and Supporting Role, and Best Actresses both Leading Role and Supporting Role. When my young niece and nephew visit, Netflix has a default profile for "Kids," so they can choose whatever they want to watch, and I have no need to censor anything in that profile.

review: I changed my billing information to another debit card to avoid an overdraft. Received an email confirmation that my new payment method had replaced my original one for monthly deductions. March 1, they charged the original debit card and overdrafted the account. $35 fee. Customer service said all they can do is close my account in order to cancel the charge. Could not explain why this happened and could not have cared less. Completely useless. After this month I paid $43 for, I will close my account.

preview: The Netflix plan only allows 2 DVDs sent to you at a time and the next 2 will not be sent until those 2 are returned. In general you get 2 movies A WEEK if you're lucky enough to have a fast delivery service. This costs a little more than $13 per month.
review: The Netflix plan only allows 2 DVDs sent to you at a time and the next 2 will not be sent until those 2 are returned. In general you get 2 movies A WEEK if you're lucky enough to have a fast delivery service. This costs a little more than $13 per month. My main issue is I have had SEVERAL scratched discs that wouldn't play through the entire movie or wouldn't play at all! I just received one that is cracked through the entire disc! That means yet another week to wait for a replacement! They clearly do not check their DVDs before they are sent out to the next customer. In all you get about 8 DVD rentals a month, one out of the 8 a month always comes damaged. For $13 you can go to a Redbox & get more than 8 movies a month. Don't waste your money.

review:

review:
I contacted Netflix on February 15, 2019, in regard to multiple charges being processed on my bank statement. The Netflix's customer service rep that I spoke to, confirmed that there were two fraudulent accounts opened with my information, including my debit card ending in **. I was tripled billed for 14 months. The rep stated that all the information on the (2) fraudulent account were in Spanish, which was obviously not me. I asked how they got my information and she was vague in her response and couldn't answer my question.

review: I received an email from Netflix to state that I had reopened an old account linked to an old email last used two years ago. Minutes later another email told me that the email on the account had been changed and I could no longer log in from my email address. Turns out, in an instant not only had my account been hacked but a payment had been taken for a new subscription - in Colombian COP currency. Considering I already have a current Netflix account in my name/house address etc, and am based in the UK, surely the email change and location of currency should have aroused some suspicion at Netflix - or required a security question. Certainly shouldn't be doable in seconds. But no, the money has just been taken from my account. Security seems very poor.

preview: I joined the Netflix free for the month plan. I was having problems trying to get it to work on our main TV but with NO luck! They told me my service was going to start billing me as my free month was up. I tried to explain that my main TV was not connec
review: I joined the Netflix free for the month plan. I was having problems trying to get it to work on our main TV but with NO luck! They told me my service was going to start billing me as my free month was up. I tried to explain that my main TV was not connecting to Netflix so why are they charging me when it's not connecting correctly. They told me it's my AT&T service Internet's problem. So they had to charge me because the free month was up!!! WOW. This is Netflix's way of showing good customer service!!! NO THANKS!

preview: I opened an account and am paying by Gift Card. I found that I don't have time to watch, as in 3 months have not watched even one program or movie, so decided to cancel the service for a few months and reactivate the account when I have time to use it. F
review: I opened an account and am paying by Gift Card. I found that I don't have time to watch, as in 3 months have not watched even one program or movie, so decided to cancel the service for a few months and reactivate the account when I have time to use it. Found out that I CANNOT CANCEL TEMPORARILY without losing the entire remaining balance of the Gift Card!!! I was NOT ADVISED of this when I registered to pay with the Gift Card. Highly unethical in my opinion.

preview: I watch Netflix and Amazon Prime shows/movies. They are both great providers. Netflix doesn't add new movies/series as often as Amazon Prime, but there is always OnDemand and Contour free things to watch.
review: I watch Netflix and Amazon Prime shows/movies. They are both great providers. Netflix doesn't add new movies/series as often as Amazon Prime, but there is always OnDemand and Contour free things to watch.

preview: Netflix use to be better. Had newer movies but since the price increase it seems like all the options are for 2nd rate movies that I probably would never watch in the first place. I now subscribe to Netflix, Hulu, CBS & Amazon prime just to find somethin
review: Netflix use to be better. Had newer movies but since the price increase it seems like all the options are for 2nd rate movies that I probably would never watch in the first place. I now subscribe to Netflix, Hulu, CBS & Amazon prime just to find something to watch. Use to have Directv but got expensive with nothing to watch. Seems like it’s going in the same direction... just a little cheaper.

preview: It is good overall but the selection of movies could be better. Sometimes we will get movies that we did not order because the ones requested are not available. When movies are sent back there always seems to be another movie fast back to us.
review: It is good overall but the selection of movies could be better. Sometimes we will get movies that we did not order because the ones requested are not available. When movies are sent back there always seems to be another movie fast back to us.

review: I like the way Netflix finds content that matches my tastes, however, I sometimes think I miss some good shows because of it. I would like to have a button that gives me additional choices, such as "check these out."

review: There are so many different tv series on Netflix that I want to see, and I never get bored. I have certain days that I watch certain things. I have 2 days that I mark as movie nights in a week. It is so nice because I can plan what I am watching each night of the week. I have a lineup on my calendar for what to watch when.

review: When you can find a film required it generally works but sometimes although we have fast broadband it sometimes finds it difficult to show the programme. It may be better if the classes of film were to be different.

preview: I love Netflix! I just wish it got newer movies in, like Redbox does. It seems Netflix is great for binge watching, but not for box office hits. The overall plans are ok, and I don't mind paying the price.
review: I love Netflix! I just wish it got newer movies in, like Redbox does. It seems Netflix is great for binge watching, but not for box office hits. The overall plans are ok, and I don't mind paying the price.

preview: I think Netflix is great overall. I love that there is an option for multiple users, and that those users can be signed in at the same time. If I were to change anything, I would add more content. Although I say that, at this time it's not a big enough i
review: I think Netflix is great overall. I love that there is an option for multiple users, and that those users can be signed in at the same time. If I were to change anything, I would add more content. Although I say that, at this time it's not a big enough issue for me to stop using Netflix.

preview: The variety gets worse each year and is almost at the point of not being worth the money. At this point, I’m keeping the service for two original shows and when those are over, I will be canceling the service.
review: The variety gets worse each year and is almost at the point of not being worth the money. At this point, I’m keeping the service for two original shows and when those are over, I will be canceling the service.

preview: I only had Netflix as a trial basis. It was ok. Just like Comcast, the variety of show was good until you've watched them over and over. Also if you would like to watch something that you haven't seen in a long time they are not available until they recy
review: I only had Netflix as a trial basis. It was ok. Just like Comcast, the variety of show was good until you've watched them over and over. Also if you would like to watch something that you haven't seen in a long time they are not available until they recycle that show.

preview: Netflix has way too many movies and series that have way too much sick, explicit, and ugly sex scenes. Most stories can be told without all of that. I really do not like seeing people do all this stuff on my TV screen. If the same scenes played out on pu
review: Netflix has way too many movies and series that have way too much sick, explicit, and ugly sex scenes. Most stories can be told without all of that. I really do not like seeing people do all this stuff on my TV screen. If the same scenes played out on public streets, the individuals involved would be arrested for indecent exposure. The TV screen should be treated like a public place. It also has way too many programs in languages other than English. I only speak one language, so reading subtitles is a distraction from the movie for me. Much of what is being communicated is lost, because there is not enough time to see facial expressions, and emotions which are the non-verbal forms of communicating.

preview: I think it's amazing how many options there are, for movies, TV shows, and their own shows that Netflix itself produces. Usually though sometimes when I first turn on Netflix, it returns to where I was last and then says that it's unavailable and then I
review: I think it's amazing how many options there are, for movies, TV shows, and their own shows that Netflix itself produces. Usually though sometimes when I first turn on Netflix, it returns to where I was last and then says that it's unavailable and then I just restart it and it's fine. When it really misbehaves, I learned a special trick, you unplug the TV while it is tuned to Netflix and this always works like a charm.

preview: These guys are just great!! We do both streaming and DVD and have had absolutely no problems. The series presented are timely and we watch most of them. (We even binge!) Their movie selection online is extensive, many choices.
review: These guys are just great!! We do both streaming and DVD and have had absolutely no problems. The series presented are timely and we watch most of them. (We even binge!) Their movie selection online is extensive, many choices.

review: I enjoy the shows & movies offered, but can't figure out how to get to the search menu. I need a guide on how to maneuver around the choices. I really like the price per month, and that it is automatically debited from my account.

review: There is a wide variety of movies or tv shows new or old. It's great to be able to watch Star Trek for example whenever you want or new upcoming shows or movies. The price is more than reasonable and never encountered any problems or issues with Netflix.

preview: I really enjoy most of the shows you have, and love that you show old seasons of other shows, some of which I had missed when they were on tv. I especially love the Death in Paradise and Doc Martin, and other shows not normally seen in the states.
review: I really enjoy most of the shows you have, and love that you show old seasons of other shows, some of which I had missed when they were on tv. I especially love the Death in Paradise and Doc Martin, and other shows not normally seen in the states.

preview: I love the selection, quality & price. I only wish you could block certain types of movies that you never watch from coming up (i.e, subtitled or foreign films, LGBTQ, etc.). Stranger Things & Ozark are my faves, by the way!
review: I love the selection, quality & price. I only wish you could block certain types of movies that you never watch from coming up (i.e, subtitled or foreign films, LGBTQ, etc.). Stranger Things & Ozark are my faves, by the way!

review: Overall I am pleased with the Netflix service. Some of the content I believe should be more restricted so children, especially teenagers, cannot have access to it at any time! So called ‘adult programming’ needs cleaning up! Money alone should not be the only purpose for providing a public service.

preview: I have had Netflix for several years and they just keep improving the variety of products without raising the price. It is simple to use, no complicated steps to follow. The picture comes in clear with no interruptions or pauses. I am very happy with Net
review: I have had Netflix for several years and they just keep improving the variety of products without raising the price. It is simple to use, no complicated steps to follow. The picture comes in clear with no interruptions or pauses. I am very happy with Netflix.

preview: I enjoy Netflix due to its varied chooses of viewing. I also enjoy the set up of categories to choose from. The price is right and I never have to worry about interruptions while watching a show. Very reliable.
review: I enjoy Netflix due to its varied chooses of viewing. I also enjoy the set up of categories to choose from. The price is right and I never have to worry about interruptions while watching a show. Very reliable.

review: It's Well but just wish more options and more recent would show. Also that things were not removed so much. Otherwise I think this is pretty good and semi affordable. I like that can download to watch later.

preview: I think the service is good value for money. You get a lot of choices for a subscription fee that cost less than buying a single movie on DVD. Overall, this is a very cost effective way to watch movies. Only downside is that you don't own the movie, and
review: I think the service is good value for money. You get a lot of choices for a subscription fee that cost less than buying a single movie on DVD. Overall, this is a very cost effective way to watch movies. Only downside is that you don't own the movie, and you only have a window in which to watch it for many movies. This is a little frustrating, but by no means a dealbreaker.

preview: Wish it had more movies. We looked for three movies this weekend and they had none of them. I do like all of the older tv shows they have listed and I think the search method was helpful. My grandchildren love all of the kids' shows and movies.
review: Wish it had more movies. We looked for three movies this weekend and they had none of them. I do like all of the older tv shows they have listed and I think the search method was helpful. My grandchildren love all of the kids' shows and movies.

preview: With Netflix I will never go back to cable. Netflix has it all, series, comedy, drama, documentaries, and much more. No commercials!!! When binge watching, the next episode plays automatically. I can make my own list of shows and Netflix offers suggestio
review: With Netflix I will never go back to cable. Netflix has it all, series, comedy, drama, documentaries, and much more. No commercials!!! When binge watching, the next episode plays automatically. I can make my own list of shows and Netflix offers suggestions based on what I watched. Also, it has a list of new releases so you don’t have to search for shows.

review: I love Netflix. I just don’t like how a lot of content was pulled due to major networks wanting to start their own streaming services. Netflix’s answer to that dilemma, having so much original content is what keeps me loyal to Netflix.

preview: I have both the streaming and DVD option. Streaming is just okay. But the DVD option is not worth the money...not enough sites to get it to you fast enough. This is a mistake, not going to keep this plan.
review: I have both the streaming and DVD option. Streaming is just okay. But the DVD option is not worth the money...not enough sites to get it to you fast enough. This is a mistake, not going to keep this plan.

review: Good selection of first run movies, and I like separation by genre. Also you can see how others rated movies. Movies constantly being updated, so we check often to view new movie titles. The cost for subscription is reasonable.

review: The only problem we have with Netflix is choices. That could just be our taste. Also, we don't have children so that eliminates a lot. We do like the British shows and they have a lot of those: comedies, dramas, action, etc.

preview: I cancelled Netflix DVD through my account immediately after streaming-only option was made available. They kept on charging. My fault is that I assumed that they will do what they said and did not check my card to make sure they cancelled. The card is u
review: I cancelled Netflix DVD through my account immediately after streaming-only option was made available. They kept on charging. My fault is that I assumed that they will do what they said and did not check my card to make sure they cancelled. The card is used seldom and has automatic 100% payment setup. When I called them, they just told me that they do not believe my story and the charges will stay as is. Do not trust Netflix just because they tell you that the payments have been adjusted. Verify it. They will keep on charging if they can.

preview: My family and I enjoy Netflix. The quality of service is excellent. We have never experienced any buffering or hesitation when watching Netflix. Even when my kids were sick in bed all day and streamed The Flash for the entire day, they didn't experience
review: My family and I enjoy Netflix. The quality of service is excellent. We have never experienced any buffering or hesitation when watching Netflix. Even when my kids were sick in bed all day and streamed The Flash for the entire day, they didn't experience a single glitch, hesitation, or buffering issue. We are very happy with the service, our only issue is that we all agree that we wish there were a larger selection of things to watch and more updated programs. Especially in the movie section. If they were able to offer more recently released movies that would great. Thanks!

preview: NetFlix has a wide variety of movies and shows, the picture quality is good enough since we're not videophiles, sometimes we will be watching something and for a split moment the screen goes black which is probably due to internet speed once in a while l
review:
NetFlix has a wide variety of movies and shows, the picture quality is good enough since we're not videophiles, sometimes we will be watching something and for a split moment the screen goes black which is probably due to internet speed once in a while lags. I kind of wish Netflix would put their entire library on the internet instead of having to order DVDs for a lot of films, but maybe that would require a huge increase in the cost of the servicing since they would have to be able to stream a lot more stuff?

preview: Netflix is backsliding but it's still the best. The new content helps but then they had to cancel so many new shows it hurt. Still much better than Prime or anything the cable riff-raff can come up with.
review: Netflix is backsliding but it's still the best. The new content helps but then they had to cancel so many new shows it hurt. Still much better than Prime or anything the cable riff-raff can come up with.

review: This service has a great variety of films. Enough series to follow and then I love the feature to save your files. The negative is that your favorites are not saved on all devices. Otherwise, it is a great alternative to cable tv.

review: Netflix original programming—in my humble opinion—is by far more superior than its competitors. Moreover, its specials, documentaries, and syndicated programs are only one season behind, which gives you the added bonus of watching your favor TV-series in one day if you’re a binge watcher.

preview: Very disappointed that you have brought Barack and Michelle on board. Do you really think that their beliefs are the beliefs of most Americans? Your clients don’t all live in New York and California. A shame you had to bring politics into your business..
review: Very disappointed that you have brought Barack and Michelle on board. Do you really think that their beliefs are the beliefs of most Americans? preview: If you are fan of B rated movies or if you missed all the popular series from the 90s and 2000 then Netflix is for you. Or if you like Kung-Fu flux from 80s or a Manga head then Netflix is for you. But if you are searching for award-winning groundbreaker
review: If you are fan of B rated movies or if you missed all the popular series from the 90s and 2000 then Netflix is for you. Or if you like Kung-Fu flux from 80s or a Manga head then Netflix is for you. But if you are searching for award-winning groundbreaker content then you are wasting your time.

review: Only problem is there is no new top films for a long time. Some films are absolutely rubbish. I suppose I need to start watching serials. But I don't watch it very often for this reason. Sometimes the quality of the sound isn't that good either.

Netflix is great and has good quality but lately I find the variety of shows to be somewhat limited after we've binge watched several TV shows. But given that I get the Netflix subscription for free through my T-Mobile bill, I can't complain.

review: Netflix is sending emails saying they are offering past members another free trial because so much has changed, what a scam. preview: Anyone considering ordering Netflix should be aware that the vast majority of movies are foreign language with close captions that you have to be a speed reader to read. A while back there was 23-24 new releases and 18 were in foreign language.
