preview: We have Netflix. When we try to put on a program it sometimes loads and sometime doesn't. We pay money and can't use it. If you call the help line and they tell you to turn off all these things and turn them back on and then it still doesn't work. It's l
review: We have Netflix. When we try to put on a program it sometimes loads and sometime doesn't. We pay money and can't use it. If you call the help line and they tell you to turn off all these things and turn them back on and then it still doesn't work. It's like a scam. They get their money, we get no service. It's sooooo frustrating and there's not a thing that you can do about it. Sometimes it works, but now it seems like it's less than 50% of the time. This week we couldn't use the streaming video at all. What can be done? Anyone have an answer???

preview: Netflix unstable, incompatible w/ Samsung 2011-15 Smart Hub TV's - I have subscribed to Netflix for 3+ years now. Netflix says they are working with Samsung. I spoke with Samsung twice -- 1-2 hrs. each to access/download updates for 2014 and 3 mos. ago,
review: Netflix unstable, incompatible w/ Samsung 2011-15 Smart Hub TV's - I have subscribed to Netflix for 3+ years now. Netflix says they are working with Samsung. I spoke with Samsung twice -- 1-2 hrs. each to access/download updates for 2014 and 3 mos. ago, 2015 smart hub stream updates (only Netflix has this issue). Watched Netflix movie last night (June 27th), and for 23rd time over 3+ yrs. got same msg. tonight, June 26, "improving things and be patient." I made mistake of buying Samsung's 56" flat screen with 240/sec. refresh rate, 3D, only available at their outlets in 2012. I have paid for continuous nightly access for 3+ yrs., and had less than 300 days total access! Recommend: Buy LG or SIM cheap every two years. Neither Netflix nor Samsung can get past their trivial internal dispute.

preview: Ok so Race to the Edge is the third season to my favorite TV series. But I can't even watch it because I'm forced to make an account to watch. I'm not paying Netflix just to watch this. Nice job Netflix, you ruined another thing for me.
review: Ok so Race to the Edge is the third season to my favorite TV series. But I can't even watch it because I'm forced to make an account to watch. I'm not paying Netflix just to watch this. Nice job Netflix, you ruined another thing for me.

preview: For the most part, I do like Netflix streaming service. But, changes have been made that do not make any sense. I started with Netflix when streaming was included with the DVD rental. Not a bad deal at all when all I had to do is pay $7.99 plus tax for t
review:
For the most part, I do like Netflix streaming service. But, changes have been made that do not make any sense. I started with Netflix when streaming was included with the DVD rental. Not a bad deal at all when all I had to do is pay $7.99 plus tax for the DVD service and get unlimited streaming video. When the company decided to start charging for the streaming as well, I thought it was still a good deal.
Read full review

preview: I'm Netflix customer for 6 years. And now the time comes to leave them. Initially Netflix was really good provider of Blu-ray disks and I really enjoyed watching movies in high quality. Unfortunately this is not true anymore. 50-75% of disks are damaged,
review: I'm Netflix customer for 6 years. And now the time comes to leave them. Initially Netflix was really good provider of Blu-ray disks and I really enjoyed watching movies in high quality. Unfortunately this is not true anymore. 50-75% of disks are damaged, so I have to replace them. So, it takes few days to replace the disk and I actually see 1-2 movies per month due to poor quality of their disks. Will strongly recommend to avoid Netflix and to find someone normal. This fake movie provider can't be considered anymore.

preview: We have experienced buffering issues for over two months. Sometimes it takes up to 45 minutes to load Netflix. All other app's work flawlessly except Netflix so I called customer service to see if we could get a credit on our account and a rude and conde
review:
We have experienced buffering issues for over two months. Sometimes it takes up to 45 minutes to load Netflix. All other app's work flawlessly except Netflix so I called customer service to see if we could get a credit on our account and a rude and condescending customer service agent answered the call and basically said we did not know what we were doing. I explained we are in the tech industry and have done all appropriate troubleshooting and still having issues and he basically said he could email me instructions for troubleshooting (didn't we just cover that??) and refused to hear that there might actually be an issue on Netflix's end. He went on to said Netflix was a bandwidth hog, then he proceeded to laugh and reiterate that he would send me instructions for troubleshooting (really, is a third time necessary??). I went on to try and explain I was hoping to get a credit on our account for the inconvenience and he proceeded in giving me two options, cancel my subscription or use the troubleshooting instructions.
Read full review

preview: The Best Deal In TV. You can't get anything to compare with it for $8 per month. A lot to choose from and no frickin commercials.
review: The Best Deal In TV. You can't get anything to compare with it for $8 per month. A lot to choose from and no frickin commercials.

preview: I had a Netflix account under a Yahoo email. I terminated that account and email when I had began a new email. Netflix had never dissolved that account and continued to charge me for it. I realized this a few months later and called to notify them. When
review:
I had a Netflix account under a Yahoo email. I terminated that account and email when I had began a new email. Netflix had never dissolved that account and continued to charge me for it. I realized this a few months later and called to notify them. When I did I was promised the return of that payment onto my debit card within 3-5 business days. On the 5th business day I called and I ask why my money had not been returned. They had an issue with the credit union that wouldn't allow that large sum of money to be refunded. Nobody had called me about the situation. I still have yet to receive my money back. I'm not asking Netflix to give me anything, I just want my money returned.
Read full review

preview: I recently started my free month of Netflix, it just happened to be Memorial Day weekend. I wanted to watch "Kelly's Heroes" however after entering into search, Netflix only offered movies "similar" to Kelly's Heroes, really? That's exactly how it came u
review: I recently started my free month of Netflix, it just happened to be Memorial Day weekend. I wanted to watch "Kelly's Heroes" however after entering into search, Netflix only offered movies "similar" to Kelly's Heroes, really? That's exactly how it came up! I was quite taken aback with Netflix. It was not at Hulu either. What the heck? I found it right away at Amazon but for $2.99 rental. This is a great Clint Eastwood movie. What's the deal? The more I look through the Netflix library, it's mostly old crap mixed with a few teaser movies and who watches old TV reruns? Amazon Prime is basically the same but much more user friendly. Goodbye Netflix! At least with AP for my $99 I get free shipping plus all the extras. Netflix is full of themselves. It seems my "smart" TV is not so smart!

preview: I was able to figure out the problem with the blu-ray on my own. The problem was with the guy at the help disk - he didn't have a clue how to do anything. I think the company needs to better train their people. I still don't understand why I was billed w
review:
I was able to figure out the problem with the blu-ray on my own. The problem was with the guy at the help disk - he didn't have a clue how to do anything. I think the company needs to better train their people. I still don't understand why I was billed while I was still in the free trial period. I'll watch my statements closely. So far I haven't had any of the of the problems others have mentioned.
Original review: June 12, 2015
I am paying for 2 blu-ray discs at a time. My account has two profiles, myself and my husband's. Apparently, only the primary account holder's profile (me) can get blu-rays; the other profile can only get regular DVD's. I called the Netflix help center and the tech I talked to was no help at all. He couldn't understand why I would want two profiles anyway. I explained that my husband and I have different tastes in movies so the profiles are configured for the types of movies we each want to see. He also showed that I was charged for the next month on my credit card even though my free trial doesn't end until June 17, 2015. He said he removed the charge so I can cancel my membership and rejoin to see if that makes any difference. Also, I asked where I can send my complaints and he said only the Help Desk (him) can enter complaints.

preview: Most series I want to watch on Netflix on my Roku stall at 25% loaded. I can watch some obscure series and movies, but not Netflix Originals or more current films. It always stalls at 25% loaded.
review: Most series I want to watch on Netflix on my Roku stall at 25% loaded. I can watch some obscure series and movies, but not Netflix Originals or more current films. It always stalls at 25% loaded.

preview: I have had Netflix for almost a year now and I just cancelled the service. It sucks. I have only kept it this long to watch House of Cards. The selection is terrible. At this point I am willing to give up House of Cards too. It isn't worth the $7.99 a mo
review: I have had Netflix for almost a year now and I just cancelled the service. It sucks. I have only kept it this long to watch House of Cards. The selection is terrible. At this point I am willing to give up House of Cards too. It isn't worth the $7.99 a month fee. Additionally, I can NEVER load and stream movies for my kids on our smart TV. I even got a wi-fi extender and all other items in the house work near the smart TV except for Netflix. Additionally, tonight I couldn't login on my smart TV to try and stream a movie AGAIN. Netflix kept saying my password was wrong (it wasn't). I decided to change it on my laptop and reboot everything. It still insisted my password was wrong. Oh and here is the kicker, they were double billing me. They had my credit card under someone else's account. I would NEVER recommend their service.

preview: We have had an automatic payment set up with Netflix for over a year with no issue. Our account bills on the 5th of every month, and this month the payment was processed in the evening on June 5th, which happens to be a Friday. Because of this, the payme
review:
We have had an automatic payment set up with Netflix for over a year with no issue. Our account bills on the 5th of every month, and this month the payment was processed in the evening on June 5th, which happens to be a Friday. Because of this, the payment posted to our bank account as "pending" and will clear on Monday. The amount of the payment has been taken from our available balance but apparently hasn't actually made its way to Netflix yet, and this has resulted in Netflix deciding to suspend our ability to stream content. When we contacted Netflix about this we were told that they would be happy to process ANOTHER payment in order to allow us to begin using our service again. Other than that, there is nothing that they can do that will allow us to begin using the service again.
Read full review

review: Satisfied with movie delivery but I've wasted an hour or more trying to log in to my account. When I finally get in, I'll cancel. Going to the grocery store for a RedBox would have been faster.

review: Over the last month or so after they resolved the Post office issue Netflix DVD availability has become unacceptable. Today, I received no new DVD's shipped out even though I had three open slots. I called Netflix and she made excuses about high demand. So what she is saying is that even on the day they ship out the new DVD's I should expect no DVD's. If this situation continues one more week, I told her that I would cancel Netflix and start using Redbox. Excuses, excuses, excuses are all I get from them.

review: I have had 2 DVDs in the last month mailed to me that do not play. What is going on with this company? If they can't service customers with DVDs because they are more concerned with what new shows they can stream, then don't be in the DVD business. After 15 years I am done with this company and will watch movies on Comcast. Disgusted!

preview: Well it WAS an excellent TV streaming app about 5 years ago! When they actually had an extensive amount of content. As time goes by I notice shows and movies that were once there but now aren't! While they do have a couple shows that will fancy the avera
review: Well it WAS an excellent TV streaming app about 5 years ago! When they actually had an extensive amount of content. As time goes by I notice shows and movies that were once there but now aren't! While they do have a couple shows that will fancy the average Joe I am far from satisfied! I watch a lot of TV so for me I am either watching a lot of content I have already seen or I am trying to get hooked by these shows and movies that are BORING or from the 80s. Netflix has become somewhat of a chore to endure! What is the deal with Netflix asking if "I'm still watching!" You ** don't ask me stupid questions and wonder why you got smacked!!! Anyway please stop being so negligent to your supporters - we need the old Netflix back!

preview: Over the past couple years, I've noticed more and more problems with the playback of DVDs and blurays. It seems at least 1/2 the movies we get anymore will screw up somewhere in the middle and we'll miss part of a chapter or more to freezing up. The disc
review:
Over the past couple years, I've noticed more and more problems with the playback of DVDs and blurays. It seems at least 1/2 the movies we get anymore will screw up somewhere in the middle and we'll miss part of a chapter or more to freezing up. The discs themselves often show little or no wear which tells me it's a quality control issue from the manufacturer side.

preview: I have come to the decision Netflix only will allow you to watch shows/movies that they want you to watch. Here is the biggest holiday of the year and my sons wanted to watch all the old great war films (Charlton Heston, Wayne and many others..). I have
review: I have come to the decision Netflix only will allow you to watch shows/movies that they want you to watch. Here is the biggest holiday of the year and my sons wanted to watch all the old great war films (Charlton Heston, Wayne and many others..). I have spent all evening trying to get one or more of these movies up to no luck. I guess we should be thankful that Netflix is allowing us to watch the 10/15 movies they think we should watch.. And again maybe this is the type of film countries do not want the people to watch as they could become more American.. Ah just a thought anyone got any ideas as to what is going on, why we can not watch old movies without a special pass from the big brother.. Again many thanks.

preview: My issue with Netflix is in the slowdown in turnaround beginning sometime in the last year. Previously, when I returned a disc I received a new one in two days (returned Wednesday = new disc Friday). Now returned Wednesday = new disc Saturday and returne
review: My issue with Netflix is in the slowdown in turnaround beginning sometime in the last year. Previously, when I returned a disc I received a new one in two days (returned Wednesday = new disc Friday). Now returned Wednesday = new disc Saturday and returned Thursday = new disc Tuesday (five days). I know that they now close on Saturdays, but that should not affect discs returned before Friday. And discs returned on Thursday, which used to be replaced by Saturday, should at least be replaced by Monday. The only issue I have with Netflix streaming is that I wish that more of their catalog could be streamed. I am otherwise satisfied with my Netflix membership.

review: I recently got netflix after hearing the media go on about how great it would be to stop illegal downloading and that all these shows and movies would be available. Not a single show or movie that I wanted to see was on there. Game of thrones (biggest illegally downloaded show in aus) doesn't even have a single episode on there. Waste of time and money.

preview: I've subscribed to Netflix for many years. Over six weeks ago, we received and promptly returned the 1st disc of Season 3 of Veep. The 2nd disc has never been mailed to us. We've called & complained, and they just tell us to keep waiting. We are very low
review: I've subscribed to Netflix for many years. Over six weeks ago, we received and promptly returned the 1st disc of Season 3 of Veep. The 2nd disc has never been mailed to us. We've called & complained, and they just tell us to keep waiting. We are very low-traffic consumers: we often keep two films for a month or longer before watching & returning them. Thus, in their service algorithm, we should be prioritized customers. To add insult to injury, when one calls (no e-mail with Netflix), one only gets a series of truisms read from a script, and absolutely no help or attempt to solve the issue. We've been paying Netflix for years, but now we have to buy the shows individually to stream on Amazon, because Netflix is such a disaster. My wife & I feel robbed by Netflix.

preview: I am angry and sad that you removed The Suite Life On Deck and The Suite Life Of Zack and Cody! Please put it back on soon! I like it so much I'm BEGGING YOU!
review: I am angry and sad that you removed The Suite Life On Deck and The Suite Life Of Zack and Cody! Please put it back on soon! I like it so much I'm BEGGING YOU!

review: I have been with Netflix for a while. Everything was good till they removed numerous shows my family watch and not updating series sooner. I'm going to end up switching to hulu or vudu. Netflix is boring me badly and sadly.

preview: I was unable to obtain access to Netflix. I called their customer service number for help. I let the service have access to my computer through an application Secure Me. The representative gave me access within 10 minutes. Of course, I did not know that
review:
I was unable to obtain access to Netflix. I called their customer service number for help. I let the service have access to my computer through an application Secure Me. The representative gave me access within 10 minutes. Of course, I did not know that at the time. The representative then proceeded to show me through data pages where my internet was trying to be hacked through a foreign address. He did say I needed to have a Mac rep. service my computer. I agreed. He then began to ask me what did I think the cost would be? I couldn't answer the question, but then realize he was trying to sell me a security package. I was so upset and I let him know he had kept me online for over a half hour to sell me a security package, when I was only calling to get assistance to access my Netflix!!!
Read full review

preview: I noticed that my billed had increased and called customer service to be advised that I had too many devices connected to the service. Although the five devices we have in our home are never streaming at the same time. But ok it was three dollars more. A
review:
I noticed that my billed had increased and called customer service to be advised that I had too many devices connected to the service. Although the five devices we have in our home are never streaming at the same time. But ok it was three dollars more. A little later Netflix advised that I needed to update my credit card on my new IPad, although I was signing into my existing account. A few months later I had an over draft fee and upon further investigation, I discovered I was being double billed by Netflix. I call customer service to be chided by the manager for my not noticing sooner that Netflix was over billing me. They refused to cover my overdraft fee and only refunded three of the six months double billed.
Read full review

preview: I was a customer of Netflix for eight years until the service got so slow. I was receiving four or five DVDs a month instead of six to seven previously. (RedBox was cheaper at 6 movies a month) After leaving Netflix my Netflix web page said one free mont
review: I was a customer of Netflix for eight years until the service got so slow. I was receiving four or five DVDs a month instead of six to seven previously. (RedBox was cheaper at 6 movies a month) After leaving Netflix my Netflix web page said one free month trial so I signed up for One DVD at a time. When my charge card statement came I noticed a charge from Netflix for that month of service. I called Netflix customer service and was told I ordered streaming, I did not! I checked DVD which they starting sending me so I asked for a refund and cancellation, which they told me NO. I asked for a supervisor which also told me NO, so I asked for his supervisor and he told me the supervisor in charge does not accept calls. I'm very disappointed with Netflix and will tell my story to those that will listen.

preview: There needs to be more than 2 settings for kids' maturity levels. 12 and under should not be considered little kids. 8 and under is more accurate. Most parents would not allow their 5 yr old to watch the same movies/shows that they would allow a 12 yr ol
review: There needs to be more than 2 settings for kids' maturity levels. 12 and under should not be considered little kids. 8 and under is more accurate. Most parents would not allow their 5 yr old to watch the same movies/shows that they would allow a 12 yr old to watch. The settings recently changed and there are now shows available to my 5 yr old that I would never allow. If there were more settings (8 and under, 8-12, and 12-18) parents would be able to choose more appropriate shows for their children.

review: I can't connect with Netflix to complain about services that are erratic. The constant buffering on the programs that are paid for I believe are being done to limit my viewing. On January 1st, the ability to watch movies was limited to "maybe" one a day if that.
