preview: Netflix allows customers to change their account information on line (email address, etc.). I did that several months ago and instead of changing the email, it ADDED an email, and hence a new account. Netflix will not refund the double payments charged.
review: Netflix allows customers to change their account information on line (email address, etc.). I did that several months ago and instead of changing the email, it ADDED an email, and hence a new account. Netflix will not refund the double payments charged. It is my opinion if one does not have the option of changing their email without talking to them (which they now advise) it should be removed as a changeable option on the account info page.

preview: I signed up for free trial Netflix March 2014. I forgot to cancel the following month; however, in May I cancelled my membership via online. I have been billed every month. I called and they openly admitted seeing that I had no streaming since 2010, but
review: I signed up for free trial Netflix March 2014. I forgot to cancel the following month; however, in May I cancelled my membership via online. I have been billed every month. I called and they openly admitted seeing that I had no streaming since 2010, but failed to give me any credit for the time I have not used the service. VERY DISSATISFIED!!!

preview: Netflix, a good idea, but only about the money. First and foremost, the quality of every show/movie varies but almost all at some point will be reduced to 1980 VHS quality grainy visuals. That problem takes back burner when presented with the most glarin
review:
Netflix, a good idea, but only about the money. First and foremost, the quality of every show/movie varies but almost all at some point will be reduced to 1980 VHS quality grainy visuals. That problem takes back burner when presented with the most glaring problem Netflix has - Disappearing movies/TV shows. I have multiple times watched a movie only to find it missing when I recommend it to a friend. These - off the top of my head- include Mission Impossible Ghost Protocol, Cowboy Bebop and various others. It's annoying to say the least when a service you pay for starts denying you exactly what is says it will deliver.
Read full review

preview: Netflix picture quality is now totally worthless and the large majority of subscribers are unable to view in HD (720p, 1080p) or even SD (480p) during prime time and weekends. The ISPs are not throttling the speed. Netflix Content Delivery Network Server
review:
Netflix picture quality is now totally worthless and the large majority of subscribers are unable to view in HD (720p, 1080p) or even SD (480p) during prime time and weekends. The ISPs are not throttling the speed. Netflix Content Delivery Network Servers cannot handle the demand. Netflix seems to want it all without the expense of building their own CDNS (Content Delivery Network Servers). Instead Netflix should be building far more regionally located Netflix CDN Servers to meet their customer demand and not relying on the ISPs to shoulder the load. While they call it Open Connect, Netflix is actually closing off access to some of its content while seeking unprecedented preferential treatment from ISPs.
Read full review

preview: I've not used my Netflix since I downloaded its $7.99 a month. When I went to cancel my subscription, they said I have to pay 20 dollars. I don't understand why. I just added Netflix on my Time Warner cable to my TV. It's easier to watch on big screen. H
review: I've not used my Netflix since I downloaded its $7.99 a month. When I went to cancel my subscription, they said I have to pay 20 dollars. I don't understand why. I just added Netflix on my Time Warner cable to my TV. It's easier to watch on big screen. How to cancel without having to pay a penalty.

preview: I opted out of the DVD service following Netflix instruction to do so in July or August of 2011 when the company intended to split. I had a DVD I had forgotten so I had to call and they informed me of the DVD and to return it and clear my queue to preven
review:
I opted out of the DVD service following Netflix instruction to do so in July or August of 2011 when the company intended to split. I had a DVD I had forgotten so I had to call and they informed me of the DVD and to return it and clear my queue to prevent further DVDs being sent and afterward it would be removed from my account and I would no longer be charged. I noticed the charges in November of that year and called back. The rep blamed the previous rep stating they removed DVD and stated I would be credited for the overcharge.
Read full review

preview: I have been with Netflix a long time and I get the mailed DVDs sent to me. I have a problem with them recently and it is only getting worse. They seem to have the ability to mail a DVD out on a Monday and I get it Tue or Wed. Now as returning them goes t
review:
I have been with Netflix a long time and I get the mailed DVDs sent to me. I have a problem with them recently and it is only getting worse. They seem to have the ability to mail a DVD out on a Monday and I get it Tue or Wed. Now as returning them goes these days, it has gotten a lot worse. I could mail one to them Tuesday night, grabbed Wednesday morning and nine times out of ten they have it Thursday, which is great. I slowly noticed they were only getting them on Friday no matter what day I mailed them back. I have not found out if they work on Saturdays or not.
Read full review

preview: What happened to customer service at Netflix? After receiving multiple scratched, unplayable discs in a row, I canceled my Netflix DVD service. Then, after trying to stream a movie on Netflix on different evenings with constant re-buffering, I canceled m
review:
What happened to customer service at Netflix? After receiving multiple scratched, unplayable discs in a row, I canceled my Netflix DVD service. Then, after trying to stream a movie on Netflix on different evenings with constant re-buffering, I canceled my streaming service as well. I was a loyal Netflix subscriber from the company's early days. Yet Netflix customer service made no effort to retain my business and took no responsibility for the problems. With respect to the re-buffering, in particular, they blamed the issue on my equipment (which works perfectly with other streaming services) and my supposedly "slow" FiOS high speed connection (which streams HBO Go, Amazon and other streaming services with no issues).
Read full review

preview: Continuous buffering on Netflix (5-10 pm); no buffering on Amazon. Netflix has a very serious server capacity issue to handle its subscriber volume. Given the scale of the TV 'Content' battle in progress, Netflix will lose... big time.
review: Continuous buffering on Netflix (5-10 pm); no buffering on Amazon. Netflix has a very serious server capacity issue to handle its subscriber volume. Given the scale of the TV 'Content' battle in progress, Netflix will lose... big time.

preview: I was informed that Netflix NO LONGER processes received discs or shipments on Saturday. Therefore, send in all your discs on Thursday if you don't want to lose 3 days in turnaround time.
review: I was informed that Netflix NO LONGER processes received discs or shipments on Saturday. Therefore, send in all your discs on Thursday if you don't want to lose 3 days in turnaround time.

preview: Not only you have few movie selections, but even the miniseries are few. Disappointed.
review: Not only you have few movie selections, but even the miniseries are few. Disappointed.

preview: I've been a Netflix customer since 2006, weathering the occasional hiccup but still overwhelmingly satisfied with the service. The "Watch Instantly" selection could be better, obviously, but the DVD offerings give me the opportunity to enjoy both popular
review: I've been a Netflix customer since 2006, weathering the occasional hiccup but still overwhelmingly satisfied with the service. The "Watch Instantly" selection could be better, obviously, but the DVD offerings give me the opportunity to enjoy both popular and obscure titles quickly and without headache. So imagine my surprise when I recently canceled for a few days' vacation travel (there is no "suspend service" option). I rejoined upon my return - no difficult feat, given that my information and queues were retained in the Netflix database - and was assessed the new higher rate for the streaming membership. Not questioning the company's right to treat me like a new member, but it seems like a slap to my brand loyalty.

preview: I am very dissatisfied with Netflix because of the selection of the movies. I understand license agreements are very expensive and probably have a lot of red tape involved, but that is no excuse for "C" movie selection. If I were to clear out all the mov
review:
I am very dissatisfied with Netflix because of the selection of the movies. I understand license agreements are very expensive and probably have a lot of red tape involved, but that is no excuse for "C" movie selection. If I were to clear out all the movies I would not watch unless had insomnia, I might have 2-3 newer movies. I use the word "newer" to describe a newly released DVDs, a month and a half later. If I had to guess, it seems Netflix got a deal on the rights of foreign movies. (Korean, German, etc) Some of the best movies I've ever seen were subtitled movies, but that is not the case with Netflix's selection.
Read full review

preview: Netflix contacted me via Email to inform there was a problem with my PayPal account (there isn't) and that I needed to update my Payment Method. Though there is/was nothing wrong with my Paypal account (continues to work), I decided to switch to a Amex c
review:
Netflix contacted me via Email to inform there was a problem with my PayPal account (there isn't) and that I needed to update my Payment Method. Though there is/was nothing wrong with my Paypal account (continues to work), I decided to switch to a Amex card, just to expedite the process. I immediately received verification that my payment method (Update) was verified a success. I couldn't access my Netflix account! HUH???
Read full review

preview: I have been a Netflix customer for maybe 2 years now. I like the contents and very good price but yesterday when I was relaxing after a hard days work I couldn't get on. Kept ask in me if I was a customer...hello, who's paying the bill here? I was asked
review:
I have been a Netflix customer for maybe 2 years now. I like the contents and very good price but yesterday when I was relaxing after a hard days work I couldn't get on. Kept ask in me if I was a customer...hello, who's paying the bill here? I was asked to provide my email and password that I no longer even use before I could watch anything. No longer had that email or password so ask my name and address please. I was so aggravated. I told them to cut me off. Sales assoc not very helpful but I'm sure she was following protocol.
Read full review

preview: I have been experiencing a lot of streaming problems with NetFlix. While with some shows it may happen once or twice, with others it happens so frequently that I am forced to turn the show off. I have been a loyal customer of NetFlix for many years. They
review: I have been experiencing a lot of streaming problems with NetFlix. While with some shows it may happen once or twice, with others it happens so frequently that I am forced to turn the show off. I have been a loyal customer of NetFlix for many years. They used to be a great company. If this problem continues, I plan to drop them.

preview: I've had Netflix for just about a year and during the last five months, I've had severe problems with being in the process of watching a show/movie & it constantly gets interfered with buffering. Then after buffering a few times, it gets a screen that sa
review: I've had Netflix for just about a year and during the last five months, I've had severe problems with being in the process of watching a show/movie & it constantly gets interfered with buffering. Then after buffering a few times, it gets a screen that says "unable to connect you to Netflix. Please try again." I've went to their help site, did what it said many times for troubleshooting, and still no luck! I give up and I am canceling them!

preview: I called customer service this morning because of some billing issue, thought there was money in my account to make the payment. The representative was not only unhelpful but rude, not even allowing me to finish my sentence before interrupting me to chim
review: I called customer service this morning because of some billing issue, thought there was money in my account to make the payment. The representative was not only unhelpful but rude, not even allowing me to finish my sentence before interrupting me to chime in on how Netflix was unable to help me resolve the issue today and I would have to wait 24 hours to have a possibility of a resolution. Then even suggested I cancel my account and start a new one, which would waive my loyalty price till 2016 and bump it up to what all the new members are paying. So a recap... Rude representative, wanting a loyal customer to cancel a loyal account to make a new one despite my protest, no resolution as of yet.

preview: Called Netflix, spent 10 minutes talking to a rude robot of a woman. I told her for the last month or two, I have not been getting movies at the top of my Queue. She said, "If you are waiting for new movies, many have a LONG WAIT TIME and there is nothin
review:
Called Netflix, spent 10 minutes talking to a rude robot of a woman. I told her for the last month or two, I have not been getting movies at the top of my Queue. She said, "If you are waiting for new movies, many have a LONG WAIT TIME and there is nothing we can do." The only movies available to send out is grade B movies and that I needed to put more movies in my Queue. To clarify, I said, "Do you mean movies other than new releases?", and she said that I should reduce the number of New Releases since I'm paying for 3.
Read full review

preview: Netflix is billing me. I don't have an account with them. The bank has reversed a payment, but the payments still reoccur every month. If you don't have an account you cannot contact them. If I log on their website it just states that Netflix is not avai
review: Netflix is billing me. I don't have an account with them. The bank has reversed a payment, but the payments still reoccur every month. If you don't have an account you cannot contact them. If I log on their website it just states that Netflix is not available in your country. Please help.

preview: I bought their products, a Roku, and signed up for Netflix. But just the service where I pick movies from my TV to watch. Somehow I signed up for the DVD rental service too. I didn't know it was a trial version where they would charge me forever for some
review: I bought their products, a Roku, and signed up for Netflix. But just the service where I pick movies from my TV to watch. Somehow I signed up for the DVD rental service too. I didn't know it was a trial version where they would charge me forever for something I wasn't aware I had signed up for or was using. They would have charged me indefinitely if I hadn't called them and told them I don't want it. I called them and told them they have a good service and we could continue to cultivate good business if they would refund me for the service they charged me for which I didn't know I was being charged for. But they wouldn't refund anything and I had to cancel the service I was aware of and wanted because they refused to refund me for charging me for something I wasn't aware they were charging me for. They should have refunded me and then they would have gotten more business from me. But, it's done now and I can't give them business anymore because of their unprofessionalism.

preview: My girlfriend got a Netflix account LAST NIGHT and I watched movies last night without problems, so I was pretty excited. Today, nothing from Netflix plays on my TV and it doesn't even play movies well on my computer either... The picture cannot keep up
review: My girlfriend got a Netflix account LAST NIGHT and I watched movies last night without problems, so I was pretty excited. Today, nothing from Netflix plays on my TV and it doesn't even play movies well on my computer either... The picture cannot keep up with the audio. This ** sucks. I'm pissed.

preview: We've had Netflix for over 2 yrs now. Lately been getting really sick of not being able to watch a movie (DVD) because it stalls, skips, generally unplayable. We've received many in the mail lately that are visibly broken in 2... cracked all the way thru
review: We've had Netflix for over 2 yrs now. Lately been getting really sick of not being able to watch a movie (DVD) because it stalls, skips, generally unplayable. We've received many in the mail lately that are visibly broken in 2... cracked all the way thru. Most are coming terribly scratched and unplayable. They are however good at sending a replacement DVD immediately; however, when you get 2 or 3 that are damaged, how do you spend your 'movie night' with no movies to watch because they're all damaged? Phone inquiry - they state DVD must have gotten broken in mail transit? Really? I don't think so. Shipping warehouse needs to do inspection before shipping out! NOT HAPPY and considering changing DVD home service, but how do I know that Blockbuster or others would be any better?

preview: Well, I wasn't impressed with their movie selection from the beginning. They have a lot of movies that never aired in theaters and that most people don't care to watch. What really ticked me off though.. I realized they had been charging me double for th
review:
Well, I wasn't impressed with their movie selection from the beginning. They have a lot of movies that never aired in theaters and that most people don't care to watch. What really ticked me off though.. I realized they had been charging me double for the past year. I called to get a refund, but when they kept saying they couldn't help me, and that I had to go through my bank to stop payment (but not get a refund for the past year), I started to get upset. The rep said she could tell I was getting upset, so she was going to put me on hold so I could cool off and she'd get back to me shortly... Yeah... that really calms someone down. I was SO pissed off, I couldn't even stay on the line anymore.
Read full review

preview: When viewing anything on Netflix, it constantly buffers. I contacted Netflix support and they said it has to be something with my connection. I have also seen other customer reviews with the same complaint.
review: When viewing anything on Netflix, it constantly buffers. I contacted Netflix support and they said it has to be something with my connection. I have also seen other customer reviews with the same complaint.

preview: I have a Roku 2 HD streaming media player and when I first got it two years ago, Hulu Plus had some streaming and loading problems and Netflix had none. Now Netflix consistently has a "Loading, Please wait" problems and Hulu has no problems nor does U-tu
review: I have a Roku 2 HD streaming media player and when I first got it two years ago, Hulu Plus had some streaming and loading problems and Netflix had none. Now Netflix consistently has a "Loading, Please wait" problems and Hulu has no problems nor does U-tube. I have read up on this problem on other forums and it has to do with when Netflix merged with Comcast and issues revolve around an issue called peering. Money is involved too... l saw the terms "who pays who" mentioned. Tonight I watched 3 programs on Netflix that did not stall and two that did, so the service seems to be getting better. Maybe Netflix reads these discussions and is working hard to solve the problem.

preview: When viewing anything on Netflix, it constantly buffers. I contacted Netflix support and they said it has to be something with my connection. I know that is not it because my daughter has the same problem and she has a wonderful connection. I have also s
review: When viewing anything on Netflix, it constantly buffers. I contacted Netflix support and they said it has to be something with my connection. I know that is not it because my daughter has the same problem and she has a wonderful connection. I have also seen other customer reviews with the same complaint. They won't do anything about it and I'm tired of paying $7.99 a month for something I can't even see. They are about to lose a long time customer over this issue.

preview: I have never been a Netflix customer, not even one day, never had one single account created by me, no trial account, never given them my c/c number. And three days ago, they managed to steal $7.99 from my Amex account. Luckily I caught them the the next
review: I have never been a Netflix customer, not even one day, never had one single account created by me, no trial account, never given them my c/c number. And three days ago, they managed to steal $7.99 from my Amex account. Luckily I caught them the the next day, and disputed the charge with Amex, and got the refund. I hope they go to jail!

preview: I have been charge double on my account for the past four months. When I called, they can only take off one month of charges. This is fraud. They are stealing money. How do I know this won't happen again? I have filled a dispute with my credit card compa
review: I have been charge double on my account for the past four months. When I called, they can only take off one month of charges. This is fraud. They are stealing money. How do I know this won't happen again? I have filled a dispute with my credit card company.

preview: Netflix double billing Sept 2013 - May 2014. I called customer service May 19, 2014. Spoke to supervisor - double billing because I inputted my email address incorrectly by one letter which setup additional account. Supervisor says nothing he can do, his
review: Netflix double billing Sept 2013 - May 2014. I called customer service May 19, 2014. Spoke to supervisor - double billing because I inputted my email address incorrectly by one letter which setup additional account. Supervisor says nothing he can do, his system doesn't allow a refund more than one month (crock of **. I thought what a scam). You enter CC info, name and password and there sftw doesn't flag you for account already used. BS. I cancelled on the spot. What a scam.

preview: When watching a Netflix movie, it stalls many times. They keep blaming Verizon even after I tell them my router and modem are brand new, and even when it's been all over the news that there are issues with bandwidth between Verizon and Netflix. Something
review: When watching a Netflix movie, it stalls many times. They keep blaming Verizon even after I tell them my router and modem are brand new, and even when it's been all over the news that there are issues with bandwidth between Verizon and Netflix. Something needs to eventually be done before I lose it, plain and simple. There has been many complaints by other people on this issue too.

preview: Same thing happened to me. My old email acct closed and I changed my email address and I updated my debit card no. When I do that, it asked me for a free month. I don't want to click on it, but there is no way to get around completing the change. I tried
review:
Same thing happened to me. My old email acct closed and I changed my email address and I updated my debit card no. When I do that, it asked me for a free month. I don't want to click on it, but there is no way to get around completing the change. I tried on diff device and pc, same thing. So I guess that must be the way to do it, so I clicked and completed the change. I checked and the new debit card is in and I had only 1 email address with Netflix. But found today that both accounts were charge for the last 6 months. When I called, Netflix blamed me for creating a new account.
Read full review

preview: Every month for the last 5 months, I have canceled Netflix Streaming service and still get charged every month. I make the call to their tech support and tell them the problem. Each time I'm told that I can only get my latest month's charges returned and
review: Every month for the last 5 months, I have canceled Netflix Streaming service and still get charged every month. I make the call to their tech support and tell them the problem. Each time I'm told that I can only get my latest month's charges returned and they will not take my credit card information off of their database.

preview: I tried to complain to Netflix that no matter what day of the week, or month or year, or day or night... EVERY time my family and I attempt to watch a movie on Netflix, it locks up, has that stupid loading logo, says that the title is not available even
review: I tried to complain to Netflix that no matter what day of the week, or month or year, or day or night... EVERY time my family and I attempt to watch a movie on Netflix, it locks up, has that stupid loading logo, says that the title is not available even though we just watched a part of that very movie, tells me to try another title - and I do, and it STILL does not work. And I'm tired of it. I would expect that with the money we are paying for their terrible service (and their customer service website is awful) that they would do better. Nope. And after reading some of the complaints on here from other customers, I can see that I am not the only one that has a problem. I know it is not our internet connection, because any other streaming service other than Netflix, works fine. It has also become apparent that Netflix doesn't give a damn about their customers either.

preview: I sent in my 2 DVDs and then canceled my account. I still had 25 days left on my account paid for. Netflix will not send me a DVD. Quite a rip off.
review: I sent in my 2 DVDs and then canceled my account. I still had 25 days left on my account paid for. Netflix will not send me a DVD. Quite a rip off.

preview: I have been a customer of Netflix ever since they dropped the DVD postings as part of the package, so for a long time. I was pretty satisfied until recently when they pulled 'Monk', and I could no longer get it. 100 episodes, I was getting into it, and t
review:
I have been a customer of Netflix ever since they dropped the DVD postings as part of the package, so for a long time. I was pretty satisfied until recently when they pulled 'Monk', and I could no longer get it. 100 episodes, I was getting into it, and they pulled it. Tonight, I see they removed 24. Really? Again? I am mad enough to spit nails. Once again, I started a TV series and, damn it, just as I was getting into it, around the 6th or 7th episode, they ** remove it. Now, I am gun shy about starting any TV series, at least the ones that have a continuing story line.
Read full review

preview: I have been pleased with my Netflix service up until a few weeks ago when I started getting error messages regarding my email address. I have been using the same email and have never changed it. I am not sure whether to go in and create a new password on
review: I have been pleased with my Netflix service up until a few weeks ago when I started getting error messages regarding my email address. I have been using the same email and have never changed it. I am not sure whether to go in and create a new password on the pop up screen that comes up when I click on "forgot password" or whatever. Reading that many others are experiencing this problem, I hope that Netflix will DO SOMETHING to fix this problem and advise its customers. I'm very suspicious at this point.

preview: I decided to get Netflix after hearing so many positive reviews from people that I knew. I got my account back when they were offering streaming and DVD in the same package for just $10.00/month. Honestly, It was a deal. I took advantage of that service
review:
I decided to get Netflix after hearing so many positive reviews from people that I knew. I got my account back when they were offering streaming and DVD in the same package for just $10.00/month. Honestly, It was a deal. I took advantage of that service and still do, only without the DVDs. The stream selection was good enough and the DVD selection made up for what the stream was lacking. I ended up having a lot of free time after work and weekends, due to putting myself on a strong no spending, cut debt program. So Netflix served as great entertainment for those days spent at home. I would invite friends over and we would watch movies on stream or I would get a DVD within days. Overall, my experience was positive. I never had an experience of a DVD been lost in the mail or anything like that. The stream has crashed a couple of times since I've had it but no big deal.
Read full review

preview: We've had Netflix for several months. We had to download some kind of update. Then spent 30 minutes trying to log in with our password. After being frustrated, we called customer service who was less than helpful. I cancelled. The woman couldn't care les
review: We've had Netflix for several months. We had to download some kind of update. Then spent 30 minutes trying to log in with our password. After being frustrated, we called customer service who was less than helpful. I cancelled. The woman couldn't care less. How much aggravation should you have to go thru just to watch a TV Show?

preview: My DVD queue continually shows my email address is invalid. I have been getting emails from Netflix for months. My email address is the same and is correct on my Netflix account. I update it anyway to turn off error message but it continues to say invali
review: My DVD queue continually shows my email address is invalid. I have been getting emails from Netflix for months. My email address is the same and is correct on my Netflix account. I update it anyway to turn off error message but it continues to say invalid email address. Clearly a Netflix problem. But what pisses me off is I can't contact them except by phone. I don't want to waste time on a call. I just want to send an email. I think it's BS they don't have email or chat. Security concerns my **. They don't want to deal with their subscribers.

preview: My wife keeps getting a message when logging into her NETFLIX ACCOUNT. IT STATES THAT HER E-MAIL/PASSWORD IS INVALID. She is able to access her Queue and set up our movies. I had said to her not to worry about it, that it is most likely a SCAM! Thank You
review: My wife keeps getting a message when logging into her NETFLIX ACCOUNT. IT STATES THAT HER E-MAIL/PASSWORD IS INVALID. She is able to access her Queue and set up our movies. I had said to her not to worry about it, that it is most likely a SCAM! Thank You, for the info. It's about time we put the squeeze on these Scamming Scumbags!

preview: I was sent an email by netflix telling me to restart my new free month. I actually stopped using their service and cancelled my subscription about a year ago. On clicking the restart my free month link and following the request to reactivate my account,
review: I was sent an email by netflix telling me to restart my new free month. I actually stopped using their service and cancelled my subscription about a year ago. On clicking the restart my free month link and following the request to reactivate my account, I realized I had just been billed 7.99 euros. I started a chat on their customer service immediately only to be told that there was a problem with the system. I also checked online for similar cases and realized I wasn't the only one been scammed in the same way. What can I do cause I feel duped. I have a transcript of the chat which was sent to me on request. Is there no way to sue this frauds? I have attached copies of the chat here. Sorry I had to snip tool them in bits as it was not sent to as an attachment or file.

preview: While reviewing our bank account statements for tax season, we discovered double billing too - from Oct 2013 to Mar 2014. Found out from Netflix that someone had been watching streaming movies on our account. Their response: 1 month refund. No hack in ou
review: While reviewing our bank account statements for tax season, we discovered double billing too - from Oct 2013 to Mar 2014. Found out from Netflix that someone had been watching streaming movies on our account. Their response: 1 month refund. No hack in our computer or devices - their system is flawed. They wouldn't even see if the usage was on any device with serial numbers not matching our TV, computers, etc. Customer service said corporate wouldn't help. We have to call them tomorrow. Wasn't there a lawsuit a few years ago with these morons? Apparently there are plenty of victims. Count us in on any class action.

preview: Over charge bill from netflix - Will someone please explain to me how netflix bill work. With this month my account was deducted three times.
review: Over charge bill from netflix - Will someone please explain to me how netflix bill work. With this month my account was deducted three times.

preview: Netflix just told me they no longer accept government issued cards, child support cards, disability cards so and so worth. This is just wrong. How and who are they to tell me how to spend my money???? I have canceled Netflix and am now on red box where I
review: Netflix just told me they no longer accept government issued cards, child support cards, disability cards so and so worth. This is just wrong. How and who are they to tell me how to spend my money???? I have canceled Netflix and am now on red box where I can use any card I choose. The cards are ours, why not use them the way we wish to???

preview: I got nowhere with them, it's a sham.
review: I got nowhere with them, it's a sham.

preview: I had obtained a new laptop and I got 1 month free of Netflix with it. Once I opened Netflix up it said I would not be charged at the end of the month. I only had used my "free" Netflix a few times and before I know it the month was up. A couple days lat
review: I had obtained a new laptop and I got 1 month free of Netflix with it. Once I opened Netflix up it said I would not be charged at the end of the month. I only had used my "free" Netflix a few times and before I know it the month was up. A couple days later I check my bank account and I have a charge of $30ish dollars. First off, that makes no sense. How the hell were they able to arrive at that amount? Second, I was told BEFORE I signed up for the FREE month that I would not be charged at the end of the month. But, no. So I write them an email explaining what happened. In their response I was told I could not receive a refund of any sort. That just made me more angry. To this day I have not used Netflix once because I don't want to be screwed over again.

preview: I have also been charged for multiple accounts. As well as multiple charges within one billing cycle for one account. This has been going on for two years. I have contacted Netflix multiple times and receive the same 'blah-blah-blah'. Just this month, I
review: I have also been charged for multiple accounts. As well as multiple charges within one billing cycle for one account. This has been going on for two years. I have contacted Netflix multiple times and receive the same 'blah-blah-blah'. Just this month, I have been billed 3 times for $17.48 on one credit card and 2 times for $13.13 on another credit card. When I contacted Netflix via Chat earlier this month I was again told they would credit my account and close the "never used nor authorized" account. A few days later additional charges (not credits) were made on my credit cards. We need a direct line/contact we need to get their attention via Social Media and other consumer rights avenues.

preview: Netflix over charged me for over a year by charging 2 different accounts even though one had no account activity on it. Once I finally realized it, I complained and was told they would only refund 2 months’ worth of charges on one of the accounts. I told
review:
Netflix over charged me for over a year by charging 2 different accounts even though one had no account activity on it. Once I finally realized it, I complained and was told they would only refund 2 months’ worth of charges on one of the accounts. I told them to close the accounts so I would not be charged any more. After some time I wanted to sign up for Netflix to watch a show that is only available on cable which I don't have and Netflix. When I tried to sign up, I was told a permanent block was put on my debit card and my account was listed as having fraudulent activity. There was no fraudulent activity except on Netflix's account and I never told them to put a hold on my card. They refuse to take the block off of my card or take the fraud label off of the account. I suppose so they can try to justify overcharging me for so long.
Read full review

preview: I have been being charged twice every month on my credit card for Netflix service for 2 years now, ever since going to streaming instead of CDs. I called them and they said they only show that I was being charged once a month and said they searched their
review: I have been being charged twice every month on my credit card for Netflix service for 2 years now, ever since going to streaming instead of CDs. I called them and they said they only show that I was being charged once a month and said they searched their entire system and they have no other charges under my number. I called the credit card company and they investigated with me. They found that it had been going on since Jan. of 2012. This is now Jan. 2014. I didn't realize it had been that long. I procrastinated on this for a few months but they refuse to admit that they are double charging us. I cancelled that card number out of Netflix and we're still getting charged. I am out $191 so far, need to see if it comes through again this month. If someone decided to do a class action suit, I'm in as long as I don't have to lay out any more money.

preview: I am furious. I only realized today that I was being billed for the past year. I cancelled my account online - and specifically remember doing so - only to realize that they have been billing me anyways. That is over 100 dollars that they have STOLEN FRO
review: I am furious. I only realized today that I was being billed for the past year. I cancelled my account online - and specifically remember doing so - only to realize that they have been billing me anyways. That is over 100 dollars that they have STOLEN FROM ME. I called customer service today and asked them to double-check if something went wrong with their computer and if they could refund it. Turns out, they really don't care and all they'll do is refund this month's charge. She saw that there was no activity on the account for the past year except for a password reset - which is when I tried to make sure again that the account was cancelled a week or so after having cancelled it as I have heard horror stories about Netflix. They can see that, but not my cancellation???? I would like to join the class action suit!!!

preview: I started receiving 4 discs just recently and when I looked at my account, I have been paying more than what they would charge for that plan. My plan is 3 discs and until recently I only got three. The four plan is around 21 dollars and I've noticed that
review: I started receiving 4 discs just recently and when I looked at my account, I have been paying more than what they would charge for that plan. My plan is 3 discs and until recently I only got three. The four plan is around 21 dollars and I've noticed that I've been paying 25 and change since July of 2013 and it's now Jan. WTF is up that?

preview: The biggest problem I have is waiting months for newer titles to be sent. It didn't used to be like this. I guess there are too many customers and too few discs. The two main excuses for this problem are: 1) Netflix has two few copies of said title; 2) P
review: The biggest problem I have is waiting months for newer titles to be sent. It didn't used to be like this. I guess there are too many customers and too few discs. The two main excuses for this problem are: 1) Netflix has two few copies of said title; 2) People tend to hold onto the discs for a long time (an excuse I'm not sure is accurate). I'm getting ready to look at what Blockbuster has to offer after being a Netflix customer for many years.

preview: I have an 8 disc out a time plan with Blu Ray. 2 discs were scratched and unwatchable, seems to be quite the norm these days. I reported both discs. The website said that a new disc was shipped but neither arrived after 5-7 days. I reported them missing.
review:
I have an 8 disc out a time plan with Blu Ray. 2 discs were scratched and unwatchable, seems to be quite the norm these days. I reported both discs. The website said that a new disc was shipped but neither arrived after 5-7 days. I reported them missing. Being concerned for them, I called to let them know that there were discs that haven't arrived. Next thing I know, they blocked my account! I called and they unblocked the account but it was unpleasant enough. One of the rep I spoke to even tried to pin it on me and saying things like "I'm going to call the USPS and find out why our discs are missing." I told him "Good, please do that."
Read full review

preview: The movie I really wanted to see did not work at all, even after I had wiped it as they suggested. This is the SECOND time I got the same problem, since I asked them to send me another one when the first one did not work. This time I asked them to send t
review:
The movie I really wanted to see did not work at all, even after I had wiped it as they suggested. This is the SECOND time I got the same problem, since I asked them to send me another one when the first one did not work. This time I asked them to send the next one in line, even though I would really like to see the film. Complaint is that this is the SECOND time such a thing occurred. Once before, I asked them to send me another copy of the same film and the same thing happened. Are they sending me the same film over again, not paying any attention to damaged DVDs being returned to them unplayable?
Read full review

preview: I use FIOS 50mbps/25mbps. Have a hard wire ethernet to the back of a Sony BD player from the FIOS router. Yet, Netflix still has to go into buffering mode frequently while streaming a movie or TV show. I'm also an Amazon Prime streaming customer and thei
review: I use FIOS 50mbps/25mbps. Have a hard wire ethernet to the back of a Sony BD player from the FIOS router. Yet, Netflix still has to go into buffering mode frequently while streaming a movie or TV show. I'm also an Amazon Prime streaming customer and their service almost never has this problem even at peak viewing periods. Thus, I know it has nothing to do with my connection. Netflix just doesn't have the capacity it needs to stream smoothly. They'd better fix this soon or other better competition will render them obsolete. And no, I'm not an Amazon employee. I'm a developer for Apple.

preview: I contacted Netflix Dec 30th 2013 with TV Shows Requests like always and an agent told me if I keep requesting content, that I would be blocked from using Netflix Canada that I’ve been paying non stop since 2010 or 2011. Then later in the chat a Supervis
review:
I contacted Netflix Dec 30th 2013 with TV Shows Requests like always and an agent told me if I keep requesting content, that I would be blocked from using Netflix Canada that I’ve been paying non stop since 2010 or 2011. Then later in the chat a Supervisor named Mike joined the chat, told me I would be blocked from using my Netflix account if I keep requesting content to Netflix Canada since it is a Support line and not a Request line. I have been requesting content non stop since Oct 3 times a day, now on Dec 30th it's a problem all of a sudden and I need to request once a month only that's what Supervisor Mike told me in our 2-hour convo. May I remind you Netflix Canada that I contacted many times to fix your Mailto Buttons with the transcripts which I only for 4 mins of my 2-hour chat with Netflix. For some reason since it's still broken and I contact the moment I see anything wrong with the website or the uploaded content to Netflix Canada, like Fast Five is missing 47 mins of dialog since it has no subtitles in English when they speak Spanish, and A Good Day to Die Hard - same problem, just no English subtitles when they speak Russian.

preview: The only time you can watch Netflix is when you are not home. As soon as you are home, so are Netflix customers. Their network just cannot support the service, and it is virtually impossible to watch anything. All you watch is the buffering icon pretendi
review: The only time you can watch Netflix is when you are not home. As soon as you are home, so are Netflix customers. Their network just cannot support the service, and it is virtually impossible to watch anything. All you watch is the buffering icon pretending to work. Netflix is absolutely worthless.

preview: Netflix has been double billing me for months (after I requested that the double billing be remedied). They were unable to find my double accounts via my name and had to check via the credit card #. They could have done this back in March when I called,
review: Netflix has been double billing me for months (after I requested that the double billing be remedied). They were unable to find my double accounts via my name and had to check via the credit card #. They could have done this back in March when I called, but did not. They are now waffling about whether or not I will get a refund for anything else but last month's double billing. I will definitely cancel my membership if the refund is not for the complete amount. Especially since I've called about this problem already. This is not the way to keep customers.

review: So I just subscribed to my Netflix free trial month. Only 5 days later when I log in, it says, "You have already used up your free trial and have to change your payment method." I joined Netflix on the 19th of this month, and I have never used it before so I'm kind of curious as to why some ** like that would happen. Screw, Netflix. Pirate Bay all day everyday.

preview: I accidentally returned a Redbox DVD to Netflix. I called Netflix right away and within 12 hours, they located the disc and are mailing it back to me (at their expense). Although the disc selection isn't the best and I have to wait for new releases, thei
review: I accidentally returned a Redbox DVD to Netflix. I called Netflix right away and within 12 hours, they located the disc and are mailing it back to me (at their expense). Although the disc selection isn't the best and I have to wait for new releases, their customer service is great!

preview: I received an offer of returning to Netflix at $7.99 a month. My last transaction with the company was in 2010 and that has long been replaced. But... on the pre-filled registration form a credit card I received in 2012 had been inserted in the credit ca
review: I received an offer of returning to Netflix at $7.99 a month. My last transaction with the company was in 2010 and that has long been replaced. But... on the pre-filled registration form a credit card I received in 2012 had been inserted in the credit card field. There is NO way this information would be available to Netflix unless they have gotten the information from a 3rd party merchant, and I only give my card # to big companies. SO.. Netflix is a great try out for the validity of a credit card $7.99 (who looks at that?). Netflix was totally "I don't care about it... you gave us the number..." A number I didn't have in 2010. And Citibank just bailed out with a get a new card that one was compromised. IMAGINE Netflix being used as a guinea pig for stolen credit cards. SOMETHING strange going on at Netflix.

preview: The service works well, but at what price? I can't believe they can't verify that they are charging the same customer, me, on 2 different credit cards! I'm sure I cancelled my original trial account before beginning the second and I was being charged for
review: The service works well, but at what price? I can't believe they can't verify that they are charging the same customer, me, on 2 different credit cards! I'm sure I cancelled my original trial account before beginning the second and I was being charged for 2 accounts all year until I just happened to be in my Netflix account and noticed the credit card # was different than the credit card account I was looking at their charge on. They say they only have an Email address and Credit Card number - No name, billing address or anything else to identify their customers on - insane!!!

preview: I signed up for a free trial and cancelled it within the 30 days, and everything worked fine for me. I went online to cancel with no hassle. I made sure to check my bank statement and never got unauthorized charges. So I have no complaints at all regardi
review: I signed up for a free trial and cancelled it within the 30 days, and everything worked fine for me. I went online to cancel with no hassle. I made sure to check my bank statement and never got unauthorized charges. So I have no complaints at all regarding cost. As a matter of fact, they emailed me with another free trial offer which I took advantage of. If I did have any complaint it would be about the quality of the movies streaming. Lots of buffering. However that could also be combination of web browser support as well. But from my experience, as long as your read the fine print, follow directions and cancel in the allotted trial time, you shouldn't have any problems.

preview: Netflix sucks, checked my bank today they charged me $30 but yet I cancelled my account 2 months ago??? SCUMBAGS.
review: Netflix sucks, checked my bank today they charged me $30 but yet I cancelled my account 2 months ago??? SCUMBAGS.

preview: I've tried several times to have a stable Netflix streaming-only account. For the first few months, all goes well. Monthly payments go smoothly. Suddenly, I see double payments showing up on my bank account. I try to clear it up. For a while, all goes we
review:
I've tried several times to have a stable Netflix streaming-only account. For the first few months, all goes well. Monthly payments go smoothly. Suddenly, I see double payments showing up on my bank account. I try to clear it up. For a while, all goes well, until two payments for one month show up a few days apart in the same billing cycle. I cancel... then later, I try again, but the same thing happens. I added the cheapest DVD account they have, hoping to solve the problem. Their computer would surely be tripping over itself with two streaming-only accounts and plus one DVD account on one computer. Outrageous results, but I instigated it, knowing that their accounting on my service was screwed up.
Read full review

preview: In April of this year my son signed me up for the 1 month trial - letting me know that in May if I wanted to cancel - I would need to call and do so. In May of this year I called and requested to continue the service but changed the account to my name (s
review:
In April of this year my son signed me up for the 1 month trial - letting me know that in May if I wanted to cancel - I would need to call and do so. In May of this year I called and requested to continue the service but changed the account to my name (same debit card account number) and requested to cancel the original subscription under my son's name. The original account was never canceled; however, they were diligent in setting up the new account in addition to the previous one. As a result I have been double charged for 6 months.

preview: I signed up for Netflix in October 2013 and chose only one DVD at a time via mail, using my debit card. In October 2013, I was charged 3 separate amounts by Netflix: $8.60, $9.19, and $8.47. I spoke with a rep via phone and was told my acct would be cred
review:
I signed up for Netflix in October 2013 and chose only one DVD at a time via mail, using my debit card. In October 2013, I was charged 3 separate amounts by Netflix: $8.60, $9.19, and $8.47. I spoke with a rep via phone and was told my acct would be credited properly. That seemed to work. One charge that wasn't correct was refunded, but the mysterious amount, $9.19 was NOT refunded. I decided to stick with them, and this month, November, I'm screwed again by Netflix. On 11/10/13, Netflix billed my bank acct for $8.60 and on 11/12/13, yesterday, I was charged $8.47.
Read full review

preview: I just started seeing the exact same thing last month. I am amazed at the number of people who don't check their credit card & bank statements daily, as only takes 5-10 minutes. I noticed two charges, same day that was not normal billing date. Called Net
review:
I just started seeing the exact same thing last month. I am amazed at the number of people who don't check their credit card & bank statements daily, as only takes 5-10 minutes. I noticed two charges, same day that was not normal billing date. Called Netflix, got the same run around about they only see one charge, and must be credit card company. Credit card companies don't initiate charges unless for a fee.
Read full review

preview: Netflix apparently has a regular policy of double billing. The two charges appear on the same day on your credit card, with different reference numbers. Netflix says they have no record of the double billing or of the reference numbers. They tell you to
review:
Netflix apparently has a regular policy of double billing. The two charges appear on the same day on your credit card, with different reference numbers. Netflix says they have no record of the double billing or of the reference numbers. They tell you to blame the credit card company. There are a lot of other people complaining about this on the web. If you try to kill the account and open another account, they continue to bill the first account as well as the new account. They do not close accounts when you request it after their history of double billing.
Read full review

preview: I initially canceled my account due to poor selections on the movie menu. Everything to choose from was either really old, or one of those dumb spoof-type movies that you've never heard of that go straight to DVD. After two months, I noticed I was still
review: I initially canceled my account due to poor selections on the movie menu. Everything to choose from was either really old, or one of those dumb spoof-type movies that you've never heard of that go straight to DVD. After two months, I noticed I was still being charged. I called customer service and they told me that a "stupid hacker kid" had gotten my info, opened an account and charged it to my card. How in the world does a hacker get my info? From their database. It seems like Netflix needs to work on their security. I will be receiving a refund, but the entire experience was subpar. I would not recommend this service to others. Go to Redbox instead.

preview: I'm not understanding why there is not more discussion about the fact that the Netflix apps do not allow a user to browse their full library? When you log in to a Netflix app you are limited to seeing the titles listed that they want you to see. If you w
review:
I'm not understanding why there is not more discussion about the fact that the Netflix apps do not allow a user to browse their full library? When you log in to a Netflix app you are limited to seeing the titles listed that they want you to see. If you want to search their entire library to find something to watch...you still have to go to their website...search...put the movie in your "list" (queue)...then access that title on the device running the Netflix app.

preview: I received a damaged disc. It had a 'bad spot' when I played it and I could see a long scratch on the disc. I tested it on my PC and the results showed bad spots. I went online and reported the bad disc, but I made the mistake of sending the bad disc bac
review:
I received a damaged disc. It had a 'bad spot' when I played it and I could see a long scratch on the disc. I tested it on my PC and the results showed bad spots. I went online and reported the bad disc, but I made the mistake of sending the bad disc back to Netflix before they sent out the replacement. When the replacement arrived, I noticed that it had the same scratch on the disc and when I tested it, it had the same bad spots on it. This is not the first time this has happened. Anyway, when I called to complain, they apologized and said they would send out a replacement ASAP and would also send the next DVD in my queue along with it.
Read full review

preview: I am waiting for the class action lawsuit against Netflix. We too have been duped by being double charged for their service. We signed up with Netflix in June 2012. Had issues logging into the network and with the advice of the Netflix phone operator, we
review: I am waiting for the class action lawsuit against Netflix. We too have been duped by being double charged for their service. We signed up with Netflix in June 2012. Had issues logging into the network and with the advice of the Netflix phone operator, we cancelled the service and reopened a new one. The first one was to be closed out. Never was. We have been billed twice each month for over a year. Our credit card company was awesome in trying to handle this but Netflix will only refund a one month fee. For what it's worth, letters are going out to let the affected parties know that this deceitful behavior on the consumer is inexcusable!

review: I've been with Netflix for many, many years. My son is now 5 and starting to use my Android tablet to watch Netflix. I talked to Netflix a month ago about this and they just said it's in the works and to be patient. They released kids mode for the iPad a year ago. Why can't they finish up the Android version?

review: I got an email today from Netflix letting me know the payment that didn't go through earlier this month had gone through. I was confused because I had canceled the service at the beginning of the year. I signed on to Chat and communicated this with one of their specialists. They refused to refund anything but one month even though I was unaware of the service and HAD NEVER USED IT!!!!! They do not send out any reminders to let you know you're going to be or have been charged!!!! They are one of those companies that try to get as much money out of you as possible any and every way they can!!! I hope they choke on that money and go belly up.

It's a real pain. If Netflix can't get their act together, I will cancel my subscription to their website. IT JUST ISN'T WORTH WASTING OUR TIME TRYING TO ENJOY A MOVIE. At this time, I can NOT recommend anyone to subscribe to Netflix!!!

review: It started when they said it wasn’t the right password when I had to log in, and when I put my password in they told me it wasn’t right. We did this 5 or 6 times; still the same thing, so they told me to go to my e-mail and change my password. So I go to e-mail to do this and then my e-mail made me change my e-mail but I kept my same password. So I call Netflix and I gave them my new e-mail; they said ok. So then I thought everything was alright and tried to watch some movies and they told me the same thing. Since then, I have gotten side tracked and forgot to cancel and that was about 5 months ago.

review: I watch a lot of anime on Netflix, and I find many shows that I'd like to watch more of but can never find the second season. Netflix is my only resource for these shows and all of them only contain the first season no matter how long they've been around. I'd like to see them change this because I know I'm not the only one with this problem.

preview: I'm having trouble getting movies that I want to see. Instead of it being a short wait and then I get the movie, it goes from short wait to long wait to very long wait. It should be the other way around. Also they advertise Anime series only to find out
review: I'm having trouble getting movies that I want to see. Instead of it being a short wait and then I get the movie, it goes from short wait to long wait to very long wait. It should be the other way around. Also they advertise Anime series only to find out that they don't have the complete series. Several are missing volumes in between. I've been with Netflix for a while and the service has gone downhill. Customer Service gives you the runaround and they really don't care.They say that the "Waits" are just a formality and it never takes long to get a movie. What a crock of crap. I haven't been able to watch a new release all summer from Netflix because Short Waits last for months at a time and then jump to long and very long. I'm thinking of switching to Blockbuster.

review:

About 6 months later they discontinued it with a promise to get another movie channel witch didn't happen. My rates didn't go down but increased... To make people think they have gotten new movies the simply change the movie cover picture. Like that fools anyone.

preview: I am disabled. I used to have a Netflix account and cancelled it in Feb. 2013. I was checking my account because things didn't add up and found I was still being charged $8.31 every month. I spoke to a Daniel and the supposed floor manager, Mike, today,
review:
I am disabled. I used to have a Netflix account and cancelled it in Feb. 2013. I was checking my account because things didn't add up and found I was still being charged $8.31 every month. I spoke to a Daniel and the supposed floor manager, Mike, today, 8-7-13, to get to the bottom of it. First, I was told they had to receive a call to cancel. I told them this was B.S as it stated on the website "for faster cancellation service, enter the account # at the bottom of the page." Then I was told that I had two accounts. I told them I knew I had an old account that was cancelled over a year prior but was not being charged for a second account and I knew nothing about it, hence did not care.
Read full review

review:
So about a year back, we got a free trial with Netflix. Service wasn't bad and we cancelled when our trial was over. A couple of months later, we try to get a free trial again. However, we are denied because it said the the card was already on file. So I'm thinking "Oh well, it didn't work." We didn't give it any thought after that. However, we just found out today that we have been getting billed for months now because we tried to set up a free trial. I mean like what gives, Jeeves?

review:
I had a Netcrap account for over a year. Beside the fact that they are not a good company, NO CUSTOMER SERVICE OF ANY KIND, and a constantly changing programs menu, and offer all too little in streaming programming, the bottom line here is this...THE SERVICE IS TOTAL GARBAGE!!! It started out decently, but as time went on, more and MORE AND MORE of their shows... would have one li'l devious problem...THE SOUND WAS OFF THE VIDEO BY ABOUT 40 TO 50 SECONDS!!! I am not interested in paying for a service that thinks that I ENJOY watching a disjointed experience like some sort of THIRD RATE KUNGFU MOVIE, you know the kind, where you watch the guys mouth, and his voice stops well before his mouth does? PRETTY MUCH RUINS ANY WATCHING EXPERIENCE!!!

preview: Seems like the first FREE month was great!! Loved it. Then afterwards all it is is problems. First: I click on Net flicks, click start. And while it's supposed to load and bring me into the lists of moves. It won't load and I'll be staring at a red scree
review: Seems like the first FREE month was great!! Loved it. Then afterwards all it is is problems. First: I click on Net flicks, click start. And while it's supposed to load and bring me into the lists of moves. It won't load and I'll be staring at a red screen with Netflix for about 5 minutes, until it tells me error. Secondly: once I ever do get into the list of shows, click on a movie, it freezes while trying to load the movie. Why pay for a service when there's no use? I believe if you're paying for a service, it shouldn't have any problems. Especially not as much as I've been having. This is BS!!!

preview: I have had Netflix off and on for about five years. I am mostly satisfied. However, I recently was charged two fees when I came back after canceling just a couple weeks ago. I found the 2 charges and called customer service (4 days before today). I was t
review: I have had Netflix off and on for about five years. I am mostly satisfied. However, I recently was charged two fees when I came back after canceling just a couple weeks ago. I found the 2 charges and called customer service (4 days before today). I was told that fee would go right back on my card. Four days later, it still has not. Also, they keep jumping around in my queue sending my DVDs that were NOT next on my list and were not any kind of wait. Getting ready to cancel again and not ever go back because of these two things.

preview: I signed up for the DVD free trial so I could watch the Avengers before going to see Iron Man 3. I only needed to see that ONE DVD. I sent the DVD directly from the post office, 3-5 days before I cancelled my DVD free-trial membership. I just checked my
review: I signed up for the DVD free trial so I could watch the Avengers before going to see Iron Man 3. I only needed to see that ONE DVD. I sent the DVD directly from the post office, 3-5 days before I cancelled my DVD free-trial membership. I just checked my account; I was charged for my streaming membership (as usual) AND for an "unreturned" DVD. I received no email, no phone call, nothing at all warning me that I'd be charged for a DVD that I mailed out but they didn't receive. They are refunding me, but I don't appreciate them charging me automatically for something that I do not have to pay for (if I wanted to keep a DVD, I can get 3 DVDs for $5 at the barber shop, lol). I very rarely check my account charges. If I wouldn't have checked, I wouldn't have ever seen the charge. I don't like that at all.

review:
We had a trial where we tried it. My kids liked it and we thought we would try it when we moved. I cancelled the account and went on with my life. After moving, we tried Netflix again but opened an account with our new email address. I paid for 1 year, no problems (other than movie selection). We used our smart TV, Wii, Play Station and iPads to use Netflix. I moved my cards to my husband's accounts and while checking the statements realized we had two Netflix charges. As it turns out, I was charged for 2 accounts for 1 year (Netflix said we have many customers that have two accounts).
Read full review

preview: I keep getting unwanted emails to join Netflix again after I cancelled a year ago. I went to their site to tell them I don't want to be bothered anymore and found they had my credit card on file. This is ridiculous!! How do we know that a disgruntled emp
review: I keep getting unwanted emails to join Netflix again after I cancelled a year ago. I went to their site to tell them I don't want to be bothered anymore and found they had my credit card on file. This is ridiculous!! How do we know that a disgruntled employee doesn't steal these? It is a privacy issue!! How do I get this removed??

preview: I called on 6/4 to cancel account before 6/7 charge. Then I check my credit card account and Netflix has charged my account (they have cc # on file). I call to get a refund and they have no record of my cancellation, and basically say I never called. Whe
review:
I called on 6/4 to cancel account before 6/7 charge. Then I check my credit card account and Netflix has charged my account (they have cc # on file). I call to get a refund and they have no record of my cancellation, and basically say I never called. When I ask for confirmation of this cancellation, they have my son's email address and that account is active too! I realize when I told my son we have Netflix again in 12/13, somehow that activated an old account with a credit card number on file so we had two accounts. It never entered my mind that my debit card and another account credit card were being charged!!
Read full review

preview: I called Netflix after I received email from them and was told that Netflix no longer wanted to support online streaming for that level of membership. Providing streaming for all kinds of devices was too burdensome. I explained that I only stream Netflix
review: I called Netflix after I received email from them and was told that Netflix no longer wanted to support online streaming for that level of membership. Providing streaming for all kinds of devices was too burdensome. I explained that I only stream Netflix videos from my PC (and the same PC every month), and not from my phone or iPod or any other device. They will not consider leaving my membership as is. I have been a member for years on this simple plan of two DVD's mailed to me a month, and 2 hours of online streaming a month. I would like my full membership restored.

preview: Every other time we reserve a movie, it either doesn't play or freezes in the middle after you get hooked. SO done. Unreal.
review: Every other time we reserve a movie, it either doesn't play or freezes in the middle after you get hooked. SO done. Unreal.

preview: In February 2013, I signed up for a free trial for one month with Netflix. Yes, a credit card was required. Within that 30-day trial period, I called to cancel my trial. Too many old movies, not enough recent ones. Today, 6-5-2013, I found three months o
review: In February 2013, I signed up for a free trial for one month with Netflix. Yes, a credit card was required. Within that 30-day trial period, I called to cancel my trial. Too many old movies, not enough recent ones. Today, 6-5-2013, I found three months of fees taken from my credit card. I called Netflix to ask for a full refund. I was told that only one month's fees would be refunded. I was told that this policy is in the fine print of the terms and conditions. Additionally, Netflix is not violating the law by keeping money for services not rendered to me. I have removed Netflix from my Christmas card list forever. Maybe I'll write a book about "How Not to Win Friends and Influence People".

preview: My son opened a Netflix account while in college and was double billed until he cancelled the account. He recently decided to try again and was immediately hit with two charges on his credit card. This should be fraud! It should NOT continue to happen.
review: My son opened a Netflix account while in college and was double billed until he cancelled the account. He recently decided to try again and was immediately hit with two charges on his credit card. This should be fraud! It should NOT continue to happen.

preview: We are long-standing Netflix customers (9 years). The "Watch Instantly" streaming service is in theory, if it were reliable, really awesome! It started out great in the beginning. Over the last year, the service has gone into intolerable decline. Three o
review:
We are long-standing Netflix customers (9 years). The "Watch Instantly" streaming service is in theory, if it were reliable, really awesome! It started out great in the beginning. Over the last year, the service has gone into intolerable decline. Three out of ten viewings are reliable. The other 7 go like this: (1) loads a show; (2) the show starts; (3) 10 seconds into show, it STOPS to reload (takes 30 seconds); (4) the show starts and rolls for 20 seconds to 2 minutes at most, and STOPS to reload (takes 30 seconds); and (5) the show starts and rolls for 20 seconds to 2 minutes at most, and STOPS to reload (takes 30 seconds).
Read full review

preview: I had simple problem with Netflix. We actually wanted the service. The customer service people will argue with you and refuse to respect, even respect what you are saying as a customer. My son ordered the service on his credit card when he got low on mon
review:
I had simple problem with Netflix. We actually wanted the service. The customer service people will argue with you and refuse to respect, even respect what you are saying as a customer. My son ordered the service on his credit card when he got low on money because he is in college. We called customer service and changed the credit card. The lady took the card over the phone and said it was changed. Then the next month, it was billed back on my son's card, and we were charge a NSF of $30.00. So we called and the customer service rep said the other rep left the other card on file and should have removed it. They tried to bill my card and it would not work which was not true at all because I had no problem on my account.
Read full review

preview: This has to do with the "save queue". Many shows and movies have to go to this queue because Netflix does not release them in a timely fashion. I was told that if you put a show or movie in this "save queue" you will be sent your DVD in the order in whic
review: This has to do with the "save queue". Many shows and movies have to go to this queue because Netflix does not release them in a timely fashion. I was told that if you put a show or movie in this "save queue" you will be sent your DVD in the order in which the save request was received. So the earlier you request this, the sooner the item should arrive. Not so! They let the item out a day sooner than posted, and it goes to their preferred clients or employees, but not the general public, some of whom, like myself waited for over 6 months patiently. I canceled their service and will never return. This is more than maddening, but the basis of very bad business - all of those years being overcharged for this service and then to be treated so unfairly! If they don't survive, here is an excellent reason why. This is discrimination, pure and simple.

preview: Netflix is affordable and it has many shows and movies for everyone. However, they neglect some of their categories such as Anime. They need to fairly add new shows in all sections.
review: Netflix is affordable and it has many shows and movies for everyone. However, they neglect some of their categories such as Anime. They need to fairly add new shows in all sections.

preview: I used to be a Netflix DVD customer. I loved the range of shows available. Tonight (and last week and the week before), I went looking for a dozen different movies that I know had been available before on Netflix as a DVD-by-mail service. None of them ar
review: I used to be a Netflix DVD customer. I loved the range of shows available. Tonight (and last week and the week before), I went looking for a dozen different movies that I know had been available before on Netflix as a DVD-by-mail service. None of them are available for streaming. In fact, all I can find is 2-3 year-old first run movies and occasional newer movies that must have bombed out in theaters before anyone ever heard of them. Sorry. Not worth it.

preview: I really can't believe I am as dumb as I look. Today, I received an email on an inactive and very old email address advising me that my credit card on file at Netflix had expired and they were about to cancel my account. Well, that card number was cancel
review: I really can't believe I am as dumb as I look. Today, I received an email on an inactive and very old email address advising me that my credit card on file at Netflix had expired and they were about to cancel my account. Well, that card number was cancelled four months ago. So thinking it was some sort of illegal activity, I called customer supportless only to find to my dismay that I have been paying for two accounts for over a year. Sound familiar? Well, you guessed it. They don't intend to refund more than the current billing period even though they confirmed that I had not used the old (other) account in at least a year. God only knows how long I had been paying for two accounts. That states volumes for online credit card statements. Having four credit cards, I wasn't smart enough to realize that I was paying twice each month since the statements come in on the beginning and last week of each month. What can one do? I noticed that I am not alone in this double billing of multiple accounts thing. They must love fools such as me. Folks, beware and pay attention to your charges.

preview: I have had Netflix for over 2 years. I never really paid attention to the monthly charge for streaming; yet upon searching for an unrelated credit last night, I discovered the charge of $29.99. It should only be $7.99. I logged into my account, and the b
review:
I have had Netflix for over 2 years. I never really paid attention to the monthly charge for streaming; yet upon searching for an unrelated credit last night, I discovered the charge of $29.99. It should only be $7.99. I logged into my account, and the billing history shows a year's worth of charges at $7.99 not the overages they have been assessing my account. I reread the terms of service to see if I had missed an important caveat… to no avail. They state they will notify customers when a change in service fee happens; there is no change.
Read full review

preview: I was charged for Netflix, which I never made an account and don't understand how it could have been done since I was at work when it claims I made the account. I would like to be refunded my money and my credit card removed from your system. I have neve
review: I was charged for Netflix, which I never made an account and don't understand how it could have been done since I was at work when it claims I made the account. I would like to be refunded my money and my credit card removed from your system. I have never watched anything from Netflix.

preview: I called them on 4/25/2013 because I noticed they're still charging my account. I canceled online and when I went back to the Netflix website, it always says "Restart your service. You have cancelled your account." I called them because I noticed that I'
review: I called them on 4/25/2013 because I noticed they're still charging my account. I canceled online and when I went back to the Netflix website, it always says "Restart your service. You have cancelled your account." I called them because I noticed that I'm still getting charged. They said someone called on 4/5/2013 and canceled last week. I replied that it is a lie. I live by myself. Do you not see I did not use it for 3 months? Did you not ask for their last 4 SS number? What was their phone number they called from? These were the same numbers you asked me. Then I said, "Well if they canceled on 4/5/2013, why did you charge me again on 4/8/2013?" They're not even offering me a refund. Beware, this is a common problem with Netflix.

preview: I just got off the phone with Netflix and a representative from my credit card agency. Netflix has no interest in good faith or good customer service. I believe that their bottom line is milking money out of customers whenever they get the chance. After
review:
I just got off the phone with Netflix and a representative from my credit card agency. Netflix has no interest in good faith or good customer service. I believe that their bottom line is milking money out of customers whenever they get the chance.
