After billing me for 5 months following the so-called free trial that I had cancelled, they refused to refund me a measly $8 because I had waited too long (I was told by their rep back in August of 2012 that I would receive this refund. I filed a dispute with my cc company for the remainder of the funds. The rep did not leave any notes to the effect that I was offered the refund. Yeah, right).
Read full review

preview: I have contacted Netflix twice concerning our problems with their streaming programming. Their response is always to blame the server, my computers, connections, etc. - never their service. I have 0 problems with Charter cable connectivity, except where
review: I have contacted Netflix twice concerning our problems with their streaming programming. Their response is always to blame the server, my computers, connections, etc. - never their service. I have 0 problems with Charter cable connectivity, except where Netflix is concerned. Every single time I want to watch anything on Netflix, there are connection issues - every single time!

preview: I enjoy Netflix, but they really need to separate the movies from the TV shows, put them in different categories like new release movies and new release TV shows or recently added category. Plus they need to add new movies. I'm getting tired of the same
review: I enjoy Netflix, but they really need to separate the movies from the TV shows, put them in different categories like new release movies and new release TV shows or recently added category. Plus they need to add new movies. I'm getting tired of the same stuff. I love that they added Disney movies.

preview: I created an account for my mother-in-law and specifically selected one DVD at a time, no streaming. She doesn't stream. She's 92 and doesn't have any devices that stream. I just learned after about a year they have been billing her for streaming every m
review: I created an account for my mother-in-law and specifically selected one DVD at a time, no streaming. She doesn't stream. She's 92 and doesn't have any devices that stream. I just learned after about a year they have been billing her for streaming every month. It's clear from the usage history she never has streamed a thing, and all they would credit was one month. This company is totally unethical. Totally unethical. I canceled both our accounts and never will do any business with them again. I'm going with Amazon Prime and iTunes/Apple TV.

preview: You can only contact them through chat or phone, no email. There is nothing in the FAQ about this being how the subscriptions work (I checked, read, searched, etc. before redeeming ... I just had a bad hunch it was going to be something like this). Just
review:
You can only contact them through chat or phone, no email. There is nothing in the FAQ about this being how the subscriptions work (I checked, read, searched, etc. before redeeming ... I just had a bad hunch it was going to be something like this). Just wanted to put this out there. If Netflix is going to do this, it should be written and made plan and obvious - not only something the customer learns about after the fact. I just wanted the fact of this out there, so others are aware if they find themselves facing a similar situation. This was nearly $100 potentially wasted depending on how long my house takes to sell.
Read full review

preview: I was offered a return 30-day free trial but was charged for it! The Latino oriented customer service argued that I was not entitled, although the email stipulated that I was being welcomed back. After getting no satisfaction with the customer service, I
review:
I was offered a return 30-day free trial but was charged for it! The Latino oriented customer service argued that I was not entitled, although the email stipulated that I was being welcomed back. After getting no satisfaction with the customer service, I asked to speak to her supervisor at least 6 times. I was put on hold for 10 minutes and the same person returned with no remedy. Netflix must not be too concerned with maintaining customer satisfaction. I am disputing the charge via my credit card company, and Netflix will spend more in labor handling the dispute than voluntarily crediting me for an erroneous charge.
Read full review

preview: I recently signed up again for Netflix service and plan on canceling again. Most of the movies have uploading issues. They play and stop and do start-up again where it left off. It freezes when this happens, and you have to back out and replay again. So,
review: I recently signed up again for Netflix service and plan on canceling again. Most of the movies have uploading issues. They play and stop and do start-up again where it left off. It freezes when this happens, and you have to back out and replay again. So, say a 90-minute film could take three times as long to view. I will cancel again.

preview: Netflix is withholding my IP traffic details on my paid account which is protecting the thieves using my stolen devices on my paid account. They also denied this information to local investigators. This is, in effect, aiding and protecting criminal activ
review: Netflix is withholding my IP traffic details on my paid account which is protecting the thieves using my stolen devices on my paid account. They also denied this information to local investigators. This is, in effect, aiding and protecting criminal activity and denying my personal information, much in the same way the phone company might deny me records of my personal phone calls. I paid for this account. Why are your protecting the thieves using my stolen TV? I want my IP usage data! It is my account!

preview: We are in the middle of watching a film and it freezes and doesn't load. It's not just one film, but lots. It's very annoying and loses the place you are at by skipping parts you haven't watched, or rewinding and replaying parts we have.
review: We are in the middle of watching a film and it freezes and doesn't load. It's not just one film, but lots. It's very annoying and loses the place you are at by skipping parts you haven't watched, or rewinding and replaying parts we have.

preview: Netflix invite me via email to a one-month free trial. However, my credit card was charged $8.79. I called customer service at 888 357 1516, and the Netflix representative responded that I could dispute the charge, and then he said, "If you try to disput
review: Netflix invite me via email to a one-month free trial. However, my credit card was charged $8.79. I called customer service at 888 357 1516, and the Netflix representative responded that I could dispute the charge, and then he said, "If you try to dispute the charge, we'll dispute it all day long." Even though $8.79 is not a large amount of money for me to lose, I would not want any business with a company that lies about their free trial in order to entice unsuspecting customers. In addition, Netflix customer service was rude and threatening.

preview: After thinking I should go back to Netflix (it had been a year since dealing with the streaming site’s always having technical issues as well as their ever-present horrible customer service), surely "those people" are gone? So after signing up again, wit
review: After thinking I should go back to Netflix (it had been a year since dealing with the streaming site’s always having technical issues as well as their ever-present horrible customer service), surely "those people" are gone? So after signing up again, within 2 minutes my account crashed and Marie told me, “That’s just bad luck" and to check back in a couple of hours. Really? That’s helpful, Marie. I don't like that there isn't an email address for Customer Service. (Their "report an issue" takes me back to my movie queue). So, I'm done. Gone. Again. How is there not a better competitor out there for Netflix?

preview: We just "upgraded" to the Netflix instant streaming service - went through lots of technical hoops to make it happen (purchased a new "Netflix ready" Blu-ray player, etc.). We knew there were other ways of doing it. We were just trying to make our movie-
review: We just "upgraded" to the Netflix instant streaming service - went through lots of technical hoops to make it happen (purchased a new "Netflix ready" Blu-ray player, etc.). We knew there were other ways of doing it. We were just trying to make our movie-watching experience as easy as possible. We were so disappointed with the selection of old movies and TV shows available! These were not second run in our view, more like 4th, 5th or worse. Consumers, be smarter than us. Do your homework and review the complete list of available titles before you opt for Netflix instant streaming!

preview: After reading other reviewers’ complaints, it is apparent that they are experiencing the same problem(s) I have had lately - long waits for DVDs of all kinds, recent releases and older ones. Plus, it appears the USPS is conspiring to further harm Netflix
review:
After reading other reviewers’ complaints, it is apparent that they are experiencing the same problem(s) I have had lately - long waits for DVDs of all kinds, recent releases and older ones. Plus, it appears the USPS is conspiring to further harm Netflix by delaying its mail processing so that instead of one-day service as in the past, we now experience two or even three day. The first problem is of Netflix's own making. It is not buying enough DVDs to satisfy demand and prefers customers wait lengthy times for their most wanted movies. The second is a systemic problem with an inefficient governmental agency in the throes of massive losses with no clear idea of what to do except curtail service.
Read full review

preview: I started off trying to buy a gift subscription for $52.76 online. When I submitted the payment, I got a message saying that they weren't able to process my payment. My card wasn't charged and I was to either try again later or update my payment method,
review:
I started off trying to buy a gift subscription for $52.76 online. When I submitted the payment, I got a message saying that they weren't able to process my payment. My card wasn't charged and I was to either try again later or update my payment method, so I retyped my card number and resubmitted the payment. Again, I got a message saying they were unable to process my payment, card wasn't charged and to try again or choose another payment method.
Read full review

preview: I started off trying to buy a gift subscription for $52.76 online. When I submitted the payment, I got a message saying that they weren't able to process my payment, my card wasn't charged and to either try again later or update my payment method. So, I
review:
I started off trying to buy a gift subscription for $52.76 online. When I submitted the payment, I got a message saying that they weren't able to process my payment, my card wasn't charged and to either try again later or update my payment method. So, I retyped my card number and resubmitted the payment. Again, I got a message saying they were unable to process my payment, card wasn't charged and to try again or choose another payment method. This time, I tried another card because I didn't have time to figure out why it wouldn't take the first one, even though I had entered everything correctly (and they bill that card every month successfully for my subscription)!
Read full review

preview: Last month, I wanted to switch plan at the account page from instant view to home DVD shipping but there was no way to do it. So I clicked on the plan to ship and decided to click on cancel instant view right away so I would not be charge for both but it
review:
Last month, I wanted to switch plan at the account page from instant view to home DVD shipping but there was no way to do it. So I clicked on the plan to ship and decided to click on cancel instant view right away so I would not be charge for both but it did not work. So I called customer service the next day. After explaining customer service for 30 minutes what I wanted, she did not want to help. In fact, she helped me leaning towards cancelling shipping service as well. I wanted to give Netflix another chance but the lady on the other line (Netflix) helped make my decision. She even offered me to write a letter happily.
Read full review

preview: Netflix has no customer service. Customer service assumes that when there is a problem, you will be able to report it and have some continued dialogue over the problem until it is resolved. Problems that are reported and need follow up are left to the di
review:
Netflix has no customer service. Customer service assumes that when there is a problem, you will be able to report it and have some continued dialogue over the problem until it is resolved. Problems that are reported and need follow up are left to the discretion of the customer service representative, as to whether they use notes or not use notes on customer accounts when speaking with customers. If they don't, there is no history of the problem and you have nothing to go back to, or the problem was never reported. They can be quite rude and condescending as well.
Read full review

preview: Netflix's website has massively improved in the last few years. It is easy to navigate, there are no longer delays, and everything in my account is accessible now. Looks like they took my advice and hired someone to fix the website; I have no problems wi
review:
Netflix's website has massively improved in the last few years. It is easy to navigate, there are no longer delays, and everything in my account is accessible now. Looks like they took my advice and hired someone to fix the website; I have no problems with it in a long time!
Thanks, Netflix!
Original review: Jan. 5, 2013
I have not had customer service problems with Netflix (so far) - they've always been okay. My issue is with their inefficient website. It breaks down or is incomplete, tells people they can't sign in, goes for weeks without publishing consumer reviews of the movies (very important for many of us who count on reviews before deciding on a film), won't let me access parts of my account, and various other glitches. I have honestly never seen a website this bad. As of this writing, the website has been "down" for two days, despite a notice that their engineers are "working hard" to restore it. Personally, I think they need to tell their webmaster(s) that it's time to move on then hire people who can design and maintain a website properly!

preview: I cancelled Netflix in August and got a confirmation email. After arriving from a trip in December, I noticed in my bank statement a charge from Netflix. When I called them up, they could only refund me the last month of December. That's their policy! If
review: I cancelled Netflix in August and got a confirmation email. After arriving from a trip in December, I noticed in my bank statement a charge from Netflix. When I called them up, they could only refund me the last month of December. That's their policy! If I want all my refunds, I have to dispute through my bank, which makes very inconvenient and time consuming. Please be aware that when you cancel your account with Netflix, keep checking your bank to make sure you don't get charged. It does not matter if you have a confirmation email, they still take no responsibility.

preview: Netflix kept emailing me, telling me my email address was not correct. Sixteen months ago, I sent them a second email. Somewhere at that time, they started charging me for two accounts. I thought I was on a plan to get 2 DVDs per month, one out at a time
review: Netflix kept emailing me, telling me my email address was not correct. Sixteen months ago, I sent them a second email. Somewhere at that time, they started charging me for two accounts. I thought I was on a plan to get 2 DVDs per month, one out at a time. When this December I had 2 DVDs out, I called and was told they were having a mailing problem. Then just this past week, I called again to tell them I was still receiving the message that I needed to correct my email. That is when I was told I was paying for two plans! I never realized it and they said they can only refund me one month! I feel that they should back pay me for the 16 months. Their records will show I never got more than 2 DVDs a month!

preview: I had the same experience with their customer service representative Christina and her supervisor Britton today. Christina was sarcastic and was mocking me with that little laughter thing that customer service reps do when they want to make fun of their
review:
I had the same experience with their customer service representative Christina and her supervisor Britton today. Christina was sarcastic and was mocking me with that little laughter thing that customer service reps do when they want to make fun of their customers. I phoned them and Hulu on March 15, 2012 to change my billing date. Hulu was very accommodating, even though I could have completed my request on their website. The rep was considerate enough to walk me through the process, with clarity and excellent customer service. On the other hand, I got nothing but bad attitude from the Netflix rep. Before calling them, I checked their website and logged into my account to ascertain if their site was user-friendly for making the changes to my account. It was not.
Read full review

preview: I think Barry of Palm Desert, CA said it very well below (on Sept. 24, 2012). In the last few years, Netflix has really gone downhill from being an industry leader and innovator to a joke of marketing incompetence. I've been a member since 2002 and have
review:
I think Barry of Palm Desert, CA said it very well below (on Sept. 24, 2012). In the last few years, Netflix has really gone downhill from being an industry leader and innovator to a joke of marketing incompetence. I've been a member since 2002 and have been very satisfied for most of that time, even choosing to remain patient and loyal during the whole "Qwikster" debacle. But in recent months, three changes I've noticed are really making it hard for me to remain a customer: (1) Fewer and fewer streaming options, despite them gearing the website to make it more difficult to add DVDs; (2) more "long wait" delays for many DVDs (for instance, my entire Christmas queue is flagged. That never used to happen, even during seasonal periods of high demand); and (3) longer turnaround times to receive DVDs by mail.
Read full review

preview: I just checked my account again, and Netflix charged my account though I've called in for vacation time (90-day hold). I've placed a hold 3 times. I've been billed $148 and change without using their service. The rep stated she could only give me credit
review: I just checked my account again, and Netflix charged my account though I've called in for vacation time (90-day hold). I've placed a hold 3 times. I've been billed $148 and change without using their service. The rep stated she could only give me credit for this month. Their "system" does not handle past months. Are you kidding me? Boo!

preview: We paid for the service for a month and they disconnected the service in two weeks. This is the third time I paid the fee and always had the problem, and the phone is not working! This is a scam! Don't recommend Netflix! Stay away from this company.
review: We paid for the service for a month and they disconnected the service in two weeks. This is the third time I paid the fee and always had the problem, and the phone is not working! This is a scam! Don't recommend Netflix! Stay away from this company.

preview: They are very ready to drop anyone with a complaint. With all the available access to other sites out there, one would think they would like to at least hear a complaint through. I was being billed twice a month for adjustments in their billing process,
review: They are very ready to drop anyone with a complaint. With all the available access to other sites out there, one would think they would like to at least hear a complaint through. I was being billed twice a month for adjustments in their billing process, sadly, throwing my bank account overdrawn costing me. I've rented two DVDs in three months and had been double billed for each month. Instead of realizing perhaps they have gotten their money's worth out of those two DVDs, they insist that customers are more than advised as to each of the DVDs and streaming being 8 dollars each. It used to be combined as I recall, but instead of just refunding just one charge for one month (not a lot for what I've actually paid in three months) totaling just 7 movies total both steaming and DVD, it's sad to say that they were more than happy to ditch a paying customer over $8 and taking time to listen with at least pretending to care.

preview: Netflix fails to deliver! Is this the same company? My first experience with Netflix was positive. They had DVD rentals which I used extensively. Also offered was streaming which I recently signed up for on a free trial and saw the price to be $8 after e
review:
Netflix fails to deliver! Is this the same company? My first experience with Netflix was positive. They had DVD rentals which I used extensively. Also offered was streaming which I recently signed up for on a free trial and saw the price to be $8 after expiration of trial without DVDs. The first thing I had to do was download a proprietary Microsoft Silverlight, which is a memory hog and simply freezes up the dual processor laptop. Fast hard drive, high power multimedia processor and an expensive internet cable connection. Before I got to the failed Silverlight delivery, I noticed an anemic interface with virtually nothing there that I wanted to view. I selected a movie that I'd seen before and after an hour of several failed attempts, the movie loaded.
Read full review

preview: I have noticed Netflix is limiting their Christmas movie selection. They have dropped the Christian themed movies whereas Blockbuster carries all of them. This is concerning as one who would like to rent these whether I'm a Christian or not. They are goo
review: I have noticed Netflix is limiting their Christmas movie selection. They have dropped the Christian themed movies whereas Blockbuster carries all of them. This is concerning as one who would like to rent these whether I'm a Christian or not. They are good family oriented films if nothing else. Furthermore, I have also noticed Blockbuster carries a great deal more (whether they have them is another matter and I am by no means advocating or promoting BB) but they do offer more excellent Christian Christmas movies including recent releases. I am re-evaluating whether to continue my subscription. Netflix, I sincerely hope you listen to these complaints as they are valid. It is sad when a company needs competitors to improve their products/services but that is exactly what is needed. Netflix won't listen until another company comes along and gives them a run for their money.

preview: Every other movie we receive skips, starts over or shuts down. I have to get up and try cleaning the DVD, and I can tell from experience, the DVDs are in awful shape. I have called Customer Service, and they said there is a cleaning process and that was
review: Every other movie we receive skips, starts over or shuts down. I have to get up and try cleaning the DVD, and I can tell from experience, the DVDs are in awful shape. I have called Customer Service, and they said there is a cleaning process and that was it - nothing else they can do. I am extremely frustrated with their products and service and want the public and Netflix to know about this.

preview: I have been a loyal and enthusiastic supporter of Netflix, but I am now constantly getting movies mailed to me that say out of format, copyright infringement or otherwise just in such poor condition that they will not play. I am now switching to Amazon.
review: I have been a loyal and enthusiastic supporter of Netflix, but I am now constantly getting movies mailed to me that say out of format, copyright infringement or otherwise just in such poor condition that they will not play. I am now switching to Amazon. Netflix, be heard - you need to keep up. Pay the bills or go under.

preview: My credit card expired, and I was issued another one with the same number, different expiration date. I wanted to quit this terrible service anyway, so I never updated my payment with Netflix. Somehow, even without the correct expiration date, they were
review:
My credit card expired, and I was issued another one with the same number, different expiration date. I wanted to quit this terrible service anyway, so I never updated my payment with Netflix. Somehow, even without the correct expiration date, they were able to take my account off of hold and keep billing me. The bank said the payments were being "pushed" or "forced" through. No idea what that means, but MasterCard will only go back 90 days with disputes. Netflix will only give back one month. The supervisor told me it was the bank's problem, that they were "more than happy to keep paying us" even without a correct expiration date.
Read full review

preview: I have decided to cancel my Netflix account. I've been a loyal customer for many years, not that they care. I have the 3-DVDs-at-a-time. I just checked my queue and about 10 movies are suddenly "unavailable." This has happened occasionally with one movie
review:
I have decided to cancel my Netflix account. I've been a loyal customer for many years, not that they care. I have the 3-DVDs-at-a-time. I just checked my queue and about 10 movies are suddenly "unavailable." This has happened occasionally with one movie but never 10 at a time. They also take out entire seasons of long-running shows. I called about this and was told that those DVDs were probably too scratched to be viewable. When I asked why they didn't replace the DVDs, the rep got rude and said they didn't do that, no explanation at all. Who wants to watch an entire series with one or more seasons missing? The time between returning movies and getting new ones is getting longer and longer. If I mail a movie back on Monday, they don't receive it until Thursday or Friday. It used to be a 48-hour turnaround.
Read full review

preview: For the last four years, I have bought a one year gift subscription with Netflix for my elderly in-laws. They had the streaming and one DVD at a time. I just discovered that their subscription ended in June! That after buying a one year subscription. Acc
review: For the last four years, I have bought a one year gift subscription with Netflix for my elderly in-laws. They had the streaming and one DVD at a time. I just discovered that their subscription ended in June! That after buying a one year subscription. According to the representative, since they changed the program, their subscription would only carry it until June! I am furious and I feel like I have been scammed. Shame on you Netflix!

preview: For months Netflix have been double charging my account and I didn't even find it until this evening. They sent out a notice (to my junk mail account) among all the hundreds of others they send out notifying me apparently, right! They have been cancelled
review: For months Netflix have been double charging my account and I didn't even find it until this evening. They sent out a notice (to my junk mail account) among all the hundreds of others they send out notifying me apparently, right! They have been cancelled and I will check into their fraudulent practice by contacting the attorney general's office.

preview: Just a simple "loophole" that I created myself to guarantee my one month free trial period of internet access by use of my Wi-Fi Blu-ray DVD player would not be a monthly service, even if I opt-out was quite unethical to capitalist standards. I went and
review:
Just a simple "loophole" that I created myself to guarantee my one month free trial period of internet access by use of my Wi-Fi Blu-ray DVD player would not be a monthly service, even if I opt-out was quite unethical to capitalist standards. I went and purchased a prepaid Visa credit card from Walmart. Within a week I reviewed my permanent card in the mail with my full name on it just like a real credit card. I put $20 on it, and voila, I used this card upon registration for the free trial that requested a credit card. I then used that money to order e-juice for my electric cigarette online to put my funds to good use.
Read full review

preview: I've been a Netflix customer for about 2 years. I provided my credit card for easy payments. When my credit card expired, my account was deactivated, so I reentered my information with the new expiration dated credit card. It turns out this opened up a n
review: I've been a Netflix customer for about 2 years. I provided my credit card for easy payments. When my credit card expired, my account was deactivated, so I reentered my information with the new expiration dated credit card. It turns out this opened up a new account and reactivated my old account, resulting in Netflix double charging my account every month until I noticed. The service I received was the bare minimum, and rather than illustrating that Netflix values their customer through refunding the double charges or providing months at no charge because they were already paid for, Netflix showed they do not care about their customer, but rather only for their money. So Netflix lost me as a customer, which is a shame, because it would have been no out of pocket to them. Just as well, I'd rather not contribute to their greedy mentality.

preview: I have been a Netflix customer for over four years now. I have a typical family of four and until recently have been able to stream multiple devices at the same time with my account. A couple of months ago, I called when I could no longer stream more tha
review: I have been a Netflix customer for over four years now. I have a typical family of four and until recently have been able to stream multiple devices at the same time with my account. A couple of months ago, I called when I could no longer stream more than two devices. They said they are getting a lot of complaints but needed to prevent people from stealing the service. I offered several suggestions on verifying the account. Today, I called again and basically was told "too bad, they're not changing their policy." And when I said this will lead me to cancel my account, I was told "Oh well!" Congrats! You just lost me as a customer!

preview: My son attempted, with our permission, to sign up for Netflix free trial via his PS3. He entered the information and when he went through the process, a system message appears that his device has already received a free trial and is therefore ineligible.
review:
My son attempted, with our permission, to sign up for Netflix free trial via his PS3. He entered the information and when he went through the process, a system message appears that his device has already received a free trial and is therefore ineligible. Then, we remember we had a free trial on the PS3 in our previous house a couple of years back. So, assuming that nothing was accepted, we forgot about it.
Read full review

preview: I've been a Netflix customer for 5 years and 8 months. The last few months there's been a delay with many of the TV shows and movies I've put in my queue. When I called Netflix 2 months ago to complain, I was basically told, "That's just the way it works
review:
I've been a Netflix customer for 5 years and 8 months. The last few months there's been a delay with many of the TV shows and movies I've put in my queue. When I called Netflix 2 months ago to complain, I was basically told, "That's just the way it works. Several of the shows in your DVD queue are available for instant viewing." I explained that I'm not able to stream most of the time and that's why I have a 4-at-a-time plan. Over the last month the waiting list in my queue continues to grow with 10 TV shows and movies at the top of my queue that are not being sent and only when I add movies/TV show is anything sent. That being said, out of the last month I've only had 4 movies at a time for perhaps 10 days.
Read full review

preview: I was a Netflix customer for almost 2 years. I just cancelled my subscription out of anger. Initially the whole plan for almost $10 with streaming and one Blu-ray DVD at a time was the best value. When they decided to separate the services and then they
review: I was a Netflix customer for almost 2 years. I just cancelled my subscription out of anger. Initially the whole plan for almost $10 with streaming and one Blu-ray DVD at a time was the best value. When they decided to separate the services and then they didn't but doubled the price, I kept only the streaming option so I could finish the shows I was watching. About 3 weeks ago, I decided to use the DVD one at a time Blu-ray subscription to watch the Walking Dead and Game of Thrones. I watched the Walking Dead 1st DVD season 2 then found it on demand on AMC and I watched the rest of it there. On to Game of Thrones. First DVD is 2 episodes, 2nd DVD is 3 episodes, 3rd DVD is 1 episode! I had to wait from Friday until Tuesday to get the DVD and watch 53 minutes and then send it back Wednesday to receive the next one Friday without knowing how many episodes are in there, and I don't want to check online. I understand the delivery if you live in a small town takes longer but I refuse to continue this service when Netflix decides to put one episode in the DVD! There are other options out there and frankly, I'd rather pay for HBO.

preview: I've been a Netflix streaming and mail subscriber for many years. I dropped streaming a few years ago due to the poor quality of the picture. The stream quality looked like they had filmed the movie in a theater with a camcorder. I changed the account to
review:
I've been a Netflix streaming and mail subscriber for many years. I dropped streaming a few years ago due to the poor quality of the picture. The stream quality looked like they had filmed the movie in a theater with a camcorder. I changed the account to Blue Ray only. It worked for about a year until a rash of unreadable, damaged discs began showing up quite frequently. And top that with the fact that new releases never shipped within months of them actually becoming available. The cost basis just became too great when they increased the membership rates.
Read full review

preview: I have been a member of Netflix for many years with no problems. I had to put my account on hold for a while because I was too busy to watch any movies. I reinstated my account by just clicking reinstate. Little did I know, streaming video was added to m
review: I have been a member of Netflix for many years with no problems. I had to put my account on hold for a while because I was too busy to watch any movies. I reinstated my account by just clicking reinstate. Little did I know, streaming video was added to my account and charged each month. I do not or ever had a streaming a video device so I would have no use for this service. I trusted this company to bill me correctly but after looking through my account history, I have been over-billed more than $100. After calling customer service and talking to several people, I got the impression they didn't care as long as they have your money. I was told first that I signed up for this service, then someone else told me it was automatically added when I reinstated. Bottom line, they refuse to credit me any money I overpaid. By one representative Kevin, I was told I should have watched my account more closely. What a joke! This is a real scam. I would suggest people check their accounts.

preview: I paid my account around the 14th of September, and still was not able to get online. I called the company and they said that the billing hadn't gone through, yet on my credit card it stated that it did go through. Three days later I called again, and tr
review:
I paid my account around the 14th of September, and still was not able to get online. I called the company and they said that the billing hadn't gone through, yet on my credit card it stated that it did go through. Three days later I called again, and tried to order DVDs and they told me that they were having problems with the billing, and that I would get service soon.
Read full review

preview: What they have is great, what they don't have is even greater. It's almost certain that if I look for a popular movie, it will either be available only on DVD or not at all. Wake up, Netflix! You are about to lose all your customers.
review: What they have is great, what they don't have is even greater. It's almost certain that if I look for a popular movie, it will either be available only on DVD or not at all. Wake up, Netflix! You are about to lose all your customers.

preview: Since your new update, Netflix is terrible not only on my cell but my home as well. While watching movies, it always freezes, reading loading please wait. It never did this with the old version. Please fix this. You want people to pay for this service th
review: Since your new update, Netflix is terrible not only on my cell but my home as well. While watching movies, it always freezes, reading loading please wait. It never did this with the old version. Please fix this. You want people to pay for this service then it should work with no issues.

preview: I can't get a full-sized screen anymore since they changed to Microsoft Silverlight. Also, low volume on most recent streaming movie. Regarding a TV series I was watching, it's gone now. Customer service told me they were in the middle of renewing licens
review: I can't get a full-sized screen anymore since they changed to Microsoft Silverlight. Also, low volume on most recent streaming movie. Regarding a TV series I was watching, it's gone now. Customer service told me they were in the middle of renewing licensing. Couldn't you do that before it expired? I called Customer Services ... six-minute wait, even with the special code to get you in faster. Then, she complained about her computer and went away for several minutes. The on-hold music is terrible - it's as if they want to get rid of people calling in. Something is up with Netflix - the overall quality just isn't there anymore. To add insult to injury, when I politely told CS that I was on the verge of cancelling my subscription, she told me, “We have 40 billion subscribers; people come and go all the time." I explained to her that there weren't that many people on the planet. Netflix, you really shouldn't be so cocky in this economy! You've gone downhill from a year or so ago. Time to check out Amazon Prime ...

preview: We noticed that automatic deductions against our Discover Card account had doubled. A call to NetFlix Customer Service and review of our online account information revealed that we were being charged for a streaming movie service. We never authorized suc
review: We noticed that automatic deductions against our Discover Card account had doubled. A call to NetFlix Customer Service and review of our online account information revealed that we were being charged for a streaming movie service. We never authorized such a change to our account. We couldn't utilize such a service if we wanted, as our internet connection could not support it. NetFlix claimed they sent a notification "e-mail" informing us of this change and giving us the opportunity to "opt out". For whatever reason, we never saw the said e-mail. As a result, NetFlix has been charging us $7.99 for a service we never requested, authorized, or can take advantage of. When I requested a rebate or credit for the difference for upwards of a year's worth of charges ($7.99 x 12 months = $95.88), the most they would do is credit the current month's charges.

preview: I wanted to buy a Netflix gift certificate for a friend of mine. I bought her a 3-month subscription and I wanted to write a note that was 3 sentences (as I can do on every other site I've bought a certificate from). However, Netflix for some reason limi
review: I wanted to buy a Netflix gift certificate for a friend of mine. I bought her a 3-month subscription and I wanted to write a note that was 3 sentences (as I can do on every other site I've bought a certificate from). However, Netflix for some reason limits the personalization to only 80 characters (see enclosed image)! I don't know why they do this, but it makes it harder to write even a short gift note. So, I decided to send my friend the gift, even with the generic note. The real problem occurred when she has to redeem the gift. Netflix wouldn't let her unless she put in a billing card! I thought I was giving a gift to my friend, not signing her up to continuity. I know Netflix is a business, but the bottom line is my friend couldn't use her gift unless she entered her credit card. This felt wrong to me, especially since it wasn't clear during the checkout process when I bought the card.

preview: I've subscribed to Netflix for more than a decade and for a number of years, I was very happy with the service, even giving it as a gift to others. Thanks to what's been going on for the past 6 months or more, my enthusiasm has completely vanished and tu
review: I've subscribed to Netflix for more than a decade and for a number of years, I was very happy with the service, even giving it as a gift to others. Thanks to what's been going on for the past 6 months or more, my enthusiasm has completely vanished and turned to anger. I can no longer get the new releases at the top of my list - for many, many months. Netflix skips over my priorities with a seeming arrogance and purposefulness. Phoning in to complain is useless. Most of those answering know little and seem to have been hired to placate. The supervisors are simply those who placate the best while failing to serve. Writing to corporate headquarters is the worst. They don't reply. I certainly hope others enter this market and become what Netflix used to be. I've already cut way back on what the number of discs I have at one time because they refuse to provide what I want and I expect I may cut off the service altogether very soon. From a great company, it has turned to one of the worst.

preview: I have been a Netflix member for over 10 years. In the previous 9 1/2 years, I have received excellent service and recommended several customers to their service. (About 20 or 30 have joined Netflix.) No more! In the last 2-3 months, they have put all th
review: I have been a Netflix member for over 10 years. In the previous 9 1/2 years, I have received excellent service and recommended several customers to their service. (About 20 or 30 have joined Netflix.) No more! In the last 2-3 months, they have put all the new release movies on very long wait status even though I had the release at the top of my queue when released. I have been complaining to them during the past week. Today, I talked to a supervisor who accused me of trying to get a free DVD because I pointed out to her that their policy used to be when they messed up, they would send an extra movie to make up for their mistake. I wasn't asking for anything, just pointing it out. Rude, very rude! She ended up hanging up on me saying I wasn't listening to her when the fact is she wasn't listening to me. Netflix is obviously experiencing financial difficulties and is trying different procedures to save money. Why don't they just tell the truth instead of making up lies? I owned Netflix stock for several years because of their excellent customer service. I would not recommend the stock or the service to anyone at this point!

preview: Only one could be used. It's unsatisfactory. I need to use all three at a time.
review: Only one could be used. It's unsatisfactory. I need to use all three at a time.

preview: I am on trial basis with Netflix. I really like everything with the exception of the background sound/noise/music in some programs. It is so loud and overpowering. One has great difficulty understanding the audio. In some cases, I have been unable to mak
review: I am on trial basis with Netflix. I really like everything with the exception of the background sound/noise/music in some programs. It is so loud and overpowering. One has great difficulty understanding the audio. In some cases, I have been unable to make out the spoken word. Gallaudet Research Institute indicates 44% of folks over 55 years old have hearing problems. My research indicates Netflix does not add the noise and has no control over it. I would be willing to pay more for Netflix programs without the disgusting background music. I hope this will get to proper authorities who may have input.

preview: Like so many others on this post, I cancelled my account when Netflix started double billing. I was told that the credit card was locked out and could not be used. Months later, I noticed that Netflix had reactivated billing to that card and continued mo
review: Like so many others on this post, I cancelled my account when Netflix started double billing. I was told that the credit card was locked out and could not be used. Months later, I noticed that Netflix had reactivated billing to that card and continued monthly withdrawal. The agent who took my complaint played dumb to my situation and said he would block my card and it couldn't be used by them anymore. It sounded quite familiar. I will be opening a fraud investigation with the bank to attempt to get my money back. I look forward to celebrating the demise of such a crooked bunch of corporate criminals, who obviously are stealing from the masses.

preview: Netflix still keeps double billing after being notified.
review: Netflix still keeps double billing after being notified.

preview: After spending three months working the oilfield in South Texas, I was able to take a break for a while. Tonight, my wife and I reinstated the Netflix streaming account, started to watch a few movies, and then ended up watching a stand-up comic. Everythi
review:
After spending three months working the oilfield in South Texas, I was able to take a break for a while. Tonight, my wife and I reinstated the Netflix streaming account, started to watch a few movies, and then ended up watching a stand-up comic. Everything’s hunky dory, right? Wrong; right at the end, a message flashed that there's a problem with my account. After logging in on the laptop, there's the message: 'We are unable to process your account, please re-enter payment info." Feeling something could be amiss, I went out to my card site, and lo and behold Netflix charged my account 4 times, each $7.99.
Read full review

preview: Movies on my computer are choppy and picture quality is not as good as it was. Another problem is I'll be watching something and the screen goes black. Sometimes it comes back, at other times I have to go back to browsing and go back to the movie, and th
review: Movies on my computer are choppy and picture quality is not as good as it was. Another problem is I'll be watching something and the screen goes black. Sometimes it comes back, at other times I have to go back to browsing and go back to the movie, and then there are times that I have to leave Netflix completely and go back in. I think I'm paying the highest amount, $16.95, and continue to have all these problems. When I call, after waiting a lifetime, I get a tech that says "I can fix that," but does not or the phone connection gets lost, usually at a convenient time when I ask a question.

preview: Netflix has an update for PS3 users that does not work. When you call customer no-service, you get the standard answers that they are probably reading off of a screen. No matter how many times you delete Netflix and reinstall it, you have to download a u
review:
Netflix has an update for PS3 users that does not work. When you call customer no-service, you get the standard answers that they are probably reading off of a screen. No matter how many times you delete Netflix and reinstall it, you have to download a useless update that won't allow you to watch anything through the PS3. Instead of the download being deleted so that viewers can watch their shows or movies, they just tell you to start all over again. It doesn't work no matter how many times you try it. This is the second time this month that we have had this problem and there was no service for 3 days the first time and this time, we are on day three with no change in sight.
Read full review

preview: Madmen - Netflix switched to DVD only while we were midstream! They didn't even allow us to continue the episode.
review: Madmen - Netflix switched to DVD only while we were midstream! They didn't even allow us to continue the episode.

preview: Okay so I signed my debit card back up with Netflix and when I called my credit union, I was told they took $16.38 twice plus $8.40. When I called them back, they told me they would only refund me $8.27. They told me they wouldn’t refund me the other mon
review: Okay so I signed my debit card back up with Netflix and when I called my credit union, I was told they took $16.38 twice plus $8.40. When I called them back, they told me they would only refund me $8.27. They told me they wouldn’t refund me the other money they took. They are ** period and other people need to hear this. Do not use Netflix. They have bad customer service and don’t care about you. They just want to steal your money. Do not use their service.

preview: We have been subscribers for years, but your new full page website page with that family grinning away has no option for browsing or ordering films. The bloody picture takes up the entire page. I tried to order films on my wife's email address, but the s
review: We have been subscribers for years, but your new full page website page with that family grinning away has no option for browsing or ordering films. The bloody picture takes up the entire page. I tried to order films on my wife's email address, but the site would not accept the password, which we have used for years. I then asked for a new password to be sent to my wife's address, but it has not arrived. Boring and annoying.

preview: I used my debit card. They took six $7.99 payments then a $16.54. I only saw four card payments back. I called, they said it is my fault and were very rude. I did think they could take more than the $7.99 without notifying me. I never saw the rest of my
review: I used my debit card. They took six $7.99 payments then a $16.54. I only saw four card payments back. I called, they said it is my fault and were very rude. I did think they could take more than the $7.99 without notifying me. I never saw the rest of my money back. That's the second time this happened.

preview: I signed up for a 30-day free trial of Netflix. About three days before the trial ended, I cancelled the subscription. However, the cancellation was never activated by Netflix. Netflix continued to bill my account and I did not notice it for a few months
review:
I signed up for a 30-day free trial of Netflix. About three days before the trial ended, I cancelled the subscription. However, the cancellation was never activated by Netflix. Netflix continued to bill my account and I did not notice it for a few months. The problem is that Netflix gives no clear directions on how to cancel the supposedly free trial. I'm sure that many subscribers to the free trial end up getting billed for at least one month even if they think that they have cancelled within the allowed period.
Read full review

preview: They reopened my account that I had closed, after it had been closed for several months. They did not have my consent. They just started taking money out of my bank account, again. I did not have the service or have any way of using the service. They jus
review: They reopened my account that I had closed, after it had been closed for several months. They did not have my consent. They just started taking money out of my bank account, again. I did not have the service or have any way of using the service. They just stole the money from me. They now refuse to credit my account the $87.35 they fraudulently took.

preview: I have been using the pilates fitness videos daily for over a year. All of a sudden they were there one day and gone the next. They were no longer in my queue and I could not even find the fitness category anymore. There’s no explanation anywhere. After
review: I have been using the pilates fitness videos daily for over a year. All of a sudden they were there one day and gone the next. They were no longer in my queue and I could not even find the fitness category anymore. There’s no explanation anywhere. After searching the titles, they are now only available in the mail. So, I would have to upgrade my service to include mailed DVDs. There’s no way will I do that. And there is no way to contact Netflix online, which is absolutely ridiculous in this age of the internet. What terrible customer service! I will not recommend Netflix to anyone.

preview: Inappropriate clips from movie - I was on my Xbox 360 looking through movies on Netflix. My 14 month old was getting into something he wasn't supposed to be. I got up, leaving my 5 year old on the couch in front of the TV. When you flip through movies on
review: Inappropriate clips from movie - I was on my Xbox 360 looking through movies on Netflix. My 14 month old was getting into something he wasn't supposed to be. I got up, leaving my 5 year old on the couch in front of the TV. When you flip through movies on Netflix, it will show clips from the movie. When I got up to get my little one, I came back to find the movie clip showing was extremely inappropriate. There were 2 girls getting their clothing torn off at knife point by some men. The girls were mostly nude and were forced to "do things". I was in shock to see that my 5 year old was watching this! The movie is "The Last House on the Left" 1972 version. I do not have a problem with this sort of movie, but with the clip that was shown for the movie. I'm sure they could choose a different clip for that movie so that no other children will be exposed to this. I called and spoke to a woman at Netflix. I was told they have no control over what clips are shown nor do they preview the clips before putting them on Netflix. She told me she would send a note and make them (whoever them is) aware of this. That was 3 weeks ago and nothing has changed!

preview: Can't you turn down the background noise? We have been watching The Guardian series and you cannot hear what is being said. The telephone on the show drowns out everything. If we can't hear the talking, it is very frustrating. We have also had trouble on
review: Can't you turn down the background noise? We have been watching The Guardian series and you cannot hear what is being said. The telephone on the show drowns out everything. If we can't hear the talking, it is very frustrating. We have also had trouble on other movies. If we can't hear the story, I think we may have to cancel.

preview: Removal of shows - It was nice to have the exercise videos available to use when I am ready during my daily or nightly activities. It was a nice variety. With American citizens being overweight, you should encourage them to exercise and keep these availa
review: Removal of shows - It was nice to have the exercise videos available to use when I am ready during my daily or nightly activities. It was a nice variety. With American citizens being overweight, you should encourage them to exercise and keep these available and add some some more options to your queue. Bring them back!

preview: So I was watching Netflix on my laptop last night with no problem but when I logged on today, it tells me I have to download a new Mac software in order to be able to watch. I called customer service and they couldn't do anything. My browser is just too
review: So I was watching Netflix on my laptop last night with no problem but when I logged on today, it tells me I have to download a new Mac software in order to be able to watch. I called customer service and they couldn't do anything. My browser is just too old and I'll have to watch on a tablet or phone. Are you kidding? This is a joke. I don't pay you monthly so that you can arbitrarily switch the software without any kind of email warning or notification that this was happening. I am considering cancelling my subscription. How can Netflix decide that one day my computer is too old to support watching TV?

preview: I went to pay the $7.99 bill off of my debit card. They accepted and took the payment off my account. Later, I went to watch a TV show, and was told I hadn’t paid the bill. I called Netflix and told them that I had paid the bill, was told the payment was
review: I went to pay the $7.99 bill off of my debit card. They accepted and took the payment off my account. Later, I went to watch a TV show, and was told I hadn’t paid the bill. I called Netflix and told them that I had paid the bill, was told the payment was received, had the money taken off of my account, and yet no service. I was told there was nothing they could do as I hadn’t paid two months’ worth of service. Yet I have bank statements that show the money was taken off my account both times in question, and never returned, and had service until I paid my bill this last time. I was given the runaround, stuttering excuses that made no sense, and when I asked to speak to a supervisor, I was told rudely that I was speaking to the supervisor and that was just all that could be done for me unless I wanted to cancel my service. I’m extremely, extremely dissatisfied, angry and feeling ripped off. Never will I use Netflix again, nor will I continue, or ever, refer Netflix to anyone else again.

preview: I signed up for Netflix about 6 months ago. When I signed up, I asked the rep if I could set up my billing date between the first and 7th of the month. The reason for this is I get paid monthly on the first of each month, I am a disabled veteran. They sa
review:
I signed up for Netflix about 6 months ago. When I signed up, I asked the rep if I could set up my billing date between the first and 7th of the month. The reason for this is I get paid monthly on the first of each month, I am a disabled veteran. They said this would not be a problem. Everything went fine up until April when I logged on and found that my service had been cut off for lack of funds. As a disabled vet, I make about a thousand dollars a month, not much, but I get by pretty well. So, I called the customer service line and explained what had happened. The rep said they were not allowed to set up payment dates and all I could do was leave the account off and restart it on the day I wanted my payment to be.
Read full review

preview: I was already sick of Netflix to begin with because of all the crap they pulled last year, but this one takes the cake. I left them back in February, but I started watching again recently when my roommate got a membership. He let his friend use it as wel
review: I was already sick of Netflix to begin with because of all the crap they pulled last year, but this one takes the cake. I left them back in February, but I started watching again recently when my roommate got a membership. He let his friend use it as well. I got sick of having to wait to use it (heaven forbid you have more than two devices using it at the same time), so I finally got my own membership again. Much to my dismay, I just found out that they no longer offer my favorite show, “Roseanne.” I don't have cable. The only reason I get Netflix is to watch shows. “Roseanne” is all I watched the last time I had it and now that I have it again I can't even watch my damn show. I know they have to pay for licenses to stream the shows and movies, but when their selection is crap to begin with, I don't understand why they can't keep what they have and build on it rather than pick and choose and play the odds.

preview: We have been subscribers to Netflix for just a few months and everything had worked fine until a few nights ago. We enjoy the BBC Doc Martin series and had watched the first 16 episodes, looking forward to seeing the rest. We tuned in the next night to f
review: We have been subscribers to Netflix for just a few months and everything had worked fine until a few nights ago. We enjoy the BBC Doc Martin series and had watched the first 16 episodes, looking forward to seeing the rest. We tuned in the next night to find that only the first season of six episodes are now available. So Netflix, where did the rest of the episodes disappear to?

preview: I am writing to say that as a parent of two little girls, I was shocked tonight to find a recently added film "I Spit on Your Grave" was available on Netflix's streaming service. I understand that movie ratings are a 'guide' for parents to use, and I rea
review: I am writing to say that as a parent of two little girls, I was shocked tonight to find a recently added film "I Spit on Your Grave" was available on Netflix's streaming service. I understand that movie ratings are a 'guide' for parents to use, and I realize that children can use the "kids" link to access appropriate content, but there are no mechanisms for parents to "block" content such as this from accidental access. Apple has a fairly strict process for preventing kids from accessing "explicit content", but Netflix does not and that is really surprising to me. I think you need to come up with a more family friendly process for using you services on computers, home entertainment systems, mobile devices etc., and enable specific blocking of content. It also wouldn't hurt for you to establish some sort of "adult" tier that is not accessible without additional effort by adults.

preview: The audio is so far in advance of most every movie that I can't watch the movies. When I called to complain, I was told that I have to uninstall my audio driver and re-install it and if that didn't work, try another browser. Then if nothing worked, I nee
review: The audio is so far in advance of most every movie that I can't watch the movies. When I called to complain, I was told that I have to uninstall my audio driver and re-install it and if that didn't work, try another browser. Then if nothing worked, I need to call a computer repair guy. This is after I explained that the problem started only after the Netflix programming update and that it was happening on both computers (one XP and one 7). I insisted it was a Netflix issue and the operator told me she had no complaints like that. A quick Google search turned up many people complaining of the same problem. I don't think we all need our computers fixed. I think someone needs to force Netflix to take responsibility, not just money. Thank you.

preview: They double the price and in return, DVDs are not available and when you do get them, they do not work! There is a "very long wait" for DVD's that go on indefinitely! Are you kidding me, all this for double the price? Netflix sucks.
review: They double the price and in return, DVDs are not available and when you do get them, they do not work! There is a "very long wait" for DVD's that go on indefinitely! Are you kidding me, all this for double the price? Netflix sucks.

preview: I had to cancel Netflix because they changed their website, which is now inaccessible. You have to have the newest computer and browser to access it. To cancel, they told me I had to pay for another month, but promised I would continue to receive movies
review: I had to cancel Netflix because they changed their website, which is now inaccessible. You have to have the newest computer and browser to access it. To cancel, they told me I had to pay for another month, but promised I would continue to receive movies during this last month. They lied. They refuse to send me any more movies. They are charging me for a full month, but are refusing to provide the service they charged me for. My queue keeps say, "Will ship as soon as possible." That was over two weeks ago. They ripped me off. They committed fraud and they don't care. When I called to complain, the rep was flippant and acted like they and the company were above the law. When I threatened to turn them to consumer affairs, they said, "Do whatever you want. We don't care." It's clear this company has thrown away their humanity for profits. They are crooks!

preview: I have been trying to get Nextflix to stop triple billing me for almost one year. After finding out, from their own employees, that my old, closed account had been reactivated and billed without my consent, I was repeatedly assured the problem would be s
review:
I have been trying to get Nextflix to stop triple billing me for almost one year. After finding out, from their own employees, that my old, closed account had been reactivated and billed without my consent, I was repeatedly assured the problem would be solved and the duplicate charges would be refunded. In June of this year, a customer service person at Netflix told me that the company tries to reactivate all old accounts and it is very often successful in double billing customers who may not notice it on their statements right away.
Read full review

preview: They don’t send any good DVDs in my queue. No matter how many months, some years, that it’s in my queue. I have a part 3 of a series in queue for over 4 months. If you can’t send it, don’t list it. I have been a customer for over 5 years. I am going to c
review: They don’t send any good DVDs in my queue. No matter how many months, some years, that it’s in my queue. I have a part 3 of a series in queue for over 4 months. If you can’t send it, don’t list it. I have been a customer for over 5 years. I am going to cancel my service.

preview: I re-signed with Netflix tonight to start - just streaming. I went to check my account to do my books and they charged me three times: two payments of $7.99 and a payment of $8.54. I called Netflix angry because I didn't authorize but one payment. Wanda
review: I re-signed with Netflix tonight to start - just streaming. I went to check my account to do my books and they charged me three times: two payments of $7.99 and a payment of $8.54. I called Netflix angry because I didn't authorize but one payment. Wanda answered the call and was all sassy over the phone. I asked for a manager and explained the issue and he thought it was all funny and then hung up on me. Netflix doesn't hold their reps responsible for how they talk to customers over the phone and could care less about their customers. It's not worth the $7.99 I paid for the month. I'm leaving them and launching a complaint here in Florida for how they treat their customers.

preview: We are trying to watch a great movie and the voice is not in sync with the mouth movement. It is very annoying, to say the least!
review: We are trying to watch a great movie and the voice is not in sync with the mouth movement. It is very annoying, to say the least!

preview: I had been a customer for many years but lately, 90% of the movie selections in my queue were available but with a "very long wait". I cancelled my membership figuring I would go back after a few months and try again. I had paid up through the 4th of the
review: I had been a customer for many years but lately, 90% of the movie selections in my queue were available but with a "very long wait". I cancelled my membership figuring I would go back after a few months and try again. I had paid up through the 4th of the month so I had one more movie coming (one of the few that were available). It came broken, so I notified them and mailed it back as directed. It was still within my paid period. When they got the broken disk, they sent an email stating they had received it but were not replacing it. I called and asked that they send the movie that I had paid for but they refused. We are not talking about a great loss here, but is this any way to treat a customer who would have come back when my movie titles were available? Now I won't go back. I'll rent from a local store and forget Netflix.

preview: Netflix TV Series - We are having trouble watching movies on our iPads. The movies keep stopping and then starting up again, very frustrating!
review: Netflix TV Series - We are having trouble watching movies on our iPads. The movies keep stopping and then starting up again, very frustrating!

preview: When signing on to Netflix, I am asked if I want to download a newer version of Netflix that has something to do with children. In the past I had a choice of “yes” or “no.” Now, there is only one response - yes. Now, I can't access Netflix through my Wii
review: When signing on to Netflix, I am asked if I want to download a newer version of Netflix that has something to do with children. In the past I had a choice of “yes” or “no.” Now, there is only one response - yes. Now, I can't access Netflix through my Wii - very frustrating. What do I need to do next?

preview: On the home page of our Netflix account, new releases are posted. When we opened our Netflix account, we set our preferences for family-based viewing. Recently, however, the new arrivals are increasingly **, with gay and lesbian themes. I called customer
review:
On the home page of our Netflix account, new releases are posted. When we opened our Netflix account, we set our preferences for family-based viewing. Recently, however, the new arrivals are increasingly **, with gay and lesbian themes. I called customer support to request these viewing option be taken off our home page, but was informed that it would require me to set the parameters of all movies at a PG or PG-13 rating. I pointed out to the service agent that the gay and lesbian movies were not rated, or NR, and there was not an opt-out choice. I was then instructed to open each gay and lesbian movie, rate it and then delete it from our family's account.
Read full review

preview: Lack of choices: Breaking Bad Season 4 isn't available. Netflix has a horrible variety of shows.
review: Lack of choices: Breaking Bad Season 4 isn't available. Netflix has a horrible variety of shows.

preview: When Netflix first began, it was a dream. I have been a loyal customer for 6 years now. However, now, I have to wait months upon months to see a popular movie or TV show. For example, I have had Downton Abbey Season 2 at the top of my list for 4 months!
review: When Netflix first began, it was a dream. I have been a loyal customer for 6 years now. However, now, I have to wait months upon months to see a popular movie or TV show. For example, I have had Downton Abbey Season 2 at the top of my list for 4 months! I called to complain and they said they just didn't have enough copies. Okay, fine, but 4 months? I am seriously thinking about cancelling the subscription and then just using the Redbox like everyone else. The only thing that keeps me from doing this is that sometimes I want to watch an older movie. So where do I go for that? Blockbuster is an extinct species. Ugh.

preview: I am a "one-disc-at-a-time" subscriber to Netflix and frequently get defective discs. For example, a month ago, I ordered Mad Men (Season 1, Disc 1). It was defective. I sent it back, and they sent a replacement supposedly. I never saw it. They told me l
review: I am a "one-disc-at-a-time" subscriber to Netflix and frequently get defective discs. For example, a month ago, I ordered Mad Men (Season 1, Disc 1). It was defective. I sent it back, and they sent a replacement supposedly. I never saw it. They told me later it was damaged in shipment and returned to them. I requested a third copy. It was fine. Tonight, I went to watch Disc 2. It's defective. And yes, I cleaned and polished it, and it still won't play. So I wait another 5 days for a replacement. It does no good to call Netflix, which cannily has no email address so you can give them some substantive information on the problem. It's frustrating. They have poor customer service. CEO Reed Hastings sends us YouTube videos when he wants to reach us, but he gives us no way to reach him.

preview: For some reason probably because y'all are money hungry, you guys decided to put ads in where I watch my movies on the Instant Play. That sucks because I now cannot see the whole screen of the movies nor can I enlarge the screen to full size and I can't
review: For some reason probably because y'all are money hungry, you guys decided to put ads in where I watch my movies on the Instant Play. That sucks because I now cannot see the whole screen of the movies nor can I enlarge the screen to full size and I can't even control the sound, nothing really. I can do nothing at all. So fix it if you want to keep my money coming in and anyone who I talk to.

preview: I understand and accept the splitting of the streaming and DVD to home services where the charges are like $7.99 plus tax for each. Having said that, the only ways that you can pay is either through direct monthly charges to one's bank account, credit ca
review: I understand and accept the splitting of the streaming and DVD to home services where the charges are like $7.99 plus tax for each. Having said that, the only ways that you can pay is either through direct monthly charges to one's bank account, credit card, or by buying a paid subscription and then redeeming that subscription so that the monthly charges are deducted from it. The deducted charges from the subscription are not itemized, and so, you do not know exactly what you have left over. Why do they have to make it so difficult? Why can't they just have a way of paying using a credit card, debit card, or bank account where you can buy for instance 12 months in advance for the services you have chosen in your account? It is almost like Netflix is trying to hide earnings from the government, and the way that they charge, it would be very easy to do and the government tax bean counters could never figure it out. There is something not right with Netflix's billing system, and someone needs to take a look into the books.

preview: Netflix changed their services and notified their customers by email. That was the only correspondence and then doubled the billings. When we discovered this, they would only refund us for three months of overbilling.
review: Netflix changed their services and notified their customers by email. That was the only correspondence and then doubled the billings. When we discovered this, they would only refund us for three months of overbilling.

preview: I tried out Netflix 1 month trial but after reading the contract, I realized that if I didn’t cancel before the end of trial I would then start to be charged. I realized that I was moving house in a couple of weeks, so after a week, I decided to cancel.
review: I tried out Netflix 1 month trial but after reading the contract, I realized that if I didn’t cancel before the end of trial I would then start to be charged. I realized that I was moving house in a couple of weeks, so after a week, I decided to cancel. I got an e-mail saying it would be cancelled at the end of the current month. I put Netflix into my junk mail and forgot about them. I have just found out that they didn’t cancel and charged me for 2 months and there’s no way to get in touch with them except by phone, which is a waste of time. Any ideas of what to do next?

preview: I am irritated with this list of what I think I want to watch. I don’t have a list of favorite. What I want is to see what is available, not a list of what Netflix thinks I like. Of course no one at Netflix reads this so it’s a waste of time to complain.
review: I am irritated with this list of what I think I want to watch. I don’t have a list of favorite. What I want is to see what is available, not a list of what Netflix thinks I like. Of course no one at Netflix reads this so it’s a waste of time to complain.

preview: They want to move viewers to streaming. You have to have movies that people want to watch: Mission Impossible: Ghost Protocol? No. The Grey? No. Underworld Awakening? No. Contraband? No. Iron Man, yeah, they have 2, but not 1? The streaming collection is
review: They want to move viewers to streaming. You have to have movies that people want to watch: Mission Impossible: Ghost Protocol? No. The Grey? No. Underworld Awakening? No. Contraband? No. Iron Man, yeah, they have 2, but not 1? The streaming collection is like B Movie Central with a few cheap classics thrown in. You can purchase the streaming (all of them) cheaper than to pay for the extra price of streaming per month! Sad. There are better streaming sites and this one just does not cut it.

preview: I have several complaints to voice with Netflix now that I have cancelled my account with them. They are not a customer-oriented/-friendly business. They are only accessible via telephone; there is no way to email or contact this company by any other mea
review: I have several complaints to voice with Netflix now that I have cancelled my account with them. They are not a customer-oriented/-friendly business. They are only accessible via telephone; there is no way to email or contact this company by any other means. They have the one-month hook subscription. I cancelled on the same day as my bill was due, and now must pay for another full month before the cancellation takes effect. They spin this as, "You can enjoy watching your favorite movies till the subscription runs out." Nine out of every 10 movies that I wish to see are only available by mail. This makes having a online streaming-only membership a near complete waste.

preview: Another scratched or ruined DVD - Half way through Rango, it stopped working. This happens too often! Does anyone check our choices before they are sent out? Please send our next two choices at once without any further price. We are very tired of your po
review: Another scratched or ruined DVD - Half way through Rango, it stopped working. This happens too often! Does anyone check our choices before they are sent out? Please send our next two choices at once without any further price. We are very tired of your poor service.

preview: Netflix is not a customer-friendly company. So don't expect to be treated fairly. Case in point, the only way to contact Netflix is via telephone, where the staff is under-educated and could care less about any problem you may have. This is understandabl
review:
Netflix is not a customer-friendly company. So don't expect to be treated fairly. Case in point, the only way to contact Netflix is via telephone, where the staff is under-educated and could care less about any problem you may have. This is understandable, because nobody would want a job where people call you with complaints that you don't have the authority to fix.

review: Netflix browser not working, customer service was unhelpful. I have contacted Netflix and spoke to a guy named Richard, ID **, and asked him to help me solve an issue with Netflix. His answer was, "You should check your computer with a technician. Nothing we can do for you!" What a crap service!
