review: New update to iPad Netflix - I used to be able to maximize the video on screen and the update took that away. With my vision, I need this feature. Please return this feature to iPad!

preview: I have not received a movie for a year. I do not know. You simply stopped contacting me and then billing me for $5.17/month. I want to cancel and receive compensation for 1 year of billing for getting nothing, $65.00. I have called Visa and told them not
review: I have not received a movie for a year. I do not know. You simply stopped contacting me and then billing me for $5.17/month. I want to cancel and receive compensation for 1 year of billing for getting nothing, $65.00. I have called Visa and told them not to pay you anymore. Please let me know.

preview: After a one-month free trial, I decided to get a subscription to Netflix. I felt the price was worth it for the selection and I didn't have any problems with them during that month. But when I signed up, they charged me twice. I called them and they said
review:
After a one-month free trial, I decided to get a subscription to Netflix. I felt the price was worth it for the selection and I didn't have any problems with them during that month. But when I signed up, they charged me twice. I called them and they said that the first charge was to verify my card and it would be put back in my account in 5 days. I thought that was weird, but I left it at that. The next day after I had some time to think about it, I started to get mad. That makes no sense at all. Charge my card the fee to verify and be done with it. Whether they plan on putting it back or not, I gave them permission to take the $7.99 off my card and not more.
Read full review

preview: Streaming Netflix has three gaping flaws. One, they provide very poor content to the streaming users. This crap should be free, and is free with a service like Hulu. Two, they have a nearly criminal policy when it comes to monthly fees, such as charging
review: Streaming Netflix has three gaping flaws. One, they provide very poor content to the streaming users. This crap should be free, and is free with a service like Hulu. Two, they have a nearly criminal policy when it comes to monthly fees, such as charging bank accounts periodically after cancellation and forcing membership via the one-month trial hook, sometimes failing to honor the trial cancellation. Three, their advertising is intentionally ambiguous when it comes to the stream vs. DVD differences. If you want a lot of cartoons for your child because you don't have cable and hate watching PBS Barney and Sid the Science Kid, then this is for you. If you love to explore a small selection of B movies, then this is for you. If you like being yelled at over the phone by the same people who are stealing from you, then this is for you. Otherwise, try checking out almost anything else.

preview: For several evenings in a row, I have clicked on Netflix sign-in but to no avail. I have tried over and over again, but the Netflix site does not come up. Please check to see if the problem is on your side or mine. This is very frustrating.
review: For several evenings in a row, I have clicked on Netflix sign-in but to no avail. I have tried over and over again, but the Netflix site does not come up. Please check to see if the problem is on your side or mine. This is very frustrating.

preview: Shows stop with long delays every few minutes. If this continues, I will cancel soon.
review: Shows stop with long delays every few minutes. If this continues, I will cancel soon.

review: Defective Disc - "Playing By Heart" was received cracked and unusable.

preview: Our son gave us a gift subscription for the Christmas holidays, which he paid for. We expected to be able to access the site and watch movies while we were on winter vacation, but no such luck. We were told when we called that the reason we could not jus
review:
Our son gave us a gift subscription for the Christmas holidays, which he paid for. We expected to be able to access the site and watch movies while we were on winter vacation, but no such luck. We were told when we called that the reason we could not just access was that we would have to submit our credit card information, even though we were not the ones paying for the account. We gave that information, even though that seemed strange but were later told there was still a problem with the account. We were near the renewal of the card and had not received our new card yet. We gave new information, but still could not access the service.
Read full review

preview: After hardly using the service for more than three years, I called to cancel. They told me that I had two of their films, which I had never received, even though they were on my queue years ago. I told them I had only used the streaming service on my iPa
review: After hardly using the service for more than three years, I called to cancel. They told me that I had two of their films, which I had never received, even though they were on my queue years ago. I told them I had only used the streaming service on my iPad occasionally and that I didn't ever receive the films. The customer service guy said he would adjust the account and not bill me for them and cancel with my most recent payment that week. I received an email confirming this. Two or three days later, I got another email saying further movies were on the way! I sent them back as soon as they arrived, saying my account was closed. They kept coming, and then I found I was being charged $15 for them! They pulled the money from my account a month later. I've heard horror stories like this about them since. They should be put out of business. As to this date, they still have my money and account open.

preview: If a movie or TV show was available only on DVD, I used to be able to see it. Now, the site says I cannot see what is available until I change my plan and pay for the DVD service. I think they have blocked me because they changed my plan to include DVD's
review: If a movie or TV show was available only on DVD, I used to be able to see it. Now, the site says I cannot see what is available until I change my plan and pay for the DVD service. I think they have blocked me because they changed my plan to include DVD's a few months ago by mistake (possibly mine), and had to refund me $2.08 (prorated) which they only refunded $2.00 anyway. They kept saying that their streaming content is going to be awesome soon. Well, it’s been a year and I don't see any more or better content. They are awful, even if they act polite. I cannot wait until another company has decent streaming content.

preview: I was notified that there was a problem with my credit card, which happens to be valid because I use it all the time. Nevertheless, I cannot change any details about payment method because I cannot get customer service on the phone. The telephone number
review: I was notified that there was a problem with my credit card, which happens to be valid because I use it all the time. Nevertheless, I cannot change any details about payment method because I cannot get customer service on the phone. The telephone number does not work and there's no email address. I need not mention that while this problem persists, I cannot watch movies (which I've already paid for). Unacceptable!

preview: I set up an account for my son to have access to Netflix back in August 2007. Recently, over the past few months I noticed charges taken out of his account twice. I had him to call several times in the past and nothing happened, so I decided to place the
review:
I set up an account for my son to have access to Netflix back in August 2007. Recently, over the past few months I noticed charges taken out of his account twice. I had him to call several times in the past and nothing happened, so I decided to place the call. Netflix was taking two payments for the same account. When a person already has an account and tried to open another account, I think it's ironic that there is no type of flag or security measure to let them know they already have an account. He used the same log in, password and credit card. The other account was opened in April 2011.
Read full review

preview: Like so many on this site, my credit card has been illegally charged for Netflix service for several months. I cancelled my service in November and foolishly thought I would try it again in December. I cancelled over the phone one hour later in December
review: Like so many on this site, my credit card has been illegally charged for Netflix service for several months. I cancelled my service in November and foolishly thought I would try it again in December. I cancelled over the phone one hour later in December because the silver light settings or something similar didn't work, and thought that was the end of it. Then I discovered they continued to charge (for at least one account) for several months onward after that. They refused to refund more than two months of the illegal charges, and told me to call my credit card to get the remainder. I will do more than that. I will sue them in small claims court for the $9 per month. What an insane business model. Sign people up, provide bad service so they quit, and then simply keep charging their credit cards. There should be a national law requiring firms to pay back these illegal charges.

preview: I pay for unlimited streaming for videos because I know me and my family. We do not do well with actual DVD’s. The DVD program would not work for us for we would either lose or break the ** things. I would think that with unlimited streaming, you would b
review:
I pay for unlimited streaming for videos because I know me and my family. We do not do well with actual DVD’s. The DVD program would not work for us for we would either lose or break the ** things. I would think that with unlimited streaming, you would be able to stream for at least the common household number of inhabitants, which are 4. Since the average American home is, two adults with 1 or 2 children. Rounded to, of course, 4-5 people per household. Why is it limited to 2 pieces of technology? Why not 4?
Read full review

preview: The program stopped and there was no signal and didn’t resume at all in the middle of a movie. This happened several times in the last week. If you can’t fix it, please let me know as I will not want pay for a service I am not receiving. Thanks in advanc
review: The program stopped and there was no signal and didn’t resume at all in the middle of a movie. This happened several times in the last week. If you can’t fix it, please let me know as I will not want pay for a service I am not receiving. Thanks in advance for your prompt help with this matter.

preview: Most of my mailed DVDs do not fast forward. In addition to that, some of them will not accept my "play" button input. Therefore, I am unable to watch the movie. I have been a faithful member of Netflix (4 movie package) for many years but am considering
review: Most of my mailed DVDs do not fast forward. In addition to that, some of them will not accept my "play" button input. Therefore, I am unable to watch the movie. I have been a faithful member of Netflix (4 movie package) for many years but am considering researching other companies. This is extremely annoying! I also have received many more "scratched, unwatchable" movies. The quality service Netflix provided in the past seems to keep getting worse. I don't know how they will stay in business at this rate.

preview: I have tried over and over (by email & phone call) to get Netflix to change my (El Paso, TX) address on file with them to my residence in Okinawa, Japan. Nothing has been done. This is so aggravating and unnecessary. They will not respond directly to my
review: I have tried over and over (by email & phone call) to get Netflix to change my (El Paso, TX) address on file with them to my residence in Okinawa, Japan. Nothing has been done. This is so aggravating and unnecessary. They will not respond directly to my email. There is little to almost no support. I need Netflix to change my mail address as I have requested them to do.

preview: I use Netflix to watch my favorite TV shows such as Family Guy and American Dad. I have recently gone back to school and in between classes, I like to watch these shows. Anyways, the updates on these shows are painfully slow and I am losing faith that Ne
review: I use Netflix to watch my favorite TV shows such as Family Guy and American Dad. I have recently gone back to school and in between classes, I like to watch these shows. Anyways, the updates on these shows are painfully slow and I am losing faith that Netflix will update them anytime soon. The movie selection is terrible. Their suggestions are way off. You can't add or delete anything off of the selection bars and the new application and format for Xbox 360 just plain sucks. Instead of updating the applications, why don't you give your customers more selections and more interaction?

preview: I have been charged six times by Netflix when I only had their service for less than a month. I would like to have my money back as soon as possible.
review: I have been charged six times by Netflix when I only had their service for less than a month. I would like to have my money back as soon as possible.

preview: My Netflix keeps loading throughout the whole movie. It’s very frustrating, especially when the kids keep complaining.
review: My Netflix keeps loading throughout the whole movie. It’s very frustrating, especially when the kids keep complaining.

preview: I see that I am not the only one. It appears that the Netflix Free Trial is a hook to scam people who choose not to continue the service after the free trial period expires. I am sure Netflix would do just as well if they build their reputation on honest
review: I see that I am not the only one. It appears that the Netflix Free Trial is a hook to scam people who choose not to continue the service after the free trial period expires. I am sure Netflix would do just as well if they build their reputation on honesty and integrity, rather than getting people to try their product/service with no way out, which leads to causing people grief. I will tell everyone I know about my experience with the Netflix free trial offer. It epitomizes the sayings "Nothing is Free" and "Buyers Beware." I hope Netflix reads this. I choose not to continue the service I signed up for, and I am trying to cancel the free trial. Please do not take any more money from this retired old lady on fixed income.

preview: Netflix has been charging my account without proper authorization. I requested a credit and was denied. This is certainly not the way to do business. I cancelled this account over a year ago. Indeed my account history reflects and substantiates the disco
review: Netflix has been charging my account without proper authorization. I requested a credit and was denied. This is certainly not the way to do business. I cancelled this account over a year ago. Indeed my account history reflects and substantiates the discontinuation on the use of their services and the basis for my compliant. How does a company get away with these types of business process? There are multiple complaints against this company. Why isn't anyone doing something about it? As consumers, we have no protection from these companies robbing our accounts.

preview: Unlimited nothing - Every time I like a movie it becomes no longer available the next day. The movies that they offer their customers are the same movies you would see in the $3 and $5 bin at Walmart. I can’t believe that I never heard of most of the mov
review: Unlimited nothing - Every time I like a movie it becomes no longer available the next day. The movies that they offer their customers are the same movies you would see in the $3 and $5 bin at Walmart. I can’t believe that I never heard of most of the movies that are being given. I’m definitely unsubscribing before my next bill hits.

preview: Movie not on as advertised - I googled a movie Soul Surfer and rent and Netflix was the first one listed so I joined to watch the movie. After joining, I find that the movie isn't on there.
review: Movie not on as advertised - I googled a movie Soul Surfer and rent and Netflix was the first one listed so I joined to watch the movie. After joining, I find that the movie isn't on there.

preview: I was recently very annoyed by Netflix. I went to their site and browsed their selections. I wanted to watch American Horror Story. When I typed it in, the title came up. It gave a description of the show and that was all. It didn't state only available
review: I was recently very annoyed by Netflix. I went to their site and browsed their selections. I wanted to watch American Horror Story. When I typed it in, the title came up. It gave a description of the show and that was all. It didn't state only available on DVD or will not be available until such and such a date. So, I sign up thinking I will be able to watch it. Nope, they don't have it available at all. When I called to question they stated that it was a series they hoped to acquire in the future. What? You advertise it on your site and then when people sign up, you don't actually have it. This has to be considered a scam.

preview: I got Netflix a few months ago. I looked at the categories provided. I looked for the film that I wanted, but I can’t find it. So I searched for it in the search bar and it said this: “There are no matches for your search." So I got concerned. Then, I se
review: I got Netflix a few months ago. I looked at the categories provided. I looked for the film that I wanted, but I can’t find it. So I searched for it in the search bar and it said this: “There are no matches for your search." So I got concerned. Then, I searched for another movie and it repeated to say the same thing. Now, I searched for films that are old and it still said: "There are no matches for your search.” Can you please help me and give me some answers? Thank you. I don’t want to pay for something that does not do what was on the advertisement.

preview: So I had to resign and join even though I been with Netflix for a long time. I tried 3 times. Finally, after the 3rd time, Netflix got $16.38 with tax plus $8.40 for 3 DVDs out at a time with unlimited streaming. They took $40.76 but when I called custom
review: So I had to resign and join even though I been with Netflix for a long time. I tried 3 times. Finally, after the 3rd time, Netflix got $16.38 with tax plus $8.40 for 3 DVDs out at a time with unlimited streaming. They took $40.76 but when I called customer service, I was told $15.98 was on hold and would come back after 3 days. It has not come back to me and I am mad and never going to sign up for their DVD plans again. They have the worst billing practices ever. I am writing to warn people about this problem not to rent from them or Redbox too. Worst companies ever!

preview: I enjoyed watching Naruto, Bleach, and Inuyasha. However, yesterday, they were all gone. Only Naruto was there but season 1 and part of season 2 had disappeared. I would like to know why and I would like it if you will put them back on. Those were the on
review: I enjoyed watching Naruto, Bleach, and Inuyasha. However, yesterday, they were all gone. Only Naruto was there but season 1 and part of season 2 had disappeared. I would like to know why and I would like it if you will put them back on. Those were the only reasons why I joined Netflix. I wished at least there was information to let us know what shows you were taking away. I hoped that that could have made the situation better. I would just beg for you to put them back. It might have nothing to do with this, but watching those shows was the only time I could relax. And I think that is what Netflix is supposed to do. It is supposed to entertain people. That is what I thought and hoped it was supposed to be. Please consider my thoughts. Thank you.

preview: My 3-year old daughter received a gift certificate at Christmas for a 6-month use of Netflix. We went through all the sign up process, including entering a Visa number to register. Last month, my card was compromised and was cancelled. As I do not own a
review:
My 3-year old daughter received a gift certificate at Christmas for a 6-month use of Netflix. We went through all the sign up process, including entering a Visa number to register. Last month, my card was compromised and was cancelled. As I do not own a credit card now, Netflix sent me an email telling me my account was suspended as of April 1, 2012. I called customer service and spoke with a gentleman who informed me even though I had already paid for the 6-month service with a gift certificate, I needed a new credit card so they could get authorization each month. I told him that if I got a prepaid credit card, I would have to pay the fees on the card to get my already paid service. He said yes.
Read full review

preview: I am very frustrated that I cannot have categories that I do not want to see and have no interest in taking off my scroll list. I do not nor do I want my children to see gay and lesbian movies as one of the choices when they scroll down to see a movie on
review: I am very frustrated that I cannot have categories that I do not want to see and have no interest in taking off my scroll list. I do not nor do I want my children to see gay and lesbian movies as one of the choices when they scroll down to see a movie on Netflix. My kids talked me into the free month and when I saw that I was frustrated. How can that category be on the same screen as kids TV and family friendly movies? All I wanted was for it to be taken off as a choice. I was told I could only block the content, but the movies would still show up on the screen. I canceled for that reason.

preview: I have been reading all these complaints about Netflix and wanted to let you know that I have received good service with them. I subscribe to the DVD and streaming. The content for streaming is not the fault of Netflix but the person who owns the movies.
review:
I have been reading all these complaints about Netflix and wanted to let you know that I have received good service with them. I subscribe to the DVD and streaming. The content for streaming is not the fault of Netflix but the person who owns the movies. You have to be licensed to stream a movie and the royalties are more expensive as it is based on the number of subscribers. I know this and that is why I subscribe to both.
Read full review

preview: Movie titles - Why so many B movies? Some movies I never heard of. I'm 62 and heard of a lot of movies. When do you add new movies to selection?
review: Movie titles - Why so many B movies? Some movies I never heard of. I'm 62 and heard of a lot of movies. When do you add new movies to selection?

preview: Netfix's introductory page says "Unlimited movies & TV episodes, streaming instantly over the Internet to your computer or TV," which is followed by a list of genres to search through. But the search apparently includes movies that are not available for
review: Netfix's introductory page says "Unlimited movies & TV episodes, streaming instantly over the Internet to your computer or TV," which is followed by a list of genres to search through. But the search apparently includes movies that are not available for streaming, for after joining, one finds that many of one's choices are available on DVD only. It's bait-and-switch, with a misleading headline. The streaming content is vastly inferior to what is on DVD. Netflix never explains why all their best films are limited to DVDs, which must be a lot more expensive for them to mail out than streaming.

preview: Nov 2010, I was told I needed a new credit card for my account that the old card was not acceptable. After making several attempts, I finally gave them another card. What I didn't notice that I had been being billed to both cards one for the regular rent
review:
Nov 2010, I was told I needed a new credit card for my account that the old card was not acceptable. After making several attempts, I finally gave them another card. What I didn't notice that I had been being billed to both cards one for the regular rental, which is what I had always had and wanted the other was for the streaming and I did not want. I only discovered the problem when I put my account on hold. I continued to put it on hold until I saw the charges were no longer deducted. This took from Jan to present, which is March 23, to discover they had been billing both cards since Nov. 2010.
Read full review

preview: My son is in the US Army and currently deployed to war. I had to transfer some money to him and noticed that Netflix had taken $7.99 out. I asked him why he started his Netflix account up while deployed. He said that he did not and asked me to check into
review:
My son is in the US Army and currently deployed to war. I had to transfer some money to him and noticed that Netflix had taken $7.99 out. I asked him why he started his Netflix account up while deployed. He said that he did not and asked me to check into it. I found that under his account, he showed that his account was canceled in December 2011. But on his bank statement, it showed that Netflix had taken their $7.99 out three other random times this year alone.
Read full review

preview: I signed up for the free month with Netflix. I opened one account with Netflix and closed that account with Netflix. Since they had an old email address of mine, they continued to bill me for months. They said that the day I closed my account, I opened a
review: I signed up for the free month with Netflix. I opened one account with Netflix and closed that account with Netflix. Since they had an old email address of mine, they continued to bill me for months. They said that the day I closed my account, I opened a new one with my old email address. Since they had all my banking information, it made it real easy for them to continue billing me. I didn't notice until recently because I don't go over my statements all the time. Netflix is banking on that! They will only reimburse me for one month. The man on the phone keeps repeating that I opened a new account and keeps repeating that. Netflix is the type of business that rips off little old ladies’ purses. I'm getting all my account information back from them. I will never, ever use them again. Watch out, Netflix has your bank information.

preview: When I started using Netflix 3 years ago, it cost $9.99 per month. The bill kept going up from there and I now pay $16.61 a month. I only receive DVDs in the mail, no streaming. The ads on TV say it'll cost $8.00 per month for all services. This morning
review: When I started using Netflix 3 years ago, it cost $9.99 per month. The bill kept going up from there and I now pay $16.61 a month. I only receive DVDs in the mail, no streaming. The ads on TV say it'll cost $8.00 per month for all services. This morning I went to check in with my e-mail and password and it wouldn't let me in. So I sent my e-mail address and they were supposed to send a link to change my password but it never happened. I want to cancel my account but there's no way to contact them. Recently I was sent a mail about a lawsuit against Netflix. I am very angry and want to just cancel my account and go with another company. My account is charged monthly to my Visa on the 13th.

preview: I received this movie and couldn’t watch it. The movie was mailed to me all broken up and my family and I couldn’t watch the movie and don’t want to be held responsible for this movie that we can’t watch. If this is what I have to look forward to, there’
review: I received this movie and couldn’t watch it. The movie was mailed to me all broken up and my family and I couldn’t watch the movie and don’t want to be held responsible for this movie that we can’t watch. If this is what I have to look forward to, there’s no reason I should keep an account with Netflix. I am not pleased. The movie came in a protection case. Too many movies will be destroyed.

preview: What happened is that Netflix hires monkeys to pick shows on Netflix; therefore, people are starting to get unsatisfied not getting what they pay for. If they’re going to have part 1 to a movie and part 2 to a movie, then grow a brain and have part 3. If
review: What happened is that Netflix hires monkeys to pick shows on Netflix; therefore, people are starting to get unsatisfied not getting what they pay for. If they’re going to have part 1 to a movie and part 2 to a movie, then grow a brain and have part 3. If you’re going to have movies with 1 to 3 stars, don’t put them on here, idiot!

preview: Back in November, I found out I was being charged $16 instead of the originally agreed to $8, then later notified $9, then $10 and then this. So I had them switch the account to streaming only for $8 again. Then, as I was reviewing my credit statements f
review:
Back in November, I found out I was being charged $16 instead of the originally agreed to $8, then later notified $9, then $10 and then this. So I had them switch the account to streaming only for $8 again. Then, as I was reviewing my credit statements for the past several months I realized that they were again charging me $16/ month.
Read full review

preview: Can't log into my account, plus I haven't received another DVD - It keeps saying that my password doesn't work. What password should I be using? I can't add more movies to my account. I sent in my DVD well over a week ago. It said they received it, but I
review: Can't log into my account, plus I haven't received another DVD - It keeps saying that my password doesn't work. What password should I be using? I can't add more movies to my account. I sent in my DVD well over a week ago. It said they received it, but I haven't gotten another one.

preview: After being a Netflix customer for some years, they split the DVDs from streaming and double the fee. So I cut back to only the streaming. The streaming selection is pitiful, and I'm sure it's deliberate. Now, there is no Starz and no credit. Consumers a
review:
After being a Netflix customer for some years, they split the DVDs from streaming and double the fee. So I cut back to only the streaming. The streaming selection is pitiful, and I'm sure it's deliberate. Now, there is no Starz and no credit. Consumers are being charged for something that is no longer available. How can they be allowed to get away with that?
Read full review

preview: Netflix cut their Starz content from their instant watch streaming with no advance warning. I received no information from them at all in advance. I was in the middle of watching the Gunsmoke TV series, and suddenly was unable to see it in their listings
review:
Netflix cut their Starz content from their instant watch streaming with no advance warning. I received no information from them at all in advance. I was in the middle of watching the Gunsmoke TV series, and suddenly was unable to see it in their listings. Further searches revealed what they had done. I had an instant Q (list of all my personal selections to watch, over 450 or so) and over 300 of them were gone and no way to get them.
Read full review

preview: I was on Netflix through my TV and every movie I searched for was not there to watch instantly. None! I typed in at least 6 movies which for each I got the same response. There are no matches for your search. Can you not at least update it or put more of
review: I was on Netflix through my TV and every movie I searched for was not there to watch instantly. None! I typed in at least 6 movies which for each I got the same response. There are no matches for your search. Can you not at least update it or put more of a variety of other films from the 60's and 70's and 80's which no one cares for? Seriously aggravated at this "Netflix," which doesn't seem so great to me anymore.

preview: The DVD Minority Report arrived broken in several pieces. I've never seen a DVD in such poor condition. There should be quality control. Plus, I can't get to the complaint part of the regular Netflix webpage.
review: The DVD Minority Report arrived broken in several pieces. I've never seen a DVD in such poor condition. There should be quality control. Plus, I can't get to the complaint part of the regular Netflix webpage.

preview: Today, due to a break down between Starz and Netflix, Netflix subscribers no longer have access to the Starz content via streaming. When I called their customer support number, I was given a long list of why it’s happening and what they have coming in th
review:
Today, due to a break down between Starz and Netflix, Netflix subscribers no longer have access to the Starz content via streaming. When I called their customer support number, I was given a long list of why it’s happening and what they have coming in the future with no results for here and now. When I asked them what they could do for me, I was informed that the only thing they can do for me would be to up my bill and allow me to have access to the DVD's they offer. Now, if I wanted to pay more for that, I would have never gone to just streaming, I would have kept the DVD portion of my plan. They did tell me that they are hoping to get some of the content back in the next few months and when I asked them what am I supposed to do till then, I was informed that I could put my account on a hold and then come back to it when they have this resolved.
Read full review

preview: I knew I made a mistake by selecting streaming for $7.99 and immediately changed it to my regular x2 a month movies mailed to me. I was charged $7.99 and then it was taken off 2-27 plus the charges of $8.41 and $4.28 on same date. Then on 2-28 I was char
review: I knew I made a mistake by selecting streaming for $7.99 and immediately changed it to my regular x2 a month movies mailed to me. I was charged $7.99 and then it was taken off 2-27 plus the charges of $8.41 and $4.28 on same date. Then on 2-28 I was charged the $8.41 and $4.28 again. Can you please take off these charges on my account or at least explain what they are?

preview: Netflix has screwed me out of 2 years of service that I have already paid. It suspended my account and refused to reinstate it until I give them an active credit card, even though I have 2 years' worth of redeemed gift certificate on my account. There wa
review:
Netflix has screwed me out of 2 years of service that I have already paid. It suspended my account and refused to reinstate it until I give them an active credit card, even though I have 2 years' worth of redeemed gift certificate on my account. There was no notice, no phone call, absolutely no notice of the suspension.
Read full review

preview: Downgrade Search feature Xbox 360 - I can no longer find any of the movies I would like to view using the Netflix search command. It stared a few months ago when there was an update to the 360 home page. I realized afterwards that the Netflix had been si
review: Downgrade Search feature Xbox 360 - I can no longer find any of the movies I would like to view using the Netflix search command. It stared a few months ago when there was an update to the 360 home page. I realized afterwards that the Netflix had been significantly downgraded, being most noticeable in the search feature. This letter is on behalf of both me and 6 others who strongly agree with me, we do not ask or expect anything in return, only that you consider restoring the search conditions to their previous state.

preview: I purchased a 6-month gift certificate for a friend and her family. They required and received a valid credit card and then proceeded to charge their bank account the first 2 months. My friend called and had the charges credited back to their bank accoun
review:
I purchased a 6-month gift certificate for a friend and her family. They required and received a valid credit card and then proceeded to charge their bank account the first 2 months. My friend called and had the charges credited back to their bank account. This week, they received notification that their account was cancelled because the credit card was no longer valid (so they were probably trying to charge the account again? ). When the person called and explained that the card was lost and would be replaced shortly, she was told that their policy is to have a valid card on file, even for an account that is paid for 4 more months.
Read full review

preview: I had a queue of 8 movies that could be shipped. One was an accidental reship of a movie we already saw. None of the others were sent. Neither the CSR nor her manager could tell me when all of the following were in my queue: Therese Raquin, Doctor in the
review:
I had a queue of 8 movies that could be shipped. One was an accidental reship of a movie we already saw. None of the others were sent. Neither the CSR nor her manager could tell me when all of the following were in my queue: Therese Raquin, Doctor in the House, Hell is a City, Martin Scorsese: Part 1 and 2, The Patriot, Tiger Bay, Wanted for Murder. Not one of them was shipped on 2/21 even though when my returned DVDs were received, three of these were listed as next in my queue. They also could not tell me how many copies Netflix has of each of the above movies or how many of those were rented. They could not explain why, when I placed these movies in my queue that, with one exception, there was no indication of a wait to get the movies neither "short wait" or "long wait".
Read full review

preview: I watched a few films over a month. Then when the free month was over, I was expecting new films and TV shows but no same old rubbish. Even when I looked on the search site for what I wanted, it was the same--nothing I want on and not what was advertised
review: I watched a few films over a month. Then when the free month was over, I was expecting new films and TV shows but no same old rubbish. Even when I looked on the search site for what I wanted, it was the same--nothing I want on and not what was advertised (100s of films and tV shows). It's not what it says. Good job, I have loved film.com, even if they don't have it to watch instantly, they still mail it to you. All in all, Netflix is very, very poor.

preview: They offer one month free but I have been charged. I signed to Netflix 2 days on the offer of one month free and able to cancel at anytime but I have charged $5.99 and I think this unacceptable. They can't offer a month free then charge the customer.
review: They offer one month free but I have been charged. I signed to Netflix 2 days on the offer of one month free and able to cancel at anytime but I have charged $5.99 and I think this unacceptable. They can't offer a month free then charge the customer.

preview: In September 2011, Netflix decided that they could make additional money by moving customers on the lowest price plan, to a different plan where they would charge for DVDs and streaming, without my permission. My total charge per month went from $10.69 t
review:
In September 2011, Netflix decided that they could make additional money by moving customers on the lowest price plan, to a different plan where they would charge for DVDs and streaming, without my permission. My total charge per month went from $10.69 to $17.10. I don't use streaming. They can see that I don't, and decided that a random email that they sent in July 2011 (that I never saw) would justify the change. They still have a value plan with DVDs only, which they could have reclassified me as being on, and then notified me by a letter and a phone call. I get many emails from them. I'm the email contact, but I'm not the one in my household watching most of the movies, and I don't care to read Netflix emails, when the subject lines just about say it all.
Read full review

preview: Deborah of Brooklyn on July 31, 2011 said it best. When you receive a defective disc, your only option is to send it back and Netflix sends you 2 discs the next time. This is useless to me since I can just watch one a week on the weekend, and getting a b
review: Deborah of Brooklyn on July 31, 2011 said it best. When you receive a defective disc, your only option is to send it back and Netflix sends you 2 discs the next time. This is useless to me since I can just watch one a week on the weekend, and getting a bad one means the weekend is ruined. And I'm paying them the $8 and just getting $6 worth of movies. I want a refund or credit to my account instead. I had to cancel since this has happened before. If I get a bad product from any business, I want a refund.

preview: Netflix began their quest to frustrating me when they began adding fees depending on how many instant streaming devices you are watching at once. I bought three instant streaming boxes for Christmas this year, believing that I could watch as many movies
review:
Netflix began their quest to frustrating me when they began adding fees depending on how many instant streaming devices you are watching at once. I bought three instant streaming boxes for Christmas this year, believing that I could watch as many movies I wanted to all at one time. Nope, I have to pay Netflix $30 per month. I continued normal business with them thinking I wouldn't have to pay much more to just get cable. Then they dropped my payment because I had a prepaid card? Whoa, hold on there, Netflix.
Read full review

preview: My husband received a 6 month gift certificate for Netflix. We are retired people living on a fixed income and never expected that Netflix would have been charging our credit card monthly after the subscription ran out after 6 months. When we called up t
review: My husband received a 6 month gift certificate for Netflix. We are retired people living on a fixed income and never expected that Netflix would have been charging our credit card monthly after the subscription ran out after 6 months. When we called up to initially activate this subscription gift, they insisted on our credit card information saying that we couldn't use the subscript.gift without posting our credit card information and that they wouldn't be charging us."It's just to have on file". Sure! You misrepresented to us, you lied and you stole our money. Shame on you. I will continue to tell people of your dishonest ways. You will lose more in Public Relations than you have stole from us! Then again, who knows how many unsuspecting people you have done this to. However, in time, the people will know!

preview: I have had Netflix DVD and streaming for many years. I do not like to deal with DVDs anymore and prefer streaming. I cancelled my Netflix DVD rental account recently and now have streaming only. I now notice that more and more of my choices are only avai
review: I have had Netflix DVD and streaming for many years. I do not like to deal with DVDs anymore and prefer streaming. I cancelled my Netflix DVD rental account recently and now have streaming only. I now notice that more and more of my choices are only available on DVD. This is driving me to purchase from Amazon and recently Hulu plus, more often than using Netflix. If Netflix thinks they can manipulate me back to paying for DVDs by making popular titles available only on DVD, they are mistaken. It is only driving me to look elsewhere for better streaming alternatives. They continue to be badly advised on what their current and future customer base wants and is willing to pay for.

preview: I have been charged £5.99 and not a member. I tried to get free trial but it wouldn't work. I think I should be given a refund. I will be removing all bank details. Thanks.
review: I have been charged £5.99 and not a member. I tried to get free trial but it wouldn't work. I think I should be given a refund. I will be removing all bank details. Thanks.

preview: Netflix has managed in less than a month to completely ** me off! That usually takes some doing! They took off streaming! They did this with lost! These are series where it’s necessary to watch every episode or a person could get lost! This seems like Ne
review:
Netflix has managed in less than a month to completely ** me off! That usually takes some doing! They took off streaming! They did this with lost! These are series where it’s necessary to watch every episode or a person could get lost! This seems like Netflix wants to lose its business and ** the customer. This is a tactic of Netflix for the customer to start paying for both streaming and DVDs. It pissed me off when they split them up in the first pay instead of that low cost they offered in the beginning. I see this as a strong arm tactic to get me to pay for DVDs. Like I said I really do not have any use for ordering DVDs and with my lifestyle I cannot. I am especially angry because I am in the third season of Heroes and this weekend I am laid up with some medical problems which this is the only thing I can do!
Read full review

preview: First Netflix jacked up their prices forcing many customers to leave. I signed up for Netflix unlimited streaming. Up until today, I could stream a TV show to Netflix on my computer while my son streamed a movie on the TV downstairs. Now we can no longer
review: First Netflix jacked up their prices forcing many customers to leave. I signed up for Netflix unlimited streaming. Up until today, I could stream a TV show to Netflix on my computer while my son streamed a movie on the TV downstairs. Now we can no longer use Netflix at the same time. Therefore, I am paying for unlimited streaming, but I am not getting unlimited streaming. I find this very upsetting especially after what Netflix did to their customer base last year. Another bad business decision?

preview: Why is your service absolutely ** in Ireland? I mean, come on, new movies are Kill Bill 2? Me and my friends actually joke about what you consider new. It’s detrimental to your customers that you provide such a ** service compared to the US version. Anyw
review: Why is your service absolutely ** in Ireland? I mean, come on, new movies are Kill Bill 2? Me and my friends actually joke about what you consider new. It’s detrimental to your customers that you provide such a ** service compared to the US version. Anyway, I only decided to contact you to say that we all know it’s ** in comparison and it’s up to you to fix it. Please understand I wasted my time to tell you this.

preview: This company, "Netflix" decides for no reason to throw up the Gay and Lesbian Genre of movies in my favorites and I had to shut down my Netflix to protect my family until this is resolved! They acted like I was some sort of oddball, is this really how ba
review: This company, "Netflix" decides for no reason to throw up the Gay and Lesbian Genre of movies in my favorites and I had to shut down my Netflix to protect my family until this is resolved! They acted like I was some sort of oddball, is this really how bad this country has become? Is there any morality left? The CEO is Reed Hastings and his phone number is 408-540-3700.

preview: I happened to come across this site while surfing the net and decided to browse through the comments. As from what I gathered, you just can't satisfy everyone. I have several friends who subscribe to Netflix and they are totally satisfied. I am a subscri
review: I happened to come across this site while surfing the net and decided to browse through the comments. As from what I gathered, you just can't satisfy everyone. I have several friends who subscribe to Netflix and they are totally satisfied. I am a subscriber as well and I enjoy every bit of it. I apologize if I offend anyone but what more do you expect for $7.99? Popcorn? As for picture quality, If you don't have a good ISP, maybe you're better off waiting or switching to a provider who offers better bandwidth. I personally stream Netflix on my TV but sometimes I log in with my laptop and I have no issues, even when I'm streaming wireless. As for the movies/shows, I am certain you can always find something that will suit you. Try being a bit more open. Browse through their huge collection and keep track of what you watch and add it up at the end of the month. See what it would of cost you if you went elsewhere. Just weigh the pros and cons for their service. Do you really think your losing out for $7.99?

preview: Netflix, they have that lawsuit going on with us, Netflix customers. We were watching a movie on Netflix. They interrupted our service and made me agree to not go along with the lawsuit that they have against them. It would not let disagree only agree so
review: Netflix, they have that lawsuit going on with us, Netflix customers. We were watching a movie on Netflix. They interrupted our service and made me agree to not go along with the lawsuit that they have against them. It would not let disagree only agree so then even after we paid for the month they did that. So we were forced to check that we won't sue Netflix or our service that we paid for already won't go back on.

preview: No new content in weeks. They did add a queue called “New Releases” which is populated almost entirely with shows and movies that have been available on Netflix for months if not years. Second, whatever AI they use to figure out my tastes, it's way off.
review: No new content in weeks. They did add a queue called “New Releases” which is populated almost entirely with shows and movies that have been available on Netflix for months if not years. Second, whatever AI they use to figure out my tastes, it's way off. Anime and gay and lesbian are not categories I want to see.

review: Why would you guys remove “That 70s Show”? That show is an all time great. I hope you guys put it back on. Now there is nothing on Netflix to watch. I pay like 9 bucks a month for this.

review: I put my account on "vacation hold" from 12/3/11-12/29/11. I thought they would not charge me for this period, but they did. After talking with them, the only way to get "credit" is to put the hold before your due date. Even though they explained their "policy" to me, I still couldn't understand it and how they could continue to charge even though services were on "hold."

review: You took that 70's show off and I love that show. I watch it all the time on Netflix and now I can't. You should bring that 70's show back to Netflix as soon as possible.

review:
Where do I begin? It had horrible picture. They forced me to go through troubleshooting which included a visit from a tech supervisor at Time Warner who made a printout of a high internet signal proving it was Netflix's poor signal, so when I went back to Netflix ,they said there was nothing they would do, even though I followed their protocol. They continued to remove movies from streaming forcing you to go to DVD. All of the movies are mostly old and positively the worst customer service. They are rude, ambivalent, and uncaring. That includes and describes most of the supervisors I talked to as well.

review: Netflix is an absolute rip-off. I signed up at something like $9.95 a month, and without notification they doubled my price. Needless to say, that has ended our relationship. I hope this company goes out of business for its greediness. I will be Redbox's newest customer!

preview: All I have to say is that if Netflix does not put lost back on the instant queue, I am going to cancel my subscription. First you separate the DVD and the instant service so that if I want both I have to pay double. And now you are taking off titles out
review: All I have to say is that if Netflix does not put lost back on the instant queue, I am going to cancel my subscription. First you separate the DVD and the instant service so that if I want both I have to pay double. And now you are taking off titles out of no where after I am a season and a half deep. So, in order for me to finish the series I have to pay double to get the DVDs? I don't think so.

preview: Netflix offered "Lost" the series for instant play. But before I finished watching all the shows, they pulled it from instant play and made it only available with an increased subscription rate on DVD. **! Most subscribers don't need this format anymore.
review: Netflix offered "Lost" the series for instant play. But before I finished watching all the shows, they pulled it from instant play and made it only available with an increased subscription rate on DVD. **! Most subscribers don't need this format anymore. Netflix is greedy, trying to tease us with content to get us to sell up. If they keep this stuff up, I hope they go out of business!

preview: I decided to stay with streaming because I don't watch that much or have time to watch movies. I really did not like Netflix's tactics when they changed their membership without consultation. I never get a chance to watch a series when it airs normally b
review:
I decided to stay with streaming because I don't watch that much or have time to watch movies. I really did not like Netflix's tactics when they changed their membership without consultation. I never get a chance to watch a series when it airs normally because of my schedule. I decided to keep streaming so I could watch a series on my schedule. I started watching Lost all the way to season 3 and they stopped airing all together. I am totally pissed off!
Read full review

preview: At first Netflix was great, I could watch a movie whenever I wanted without waiting or driving anywhere. Then after a while, every movie I tried to look for wasn't there. I understand Netflix doesn't get the new movies right away, but it doesn't have "St
review: At first Netflix was great, I could watch a movie whenever I wanted without waiting or driving anywhere. Then after a while, every movie I tried to look for wasn't there. I understand Netflix doesn't get the new movies right away, but it doesn't have "Star Wars", "The Transporter", "Cube", "Cube 2", "The Professional", "Now and Then", "I am Number 4", "The Help", "The Goonies", "Saw", "Saw 2", "Saw 3", "Saw 4", "Saw 5". Basically I am disappointed in the lack of interesting movies. As my personal consequences, if I don't get a reply via email on why these movies aren't there or when these movies will be available, I will not continue with Netflix and go back to my local movie store. Furthermore I will tell my friends to tell friends about the lack of movies.

preview: I was a member of Netflix for a long time now. I’ve learned that I was over-charged and they made me lose my credit card. I never received my movie that I was being charged for every month. I made a complaint about this and all they said was sorry. I don
review: I was a member of Netflix for a long time now. I’ve learned that I was over-charged and they made me lose my credit card. I never received my movie that I was being charged for every month. I made a complaint about this and all they said was sorry. I don’t think that was fair to me because I am a brain patient.

preview: There is a movie on their website entitled "The Girl Next Door". It is the most disgusting movie in the world, and if it is not off Netflix, I will be forced to take legal actions about it. That kind of movie should not be on the website. Little kids cou
review: There is a movie on their website entitled "The Girl Next Door". It is the most disgusting movie in the world, and if it is not off Netflix, I will be forced to take legal actions about it. That kind of movie should not be on the website. Little kids could see that, and what do you think they are going to think about? That it's okay to do that to anybody?

preview: I got an offer for a 1-month free trial with Netflix, so I joined them on January 20, 2012. The next day I got a charge on my credit card of $7.99. I have called customer service and the representative said that I am not eligible for a free trial because
review: I got an offer for a 1-month free trial with Netflix, so I joined them on January 20, 2012. The next day I got a charge on my credit card of $7.99. I have called customer service and the representative said that I am not eligible for a free trial because I live in the same house of a previous customer. And she confirmed that even I am a new customer, I will not get a free trial. So, I canceled my account on January 21,2012.

preview: Netflix provides a very good service. I was just reading all the people who have complained about Netflix. All of these complaints were the customers’ fault for not keeping up with the amount being charged. This is a subscription service so I can underst
review:
Netflix provides a very good service. I was just reading all the people who have complained about Netflix. All of these complaints were the customers’ fault for not keeping up with the amount being charged. This is a subscription service so I can understand why you cannot come back after 3 months for a refund. Otherwise, everyone will be doing that. The service complaints are all outlined in the terms of service that requires the ability to read. I for one have received a very good service and I do not feel like I have been scammed. They are doing what they agreed to in the terms of service.
Read full review

preview: In August of 2010, I received an email from Netflix for 1 month free trial subscriptions. Thought it was a great idea and went ahead and signed up for it. In September, I went online and stopped the free subscription. In October 2010, I made a call to ma
review:
In August of 2010, I received an email from Netflix for 1 month free trial subscriptions. Thought it was a great idea and went ahead and signed up for it. In September, I went online and stopped the free subscription. In October 2010, I made a call to make sure my account was closed. January 19, 2012, I discovered for the first time that Netflix was charging my checking account for $17.25.
Read full review

preview: Something happened around 4 months ago where I wasn't able to login into Netflix. The only thing that was working was the free trial link that I clicked on. Somehow I registered under an account and still wasn't able to get into Netflix. The problem is I
review:
Something happened around 4 months ago where I wasn't able to login into Netflix. The only thing that was working was the free trial link that I clicked on. Somehow I registered under an account and still wasn't able to get into Netflix. The problem is I have two machines. So one machine has the bogus cookie's stored with the new account.

preview: When Netflix decided to raise their prices and divide their company up, I decided to cancel my account with them as a result. They claimed that I put my account on a vacation hold for 90 days. Well, 63 days later, Netflix reactivates my account without m
review:
When Netflix decided to raise their prices and divide their company up, I decided to cancel my account with them as a result. They claimed that I put my account on a vacation hold for 90 days. Well, 63 days later, Netflix reactivates my account without my permission at the higher rate. After noticing the charges on my credit card for three months, I contacted Netflix and they would only give me credit for one month. Netflix is a scam. Absolutely. Do not give them your credit card number.
Read full review

preview: I received a six-month subscription for Christmas 2011. My husband does not have an email account and when I (wife with an email account) received a renewal notice after six months, I ignored it assuming it would automatically cancel. Wrong. My husband n
review:
I received a six-month subscription for Christmas 2011. My husband does not have an email account and when I (wife with an email account) received a renewal notice after six months, I ignored it assuming it would automatically cancel. Wrong. My husband noticed that they were charging his debit account monthly. When we called to explain that he has not received or ordered movies since his (assumed) cancellation, they could have cared less. I guess this is how they make their money --taking the money of people who don't read the fine print! There was no customer service in this phone call, the operator was matter-of-fact-whatever.
Read full review

preview: Regarding the Holiday Bonus Coupon Netflix sent me, this might seem like a nice gesture with no strings, but Netflix has inadvertently erased the benefit with the small type. It states that "You will then need to return 2 DVDs to receive the next DVD in
review: Regarding the Holiday Bonus Coupon Netflix sent me, this might seem like a nice gesture with no strings, but Netflix has inadvertently erased the benefit with the small type. It states that "You will then need to return 2 DVDs to receive the next DVD in your queue." I had a DVD on the way back when I redeemed the coupon, so they shipped the bonus DVD, they then received my return, and I did not receive another DVD in my queue until the bonus was returned. In essence, it just became the next rental and there was no benefit.

preview: On December 21, my wife and I bought Gift Subscriptions for our family in L.A. and Canada. On January 1, my wife's sister in Canada tried to redeem their code and it failed to work. She called us to complain about the gift not working. My wife contacted
review:
On December 21, my wife and I bought Gift Subscriptions for our family in L.A. and Canada. On January 1, my wife's sister in Canada tried to redeem their code and it failed to work. She called us to complain about the gift not working. My wife contacted Netflix the same night. After numerous conversations and holds, we were told to ask my wife's sister to call in herself, or to sign up for an account and then have us call back to get their code activated.
Read full review

preview: I received an e-mail from Netflix stating I could receive a free movie as a thank you for being a customer. I thought that was nice of them (though I wasn't surprised after a year of scandal) and redeemed the offer. The next movie in my queue moved into
review: I received an e-mail from Netflix stating I could receive a free movie as a thank you for being a customer. I thought that was nice of them (though I wasn't surprised after a year of scandal) and redeemed the offer. The next movie in my queue moved into the "At Home" section. Then, a day later, I got an e-mail stating the movie in question was removed from my "At Home" section and back into my queue. So, I never received a free movie. And to top that off, after checking my queue, the movie wasn't even in it anymore so I had to re-add it. Thanks Netflix. You sure know how to treat your customers.

preview: I have been a loyal customer for about a year now. Recently, this December I found where "Netflix" was charging two of my credit cards. Both accounts had the same name. I called Netflix when I found this and the operator stated that he could clearly see
review:
I have been a loyal customer for about a year now. Recently, this December I found where "Netflix" was charging two of my credit cards. Both accounts had the same name. I called Netflix when I found this and the operator stated that he could clearly see that I had not signed up twice and I would be credited all my money back to my credit card on the account created in July! However, this did not happen, I was only credited for three months of the six months I was billed. I called and asked Netflix why I couldn't have the rest and was told their system would not let them refund that to me. Then I asked if they could give me a free month because they could clearly see it was a fraud account. The guy on the phone today, 12/27/2011, was rude, disrespectful and refused to allow me to speak to a supervisor or someone in a higher position than him. This process is such a bad business practice and how they received both of my credit cards numbers I will never know.
Read full review

preview: I received an email from Netflix stating that I would get a bonus DVD this year--I normally get two at a time--and they claimed that I would get three at once, and they would need to get two back from me before I'm back on the two-at-a-time plan. Yeah? H
review: I received an email from Netflix stating that I would get a bonus DVD this year--I normally get two at a time--and they claimed that I would get three at once, and they would need to get two back from me before I'm back on the two-at-a-time plan. Yeah? Hardly. I clicked "yes, I'd like this," and sure enough, they sent my next disk to me yesterday. Of course, I only had one disk at home, since my other was already in the mail back to them. Today, they got it, and nope, I get no more disks until I mail back my other one.

preview: Netflix is an unethical company. In July of 2010, I was informed that as my credit card was expiring, I should enter my new credit card information to continue the service. As I had stopped using the DVD service in April, I never updated my information,
review:
Netflix is an unethical company. In July of 2010, I was informed that as my credit card was expiring, I should enter my new credit card information to continue the service. As I had stopped using the DVD service in April, I never updated my information, thinking that this would cancel my subscription. Well, I was wrong. Somehow, without my new information, Netflix continued to charge my credit card, even though there had been no activity in my account. After contacting Netflix, they too gave me the runaround, particularly about the escalating charges (the subscription went from $9.99 a month to $21.00 a month, without my permission), which were incurred on a credit card which had expired! They said I had to take it up with my credit card company.
Read full review

preview: On Thursday, 12/15/11, I received email from Netflix about opportunity to receive a bonus DVD rental for the holiday season. I decided to take advantage of the offer but they don't send it right away and they won't send the regular DVD until the bonus on
review: On Thursday, 12/15/11, I received email from Netflix about opportunity to receive a bonus DVD rental for the holiday season. I decided to take advantage of the offer but they don't send it right away and they won't send the regular DVD until the bonus one is returned and it hasn't even been sent yet! I didn’t really get a bonus DVD because they tie up your account by not sending the bonus DVD right away. I could have gotten the regular DVD quicker by just returning the one that I had at home so basically they are giving me less movies for the same time period than I could have normally gotten!

preview: I was scammed and cheated by Netflix. I am a longtime customer. I took advantage of the website's "Account Hold" feature to suspend my service for anywhere from 7 to 90 days for vacation. I activated a hold for 2 weeks in November. I returned my two DVDs
review: I was scammed and cheated by Netflix. I am a longtime customer. I took advantage of the website's "Account Hold" feature to suspend my service for anywhere from 7 to 90 days for vacation. I activated a hold for 2 weeks in November. I returned my two DVDs promptly, as required under threat of financial penalty. Then they continued billing full monthly charges anyway. No adjustment of charges whatsoever.

preview: During the first week of October 2011, I called Netflix to cancel my account. I informed them that I no longer wanted any of their services, because of the way they tried to con their customers with their misleading emails. I was told that both services
review:
During the first week of October 2011, I called Netflix to cancel my account. I informed them that I no longer wanted any of their services, because of the way they tried to con their customers with their misleading emails. I was told that both services had been canceled, and I would no longer be charged. I noticed on my bank statement that, I had been charged $7.99 in November and in December. I called Netflix customer support, and was informed that after I had verbally called and canceled the service, someone had reactivated it by trying to watch a movie online.
Read full review

preview: On December 8, 2011, I signed up for a one-month trial membership with Netflix and received an email specifically stating, "You will not be billed until after your free month ends." Yet less than 48 hours later my bank has been charged $17.57 by Netflix.
review: On December 8, 2011, I signed up for a one-month trial membership with Netflix and received an email specifically stating, "You will not be billed until after your free month ends." Yet less than 48 hours later my bank has been charged $17.57 by Netflix. I called customer service and spoke with "Drew" who said Netflix never charged me but MasterCard did. After a heated exchange, I asked to speak to Drew's supervisor and he told me nobody is available to talk with me. He said he could put me on a call-back list and it may be several hours before I receive a phone call. At this point, I still have not heard from Netflix. I filed a complaint with the Indiana Attorney General. I emailed Netflix's Public Relations Department (Steve ** and Joris **). I contacted MasterCard Fraud Department and I reported the transaction to my bank, Stock Yards.

preview: Thousands of Google searches return "low volume" problems, try to file a complaint with Netflix. It's like being on a merry go round. No answers, no resolutions and no way to submit a complaint with their "automated problem solver." It would seem they wo
review: Thousands of Google searches return "low volume" problems, try to file a complaint with Netflix. It's like being on a merry go round. No answers, no resolutions and no way to submit a complaint with their "automated problem solver." It would seem they would want to resolve such a minor issue that involves so many of their customers.

preview: We've been customers for nearly 5 years, and recently decided to cut back. I changed our service to 1 movie at a time and streaming, and deleted my profile, changing my husband to 'owner'. A month later, somehow, my profile has been recreated and our pro
review: We've been customers for nearly 5 years, and recently decided to cut back. I changed our service to 1 movie at a time and streaming, and deleted my profile, changing my husband to 'owner'. A month later, somehow, my profile has been recreated and our profiles have been all muddled and mixed up, and my husband is no longer supposedly receiving movies. I called and tried to resolve it on the phone (since there is zero help online!), only to be told that there was literally nothing they could do. So I canceled, intending to make a new account under my husband's name/email. Only it won't let me do that either, and I have yet to receive confirmation of canceling on either my, or my husband's email. Netflix used to be great, but apparently they can't be bothered to have a computer system that works, and is even semi-flexible, nor tech support, that is willing or able to do anything at all to help.

preview: I have been very happy with Netflix, and have been with them since they started. As the old saying goes, "if it's too good to be true, it usually is". This summer, I started to receive unplayable DVDs. The last one had to be the ultimate as it had a whol
review:
I have been very happy with Netflix, and have been with them since they started. As the old saying goes, "if it's too good to be true, it usually is". This summer, I started to receive unplayable DVDs. The last one had to be the ultimate as it had a whole chunk (about a third) broken off, and missing from the shipping envelope, so they had to have knowingly shipped it that way. Yes, they sent me a replacement, but later notified me that either it, or the original defective disk had not been returned.
Read full review
